story:
Local Scene will be the best way to discover great local events and local business and make plans for a night out. 

Features of Local Scene:

  • Comprehensive lists of small businesses, local events and venues
  • Zero up front cost deals and daily specials by businesses
  • Loyalty rewards for promoting, reviewing and shopping at local businesses
  • Ability to follow your favorite businesses and get automatic updates when they create deals or events
  • Ability to add events to your LS calendar and personal calendar
  • Ability to create private events and plan activities with your friends with simple push notifications
  • Short reviews based on business characteristics rather than an arbitrary number
  • Aggregation of different business reviews
  • Online reservations and ticket sales with participating businesses

 

Why make Local Scene

My name is Seth Reynolds and I founded Local Scene for two main reasons.  First, I have moved around a bit and noticed that there are not any good websites to help an individual get integrated into their community.  Hopefully you have a friend who can help you get your bearings, but I feel with the power of the internet we can do much better. Second, I am a big proponent of shopping locally.  Local businesses tend to be much more concerned with sustainable business practices.  Also, shopping at local businesses greatly helps local economies by keeping the money spent in the local economy.  Typically the greatest challenge for small business is getting sufficient exposure.  As the internet is the great democatizer we can use it to make it easy for people to connect with local business.  Local Scene will solve both of these issues.

Why get funding on Indiegogo

Local Scene is attempting to raise $40,000 to pay for hosting costs, data entry, and feature development.  Our choice to seek funding through Indiegogo was deliberate.  The primary purpose of Local Scene is to highlight local businesses and events so we do not want to need ad revenue from large corporations.  Our goal is to create a website to give voice to the "shop locally" grassroots movement and so we are asking for your help in ensuring this project has the finances to stay true to this vision.

All funding we receive will go to supporting the website and moblie apps developed by Local Scene.  If we do not reach our full goal we may have to scrap a few proposed functions such as the social clubs portion of the site or a moblie app, but we we should be able to accomplish the core goals.  However, if we manage to raise more then our goal we may be able to implement even more advanced feature or expand the geographic reach of the site sooner.  Because of the nature of the project, we can scale up or down to ensure all of the money donated is used to advance Local Scene and its goals.

The perks we will provide to our donors fall into two categories. First, we will send out T-Shirts or Hoodies so you can show your solidarity with the goals of the site.  Second, we will give membership perks to small businesses for those who are willing to contribute large amounts.  But you do not have to own a small business to receive this perk, you can give it to your favorite local business.  Thus your contribution can both support the cause Local Scene is championing and help support your favorite small business.

The Value of Local Scene

Everybody wants to have somewhere to go, something to do and someone to see.  Local Scene aims to ensure that is always true.  We want to use the internet to reinvigorate the lifeblood of communities.  The way to do this is making it easy for someone to figure out what to do, whether their interest is as basic as "I want Japanese food" or as specific as "I want a divey, Chicago style pizza joint which uses locally sourced ingredients".  But it should encompass enough to enable people to find activities as diverse as attending a Turkish cultural festival or listening to an indie bluegrass garage band.

But besides making it easy for people to find things to do, this site will help the local business community.  Supporting the local business community is the best way to improve our communities. First, it keeps money local.  This allows business owners to hire more local workers and make improvements to their business.  Also, local business are more inclinded to invest in the community by sponsoring clubs and schools.  Plus supporting local businesses allows a community to develop a richer and more diverse community rather than simply having the monolithic big box stores and chains.

Supporting Your Local Scene

The most important way an individual can support our project is by supporting their local community by attending events and shopping locally.  But we would also hope that you tell your friends about this project.  Please share this project on Facebook, Twitter and Pinterest.  Also, please sign up for our mailing list on www.localscene.net so we can give you updates even after this campaign finishes.  We hope to engage with everyone who is passionate about improving their local community, not just those who can afford to sponsor the development.  Finally, please visit our site frequently.  Although we cannot effectively hold physical rallies, web traffic can just as effectively communicate solidarity.

Thank you everyone for anything you do to help.

story:
Gi en nyttig julegave til barnehjemsbarn i Norge

Gladiator er en sosial entreprenør som arbeider for at alle barn skal oppleve mestringsfølelse sammen med andre og at ingen skal føle seg utenfor. I år vil vi gi barn ved norske barnevernsinstitusjoner en julegave som varer; læring gjennom glede og samspill hele året.

 

For å realisere prosjektet trenger vi

Vi synes alle 100 barnevernsinstitusjoner i Norge fortjener å få et Aball1 sett til jul. Derfor oppfordrer vi privatpersoner og bedrifter til å støtte opp og samarbeide med oss etter beste evne. For hver blå ball som kjøpes av dere, byr vi på en rød ball! I hvert sett er det 50 baller - så LA BALLEN RULLE.

 

Hva er Aball1?

Aball1 kombinerer sosial trening med motiverende læring gjennom bruk av baller i lek. Barnevernsinstitusjonen får tilgang til hundrevis av varierte og morsomme aktiviteter.

story:
Ubuntu Edge

Have you heard of the ubuntu edge? Have you seen the breath-taking presentation by Mark Shuttleworth? You probably have! If not then have a look!
http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_emb...
 
And all you want to do is hold the device in your hands right now, don't you? Well, that's exactly the same thing I want to do!

I decided to be pro-active. I have no funds to become a backer of this project. But, since this is a crowd-funding platform, I decided to start a campaign to support me on getting this device. That's probably a crazy idea, but who knows! 
 

The Perks

Becoming a backer of this project will help me to support the Ubuntu Edge and hopefully get it all the way to it's goal of $32m, It's a HUGE goal but Open Source has always surprised me at it's huge community influence and support that those involved have for one another and their respective projects.

Inlcuded with all perks of $10 and up I will write you a personal thank you note from the bottom of my heart! I truly appreciate all the support that anyone can show even if they don't have money to support, a nice comment will still warm the hearts of all those that see it!

all $100 + perks will get an AWESOME drawing (I'd do it myself but I suck at drawing but I can definately beg one of my friends to do it for me!!) of anything they want really, wether it's a pet or a name or anything really!! (Well, maybe not ANYTHING but you kinda get the point right?)

If you pledge $400 or MORE I will make a youtube video WITH the Ubuntu Edge once it arrives specifically for you to say thank you for your support or if you don't want a video all to yourself then i can give you a shoutout in one of my other videos for all your AWESOMNESS!!!

The Impact

By supporting this campaign you allow me to place an order for the Ubuntu Edge, to become one of the backers. This will increase YOUR chance to get YOUR device by about 0,0025 percent. Not so bad for just $10 extra, right?

Once my campaign reaches it's goal, which is $860 for Ubuntu Edge device and for the shipping costs, I will contribute to this campaign.

Everything I promise is to use the device proudly, showing the power of crowd-funding, showing the power of ubuntu. showing the power of the community.

Thank you.

story:
THANK YOU FOR VISITING, HOWEVER, THIS CAMPAIGN HAS COMPLETED AND WE ARE NO LONGER ACCEPTING CONTRIBUTIONS.  We'd like to thank everyone for their wonderful support throughout our campaign.  Feel free to look around here, then visit our site at www.Gabberz.com.

 

 

Gabberz mission is to help children from all walks of life develop a powerful voice to influence the future of their world. Our self-paced public speaking coaching program helps build confidence and leadership skills in children , enabling a new generation of doers... of builders... of leaders who will mold a bright, positive, and productive future.

 

Gabberz is a multi-level, activity-based coaching program provided through a detailed and kid-friendly activity-based guidebook and supplementary materials that lead kids through the building blocks needed to gain the confidence to express themselves in any situation.

Starting with a simple speech we provide, the student delivers an easy-to-read presentation in front of his or her immediate family. Then the program builds foundational skills through fun, exciting, and surprising exercises that escalate as the student builds experience, confidence, and the skills to deliver more complicated speeches to progressively larger audiences (building at the student's own pace and comfort level).

As the student progresses through the program and gains confidence, the levels become much more rigorous and adventurous. See the sections below on "how" Gabberz works and "why" kids need the program.

Why do I need your help? Your contributions will help me provide the program to kids from challenging and limited backgrounds. These kids are the ones who need most to feel like they are making a positive impact on their world.

For example, I've very recently begun working with the dedicated and wonderful folks at a private school in one of the poorest counties in the nation where opportunities for these children are nearly non-existent. The heart-breaking stories of what these kids endure on a daily basis is beyond what most of us could even imagine. I've offered to develop, produce, and deliver a coaching program specifically for their kids at zero cost to them. This is in addition to my focus on single-student programs.

 

Imagine if, in every aspect of a person's life (school, college, career, courting, family, etc.), they not only had the confidence to speak up and express themselves, but had an INNER DRIVE to seek out opportunities to speak.

Imagine if they could walk up to anyone, anytime, anywhere, and talk confidently with them. Imagine them looking forward excitedly to that job interview, giving that speech in school, being the center of conversation in social situations, or just standing up confidently and expressing their ideas at a business meeting.

Many kids and adults are absolutely terrified of those exact things and are held back in life because of it. Jerry Seinfeld famously once said something along the lines of, "according to polls, most people at a funeral would rather be in the coffin than giving the eulogy." I don't know how true that is, but the Fear of Public Speaking tops fear of death in many polls.

The fear and terror of speaking (whether to 1 person or to 100) is a real and debilitating phobia that holds people back, stunts their careers, and results in awkward social situations that limit their prospects and feed their fears even further. But, this is a learned phobia and it doesn't need to be that way for anyone.

Imagine if our children were to learn the joy of public speaking at an early age, before the fear could possibly develop... Imagine where they could go in life. Imagine what they could do.

 

I like to compare Gabberz to learning to ride a bike as a kid. At first, you're scared. You don't know what's going to happen. You don't know if you're going to fall and get hurt. Are people going to laugh at you? Ridicule you?

So, you try "just a little". Just enough that you won't get hurt if you fall. Your family is there to encourage and guide you. But you're still scared. Tentative.

After a few wobbly tries, you begin to feel like maybe, just maybe, this is something you could do if you kept at it. So you keep trying. Slow. Wobbly. Unsure. But in the back of your mind you start to realize that this could be fun.

After a while, you take the training wheels off. Maybe you try pavement instead of grass. Work your way up slowly, at your own pace, still concerned about getting hurt. But then... once, finally, you get up enough speed to feel the wind in your face.

From that point on, you're hooked. You push a little harder, looking for a little more wind, starting to gain a little confidence. Beginning to understand that, not only is this something you can do, but it's something you "want" to do.

That's Gabberz in a nutshell. THE WIND IN YOUR FACE!

Just like learning to ride a bike, or swim, or do algebra, comfort comes from familiarity. Gabberz starts out very simply and safely with the goal of just getting the student up in front of their immediate family and doing simple foundational things.

Each lesson is designed to build on the previous ones using fun and interactive methodologies that are entertaining for both the student and their audience. There are many different types of lessons and the student's goal (in addition to continued acclimatization to speaking in front of others) is to learn that even the most boring topic can be brought to life by an animated speaker who is having fun.

And that is only one, tiny part of the puzzle we use to help the student build a foundation of confidence and skill. Using many tiny steps like these, we build on that confidence and keep stretching and challenging the students. Our goal in every lesson is to make it fun and positive so that the student will begin seeking out reasons to speak in front of others.

Imagine the advantage this training and skill will provide these kids in college, career, and life!

Note that you can contribute any amount from $1 on up, not just what's listed to the right (all contributions will give you access to "Supporters Only" updates and inside information). You can also request that we not provide you any of the perks you earned.

A Little Different

We're a little different than many campaigns on Indiegogo in that our perks aren't really about providing contributors with super nifty gadgets like a secret decoder watch that plays videos while automatically organizing your life and polishing your shoes. We do have a few cool things like the shirts, copies of the coaching program, actual coaching, and other simple rewards to thank you.

However, every dollar we spend on our wonderful supporters is a dollar that we can't spend on reaching out to help these kids. They are the ones who get the real rewards and will benefit from this program when you support us. We hope you'll believe in the importance of this as much as we do and contribute as much as you can.

Please help us complete the program and bring confidence to these kids to give them the power to create an awesome world for themselves. Your support is greatly appreciated! You can also help by spreading the word far and wide to help us reach as many supporters as possible. Please use the simple link, www.GoToGab.com.

Please consider supporting our mission and helping us give these kids a voice!

Thanks!

David Nemzoff
President, Gabberz, Inc.

 

Gabberz® and “Public Speaking for Kids, Confidence for Life”™ are Registered Trademarks of Gabberz, Inc. and all rights are reserved.

story:
4 Friends on a Mission

Thank you for visiting this page! This is our first time organizing a fundraiser, it is a very meaningful and personal project, and we hope you can help out. Here is our story:

Our friend Javi has invited us to go with him to the Solomon Islands for 3 months. Javi has been going to the Solomon Islands for the past 2 summers helping them with everything from teaching the locals how to screen print T shirts to sell in the markets, organizing tournaments and getting uniforms for their soccer teams, to raising money for water tanks and solar panels for the village. This year, besides continuing with what he has left off from last year, one of our biggest goals is to travel up north to Fo'ondo and get a water tank (possibly toilets?) for their village. 

Fo'ondo is a place with a very small population. It is north of Malaita, in the country of Solomon Islands. Fo'ondo is so remote that if you try to Google "Fo'ondo" pretty much all that comes up is their weather report. As you can imagine, life on Fo'ondo is very basic, no running water or electricity, no toilets, and what is internet? They have very little resources, it would really help them a lot to be able to store rain water close to the village. 



- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
Javi's stories has inspired us to do our part, check out videos from Javi's past 2 trips to get a better idea of life on the Solomon Islands (sorry it's mostly in Spanish as Javi is a Spaniard).


Water tank


Screen printing class


Lavalava competition


Goalpost for the soccer team | New uniforms for the soccer team

What We Need

To get a water tank is actually a bit complicated due to the fact that they are on an island. First, the tank needs to be transported from Honiara (the capital of the Solomons Islands, situated at the island of Guadalcanal). Next, in order to level and secure the tank, we will need to build a small cement platform. These building materials will travel from Malaita island to Fo’ondo. Finally we will need pipes, plumbing and men power to complete the installation of the water tank, which means salary for the local workers. With more money we can even build a toilet or latrine! Can you imagine how amazing it would be to be able to go from a hole in the ground to new toilets? Stored water for dry seasons, and bonus toilets for a healthier condition, we are counting on you!

The Impact

Imagine having water, whenever you want. I know, you're thinking, but that's what I have already. Exactly! Now these people that we are trying to help, they don't have the luxury of stored water, not to mention running water. By getting them a water tank, it will make their lives so much easier. With your generous donations, they too will be able to have water within reach, whenever they want. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Word of mouth is always a big help. Spread the word, tell your friends, tell your family, tell everyone around you to give the gift of water. After all, we are made of 72% water, don't underestimate the power of water. Again, thank you so much for your contribution, and for making a huge difference in people's lives.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

While our focus will be on the water tank, we would love to be able to help the community in other ways as well. If we raise over our goal of $3,200, any remaining funds will be used for purchasing supplies for the screen printing workshops, uniforms and soccer balls for the soccer club and the local school team.
story_txt:
4 Friends on a Mission
Thank you for visiting this page! This is our first time organizing a fundraiser, it is a very meaningful and personal project, and we hope you can help out. Here is our story:
Our friend Javi has invited us to go with him to the Solomon Islands for 3 months. Javi has been going to the Solomon Islands for the past 2 summers helping them with everything from teaching the locals how to screen print T shirts to sell in the markets, organizing tournaments and getting uniforms for their soccer teams, to raising money for water tanks and solar panels for the village. This year, besides continuing with what he has left off from last year, one of our biggest goals is to travel up north to Fo'ondo and get a water tank (possibly toilets?) for their village. 
Fo'ondo is a place with a very small population. It is north of Malaita, in the country of Solomon Islands. Fo'ondo is so remote that if you try to Google "Fo'ondo" pretty much all that comes up is their weather report. As you can imagine, life on Fo'ondo is very basic, no running water or electricity, no toilets, and what is internet? They have very little resources, it would really help them a lot to be able to store rain water close to the village. 










- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -Javi's stories has inspired us to do our part, check out videos from Javi's past 2 trips to get a better idea of life on the Solomon Islands (sorry it's mostly in Spanish as Javi is a Spaniard).
Water tank
Screen printing class


Lavalava competition

Goalpost for the soccer team | New uniforms for the soccer team
















What We Need

To get a water tank is actually a bit complicated due to the fact that they are on an island. First, the tank needs to be transported from Honiara (the capital of the Solomons Islands, situated at the island of Guadalcanal). Next, in order to level and secure the tank, we will need to build a small cement platform. These building materials will travel from Malaita island to Fo’ondo. Finally we will need pipes, plumbing and men power to complete the installation of the water tank, which means salary for the local workers. With more money we can even build a toilet or latrine! Can you imagine how amazing it would be to be able to go from a hole in the ground to new toilets? Stored water for dry seasons, and bonus toilets for a healthier condition, we are counting on you!
The Impact

Imagine having water, whenever you want. I know, you're thinking, but that's what I have already. Exactly! Now these people that we are trying to help, they don't have the luxury of stored water, not to mention running water. By getting them a water tank, it will make their lives so much easier. With your generous donations, they too will be able to have water within reach, whenever they want. Other Ways You Can Help
Word of mouth is always a big help. Spread the word, tell your friends, tell your family, tell everyone around you to give the gift of water. After all, we are made of 72% water, don't underestimate the power of water. Again, thank you so much for your contribution, and for making a huge difference in people's lives.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
While our focus will be on the water tank, we would love to be able to help the community in other ways as well. If we raise over our goal of $3,200, any remaining funds will be used for purchasing supplies for the screen printing workshops, uniforms and soccer balls for the soccer club and the local school team.

story:
Hello!

My name is Monti Panzica and along with my wife, Angela, we opened Red Mosquito Raceway in November of 2012. Red Mosquito Raceway (RMR) is an indoor carpet racing track for radio control cars. It is located just outside of Cincinnati, Ohio in the small town of Bativa.

I have been racing remote control (r/c) cars for over 20 year. I even work inside the r/c racing world as a leading producer of r/c racing tires. Needless to say, r/c racing is my life, hobby, and passion (beside Angela!). I enjoy r/c racing because it brings people and families together for friendly competition. Remote control racing is open to everyone regardless of age, experience, and income. If you enjoy competition and have a thirst for fun and excitement r/c racing is for you!

Over the past 8 months, Angela and I have spent time, money, and countless hours bringing my dream of owning my own track to reality. The track has brought together a community of racers, but we still need some additional help to better serve the patrons of the track.

To make this dream a full success, I need additional funding for various projects.  

What we need

I have a few things that I want to improve for this upcoming 2013/2014 racing season.

  1. Remove/fix the bump in the floor on the far end of the track in the oval racing line
  2. Add better and more stylish on road barriers to the track
  3. Add some color and paint to the facility
  4. Add a beta bright to the scoring system

These are the four most important things I want to accomplish to the track area and racing surface. The funds I receive will go towards these projects.

The Impact

I feel a racing facility that others can enjoy, and feel they are a part of, is a great way to get other people interested in racing as well. I will continue to promote and attract racing to RMR but in the end, it's up to everyone to help out and spread the word: Red Mosquito Raceway is the best place to race in the Tri-state.

Other Ways You Can Help

Another way to help the success of the track would be to spread the word. Tell people about RMR and what a great place it is to race. Tell them about your hobby, the indiegogo project, and what fun it is to race r/c cars.

Lastly, we appreciate your time and generosity.

 

Thank you,

Monti and Angela

story:
Picture This...

Picture This... You wake up, look in the mirror and realize you are in need of some attention from a barber. You head down to the barbershop where you notice that everyone working looks as though they have stepped back in time. There is no over abundance of items hanging on the walls and the atmosphere is distinct with a classic, clean appearance with a comfortable vibe. You are greeted with a handshake and a welcome to the shop. You sit down in a chair to wait and watch the barbers in the shop do their thing while the soulful Billy Holiday plays quietly in the background. The shop keep offers you a beverage to nurse while you wait and eventually finish off during your appointment. You engage in a friendly conversation when your beverage arrives and notice that the track has changed to Witchcraft by Frank Sinatra. A gentleman approaches, introduces himself with a handshake and invites you over to the chair. You sit down, tell the barber what you need done and he instantly goes to work while keeping the conversation engaging and between friends. A few minutes go by and Hound Dog by Elvis has now come on. You are at the bottom of your beverage, your hair is done, styled and you smell good. The gentleman walks you over to the counter and finishes the appointment off with a handshake while the shop keep takes payment which is well below $20 for your new look. You are invited back and offered a customer appreciation card which will ensure that after a few visits, your cut will be on the house. On your way out you take notice of the product on the shelving. Turning around, you pick some up to keep you looking good until your next visit. As Rockaway Beach by The Ramones comes on the radio you notice the signage on the counter showcasing the on-site and in-shop wedding services. You ask about the details as you are part of a wedding party in a few months. A barber will actually travel to your location and provide haircuts for the grooms party and company or you have the option of booking the shop after hours to come in and enjoy the whole experience of being inside the barbershop itself. As you step out of the shop Get Rhythm by Johnny Cash comes on the radio and another sign catches your eye offering free barbering services to men who are currently down on their luck and are out of work. Exiting the shop to finish off your day you realize you have a few extra dollars in your pocket and are feeling satisfied from the top notch customer service you just received in a relaxing, welcoming, and comfortable environment.

Now that you know

This campaign is to help me reach my goal of opening Sailor Bup's Barbershop, a throwback barbershop offering men's traditional barbering services at an attractive price point and keeping the men of Halifax looking good while offering an inviting environment. In addition to traditional services, Sailor Bup's will also be offering a community outreach program to unemployed men getting back into the work force, themed events in the shop, onsite wedding cuts for the groom and groomsmen as well as much more along the path and progression of this venture.  Keep reading for more information - I hope to see you on opening week with your free cut coupons in hand.

Where Your Money Goes & Return For You

My goal is very small as the majority of this project has been funded out of my own pocket. $5000 is the goal for this campaign. That's it! The money will be entirely allocated to cover startup costs. As I am a devoted supporter of local business, the money will be given to local designers, web developers, photographers/videographers, printers, et cetera.  Not a penny of this money will go toward a large corporation or non-local business, where possible. As a way to keep local small business successful, the concept of keeping money out of the banks and in return offering product and services to the customer is front of mind in this venture. The purchase of any perk will offer you significant value in both product and service. 

Shipping is available all across Canada. You will be prompted to throw in your address so I can get everything to you with an estimated delivery of December 1st.

*Logo designed by Jane Tooker - independent designer

The End Result

As a contributor, you are both helping to build something great for the community in Halifax and taking a charitable step to help unemployed men build confidence when trying to get back into the workforce through our outreach program. Please remember that this is not a way of asking you to give your hard-earned money for no return. You receive a significant amount of value in each reward level as well as a personalized thank you hanging in the shop that will greet you every time you come in. 

Can't Donate?

Completely understood. Maybe someone you know would like to take advantage of this start-up offer. Please share this campaign! Get the word out, and just by doing that you will have contributed to the success of this project.

story:
Hello everyone! We need your help and we need it now. There is a terrible injustice being perpetrated against two very good people here in our community, both of whom have served our church and the wider community faithfully for over ten years.

What's Going On

Two years ago, in 2010, our bishop, the Most Rev. Stephen J. Enea, in anticipation of receiving a large pledged donation, authorized the commencement of the restoration of our cathedral church. Work began on the foundation and repointing of the exterior of the building. The total cost of the work done to date is $450,000. Due to unforeseen circumstances, the donation was not given and the church could not pay the bills. As a result, several of the contractors got angry but rather than suing the diocese in civil court proceedings, they filed criminal charges against our bishop, the Most Rev. Stephen J. Enea and Philip G. Barker, Jr., the dioceses’ chief operating officer.

In August of this year, Archbishop Stephen and Mr. Barker were indicted, arrested and charged with several counts of Grand Larceny and a charge of
Scheme to Defraud. Both the Archbishop and Mr. Barker are set to be tried on
December 2nd.

The claim by the District Attorney is that there was never any intent to pay the bills,
even though the church was paying one of the subcontractors of one of the
complainants for months before the complaint was filed with the DA. In addition,
there were several public efforts (for example, our annual parish festival
which is intended to raise funds for the restoration of the church) made to
raise funds to pay the bills. Last month, through the generosity of a supporter of the Church, two of the bills, totaling approximately $15,000 have been paid were paid but the judge has refused to drop those two charges.

What is being done here is the result of an act of hate and vengeance on the part of the contractors involved. From the very beginning, this should have been a civil
case and not a criminal case. No one denies the right of creditors to sue for
money they are owed but to inflict criminal charges and the way it has all been
done smacks of religious persecution and an effort to discredit and destroy the bishop and the Church. We also believe this is an effort on the part of the District Attorney
to make a name for himself by supposedly protecting the public from another allegedly "bad priest".

The District Attorney’s involvement in this matter and the way in which the entire matter is being handled has done far more damage to the church and our community than what has been done to the creditors. The complainants, with the willing help of the District Attorney, are intent upon destroying our Archbishop, administrator and our
Church. They are driving people away from the Church. Further, the judge in charge of the case has prohibited the archbishop from performing his priestly ministry by forbidding him to travel outside the area thus violating his right to religious freedom. This means he cannot serve Divine Liturgy in other communities, visit the sick, bury the dead, etc. Because of some of the negative publicity, which, because it involves a priest, has furthered already problematic anti-clerical sentiments. Because of this, the bishop has received hate mail because of one of the articles that has appeared in
the local newspaper and the coverage on local television stations.

Our intent by this fundraising campaign is first and foremost to raise the money
needed to pay off all the remaining restoration bills and second, to create an
awareness of the injustice which is being done to our bishop, Mr. Barker and
our faith community and of the fact that there is an active effort to discredit Christianity and the Church in society today.

We are a small Orthodox Catholic community and we need your help. Since this all
began in August, we have lost so much and stand to lose even more if we don’t
stop this assault now. We are asking all Christians and people of good-will to
help us now.

Our church is by no means affluent. It is in one of the poorer sections of Utica.
It has been without heat and electricity for many years now but we have continued
to worship in it, even in the coldest months of the winter and oftentimes with temporary electricity provided by a gas generator. Yet, in our own poverty, we have
faithfully and joyfully ministered to those of our brothers and sisters in
need. We have never gone outside our community to seek help for ourselves or
our own needs but now we find it necessary to reach out to the wider community
so that we can continue to help others and two of our own whom we cannot help
by ourselves.

What Needs to Be Done

We need to raise all the money by November 22th. This will allow the defense attorneys to negotiate a settlement and favorable disposition of the case in advance of the start of the trial and to obtain a favorable resolution to the matter.

How Donations will be Used

All the money raised will be placed in an escrow account with a local attorney
selected by the archbishop’s defense counsel. All monies raised will be used
only to pay the restoration bills. If we cannot obtain a favorable disposition
of the case before trial, all monies raised will be returned to every donor.

Those wishing to donate larger amounts are free to speak directly with either one of
the defense counsels appointed by the court to represent the Archbishop and Mr.
Barker. For contact information for the defense counsels, please email chancery@igoarch.org

How You Can Help

Your donation, no matter how small, will help us end this injustice, bring healing
and peace to our community, and save our bishop, our administrator and our
Church. Both individuals are facing up to 15 years in prison for something they
did not do. Neither the bishop nor Mr. Barker have been accused of taking any
money for themselves personally and both have provided their services to the
Church without compensation. What is being done to them is an absolute wrong.

You can help by making a donation yourself and by getting the message out about
this effort to your friends. Get it out by Twitter and Facebook. Whatever you
can do to help will be greatly appreciated.

If they take our bishop away from us, our Church will cease to exist as there will
be no pastoral leadership to take his place. We just cannot lose our bishop or
Mr. Barker, both of whom have served the Church faithfully for over ten years.

The video above gives you a glimpse of what our bishop and our community does. Won’t you help us stop the persecution and injustice and continue the good work? Please help us in any way you can! Thank you and God bless you for your kindness and support.

story:
My name is Karl Jackson;

 I am a disabled stay-at-home father to my two beautiful daughters, a hobbyist mead (honey wine) maker looking to go professional, and am looking to start keeping my own bees to produce the honey needed.

The aim of this campaign is to help cover the costs of buying hives, bees, and the equipment needed to maintain the hives.  I want to establish an apiary before pushing to go professional with the meadery.

This is important to me because at the moment I live on disability, and am looking to break out of it. I want to provide a better life for my family, despite living with a handicap, and I feel beekeeping would be a step in the right direction.

My Story:

I was hit by a car at the age of 12 and left for dead. I suffered massive head trauma, as well as allergic reactions to penicillin, this caused me to have a stroke. While giving me a cat scan to figure out what happened, I had an allergic reaction to the dye used, and suffered a heart attack. They brought me back, got me stabilized, and induced me into a coma. I spent a month and a half in this coma. When I awoke I had lost the use of the left hand side of my body (due to the stroke).

I spent the better part of 2 years being labeled a cripple in school, struggling to learn to walk again, and believing I was nothing more than a worthless handicap.

Now almost 20 years later, I have learned to walk again, and seek to make something more of my life, through the keeping of bees, and the production of mead.

 Originally our thought to get this started was that we were going to need a farm of our own, however one of the local farmers has volunteered his 75 acre farm for us to put hives on. So the cost comes down to the hives, the bees, and the basic equipment.

I estimate that we need roughly $2000 to truly get this project off the ground. My father has volunteered to build the hives for me in his woodshop at a cost of only $200 per hive to me. This is a third of the going market rate for similar hives. I am thinking that 6 hives will be a good start. Six hives means that I will need 6 separate packages of bees, which run roughly $100 each. And of course I will need the basic equipment for keeping the bees (veil, smoker, etc…), which runs about $200.

  • $1,200-6 Hives
  • $600-Bees
  • $200-Basic Equipment

 

What You Get

Ok since bees are what we seek we will label are perks after the different classes of bees 

$5- For a $5 contribution we will send you a Thank You card signed by everyone in the family

$10- Give a $10 contribution and we will send a Thank You card and a photo of me with my new hives

$25- For a $25 contribution you will get in addition to the Thank You card and photo, 2 handmade beeswax candles

$50-  All those that give a $50 contribution will receive the signed Thank You card, the photo and 5 handmade beeswax candles

$100- Contributors giving $100 will get the thank you card, photo, and 10 beeswax candles

$250- Anyone contributing $250 will get the thank you card, the photo of me with my hives, 10 handmade candles, and when I pick up the bees in May I will send you a close-up photo of one of our new queens

$500- Big contributors offering $500 will receive a video Thank You in their email in addition to  the photos and 10 handmade candles.

$1,000- Contributors will get an email Thank You video, framed photo of me with my new hives, 10 handmade beeswax candles, and two framed up close photos of two of our new queens  when they arrive in May

http://www.facebook.com/pages/Twists-and-Turns/210554265641615. 

If I should fail to miss my target of $2000 I will simply cut back on the number of hives and queens that I start with.

Without bees to pollinate our food, mankind as a whole would lose 70% of its food supply! So by helping me get started on the road to beekeeping you are helping the whole human race. This is my first project of this nature, however I am a stick to it kind of guy who never backs down from his goals.

If you cannot contribute money but want to help, then please feel free to share my story and help me get other people excited. Remember that Indiegogo has many share tools at your disposal.
story_txt:
My name is Karl Jackson;
 I am a disabled stay-at-home father to my two beautiful daughters, a hobbyist mead (honey wine) maker looking to go professional, and am looking to start keeping my own bees to produce the honey needed.
The aim of this campaign is to help cover the costs of buying hives, bees, and the equipment needed to maintain the hives.  I want to establish an apiary before pushing to go professional with the meadery.
This is important to me because at the moment I live on disability, and am looking to break out of it. I want to provide a better life for my family, despite living with a handicap, and I feel beekeeping would be a step in the right direction.
My Story:
I was hit by a car at the age of 12 and left for dead. I suffered massive head trauma, as well as allergic reactions to penicillin, this caused me to have a stroke. While giving me a cat scan to figure out what happened, I had an allergic reaction to the dye used, and suffered a heart attack. They brought me back, got me stabilized, and induced me into a coma. I spent a month and a half in this coma. When I awoke I had lost the use of the left hand side of my body (due to the stroke).
I spent the better part of 2 years being labeled a cripple in school, struggling to learn to walk again, and believing I was nothing more than a worthless handicap.
Now almost 20 years later, I have learned to walk again, and seek to make something more of my life, through the keeping of bees, and the production of mead.
 Originally our thought to get this started was that we were going to need a farm of our own, however one of the local farmers has volunteered his 75 acre farm for us to put hives on. So the cost comes down to the hives, the bees, and the basic equipment.
I estimate that we need roughly $2000 to truly get this project off the ground. My father has volunteered to build the hives for me in his woodshop at a cost of only $200 per hive to me. This is a third of the going market rate for similar hives. I am thinking that 6 hives will be a good start. Six hives means that I will need 6 separate packages of bees, which run roughly $100 each. And of course I will need the basic equipment for keeping the bees (veil, smoker, etc…), which runs about $200.

$600-Bees
$200-Basic Equipment

Ok since bees are what we seek we will label are perks after the different classes of bees 
$5- For a $5 contribution we will send you a Thank You card signed by everyone in the family
$10- Give a $10 contribution and we will send a Thank You card and a photo of me with my new hives
$25- For a $25 contribution you will get in addition to the Thank You card and photo, 2 handmade beeswax candles
$50-  All those that give a $50 contribution will receive the signed Thank You card, the photo and 5 handmade beeswax candles
$100- Contributors giving $100 will get the thank you card, photo, and 10 beeswax candles
$250- Anyone contributing $250 will get the thank you card, the photo of me with my hives, 10 handmade candles, and when I pick up the bees in May I will send you a close-up photo of one of our new queens
$500- Big contributors offering $500 will receive a video Thank You in their email in addition to  the photos and 10 handmade candles.
$1,000- Contributors will get an email Thank You video, framed photo of me with my new hives, 10 handmade beeswax candles, and two framed up close photos of two of our new queens  when they arrive in May
http://www.facebook.com/pages/Twists-and-Turns/210554265641615. 
If I should fail to miss my target of $2000 I will simply cut back on the number of hives and queens that I start with.
Without bees to pollinate our food, mankind as a whole would lose 70% of its food supply! So by helping me get started on the road to beekeeping you are helping the whole human race. This is my first project of this nature, however I am a stick to it kind of guy who never backs down from his goals.
If you cannot contribute money but want to help, then please feel free to share my story and help me get other people excited. Remember that Indiegogo has many share tools at your disposal.

story:
Beads of Hope. 

 

What is the definition of Hope?

A desire of somthing good accompanied with the expection of obtaining it.

Hopelessness? Depairing of ever obtaining anything good.

To live without any hope of having a different future for your own situation is one thing, but to live without hope for any change in your situation for your children is another thing

Child headed households, Grandmothers spending their social grants to feed up to 10 children every month are common realities in rural South Africa.

How would most people survive if they had no hope for a better future?

Please take the time to read our story.

Be an Angel, buy an Angel, feed an Angel.

A 14 year girl named Abigail, had a son named Lucky. At 3 months old he got sick with vomiting and diarrheoa, she took him to the local clinic and was told that they had no medicine for babies and that she must go. Desperate this young mother, a child herself, managed to beg people to get enough money together  to try and get  to her mother in Johannesburg, however when she got as far as Pretoria somebody pointed out to her that she was was carrying her dead baby. Can you imagine the horror of this for a 14 year old girl

In the rural areas, there is little opportunity for employment, functi!onal illiteracy rates are extremely high and HIV/AIDs is rife. Family's are seperated normally due to, mainly the fathers, leaving to find work in the large cities, the need for education and income inititiatives is huge.

Then came a "vision" around the words "Be an Angel, buy an Angel, feed an Angel". Seeing a woman in a darkened hut, dressed in rags, her children holding empty plates, a tear running down her face, and then in the corner   could see people buying beaded angels, and as each angel was purchased so the picture changed, from darkness to light, food on the plates, new clothing a smile replace the tear.
 
Our Goal? The Beaded Angel to become an International symbol of poverty alleviation.One million Angels by November 2013, and increasing every year thereafter.
Why: Change the destiny of at least 1000 families
 
We need at least $50 000 To provide the material and costs to have a starting stock of 10000 Angels which will allow mothers to buy food and send their children to school, to buy a couple of sewing machines, to set up a creche and training facility in one area, to get early learning material in own language for at least 50 children. To buy wheelbarrows and other gardening equipment to start a garden and feeding program at the creche. At least 3 months supply of bead stock This will give work to 100 people for 4 months and give us the seed stock to go global, further training, transport and computers are required.
 
Your contribution could help change the destiny of  young girls, from prostituition, to going to school and a future filled with opportunities. From hopeless to  hopeful. Un-educated to educated.
Want to know how it feels to be an Angel?  Simple! Help another human being.

story:
Our Story

On May 18, we will hold the 5th and final Marines Helping Marines Fishing Tournament at the Anchor Marina in North East, Maryland. Each year we strive to provide a fun-filled weekend for approximately 20 or more severely wounded warriors and their families.

Veterans are paired up with professional anglers who will teach them the ropes of bass fishing. Together the two will perform as a team against other anglers. The tournament is open to the public. After the tournament concludes, a barbeque will be held for all and proceeds from the day will be given to the Marines Helping Marines foundation.

The Impact

These heroes are confined to the hospital for rehabilitation. Many of them cannot go home as they do not live close to the area. Through donations we are able to allow them and their families to leave the area for a weekend, meet new friends, engage in the community, and learn a little about bass fishing.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to provide each servicemember with the proper fishing equipment to compete in this tournament. Fishing companies do donate product, however that is not always enough. We also need to pay for hotel rooms for each veteran and their families. Your donations will also help pay for event registration fees, t-shirts and coins, food, travel expenses, entertainment, and advertising for the event.

Other Ways You Can Help

Besides making a small donation you can help spread the word about this great event. Please share the links with your friends and family.

story:
Hey there! My name is Paige French and earlier this year I won Miss Teenage Camrose County. I will be headed to Toronto in July to represent Camrose County in the Miss Teenage Canada pageant!! I am excited to promote not just Camrose County, but rural Alberta! 

I live with my parents, Rick and Crystal, and have one sister, Bailey, and one brother, Benjamin. My family is my complete support system for anything I try or want to try. I love them for letting me find out who I am, and letting me be me!!

I love animals, especially horses. I have a mare and a new baby filly whom I adore. I have brought many "strays" home to my family and a few friends. I just can't leave them there by themselves.

I just finished grade 11, headed into grade 12 this coming school year. After high school, I want to travel for a year before going on to take my Bachelor of Science with a Biology degree.

I am out of my comfort zone and had to learn to walk in heels for the Miss Alberta pageant, but also believe this will be a great opportunity for all the girls involved!

I broke my back on October 26, 2013 and thought for sure I wasn't going to be able to compete in the pageant or ride horses again. Thankfully I did and I will!!

Part of the pageant is to raise the funds for the flights, the clothing, the entry fees, meals, etc, and this is where you can help me. Any donation, no matter how big or small, can help me go on and represent Alberta.

Please help me reach my goal and represent you and Alberta in Toronto!

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this, and for all the support I have gotten so far, and all the support I will keep getting. You are the best!

story:
Hello My name is Lakrishi Kindred

  • I am the owner of Elon Studios.
  • I am starting this campaign to raise money to purchase a computer to finish editing three really great projects.
  • This will definitely help me in a big way.  I will be able to finish these projects in a timely manner.  The producers will be able to receive their projects and screen them at their projected dates with your help.

Projects I am editing include: Unspeakable Indiscretions written and Directed by Eric B. Ramsey, Because We're Thespians, Written by JohnRoland Prejean and a Commercial for CTS Video Magazine's website. The problem is my computer crashed with no warning.  It is unfixable.  In order for me to finish these great projects,  I need  your help purchasing a new computer and I also need my files transferred.  I would appreciate everyone's help.  Please help me stay in business.

This is really a tuff time for me and I know that this is an editor and producer's worst nightmare.  With your help I can definitely be able to get these projects out there on the big screen.

I have to purchase a new computer and get my files transferred over to the new computer and get these projects edited so they can be screened.

In order to do this I need every one of you to help out with what ever you can give. 

So many people are waiting for these projects to be completed. 

These movies took a lot of time and patience to create and once they are edited, Everyone will be able to see how impactful they are.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know some of you may not have it, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share, share, share on all social media.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools! 

Again, Thank, you so much for taking your time to visit my page.  We can do this.

story:
We would not have made it all of these years without your support, but now we have to ask you one more time to really get behind The Idle Hour.  Any donation at any level is really important.  But we also really need your help in spreading the word about this fundraiser.  It is critical.  So please pass this along to your friends and neighbors, or anyone else you think might be interested in keeping us in the neighborhood.

The Idle Hour opened about 12 years ago on an unassuming corner in South Baltimore.  A bar has stood on the same corner ever since 1937.  When we were lucky enough to be given our turn at owning it, we respectfully reopened keeping the intimacy and warmth of an old neighborhood corner bar where you can relax with a good drink and good company, and of course great music.  We have had so much fun creating a community and sharing this with you over the years at The Idle Hour.  

Unfortunately, we have recently run into a structural issue that has forced us to close our doors.  The wall behind the back bar has started to buckle to the point we are not comfortable having a bar full of people.  We already have the plans for repair, and the team we'd like to use to get the job done.  Temporary walls must be constructed, and then the compromised wall will be removed in sections and replaced with a new foundation and block wall.   What we need now is the money to move forward with this plan.  Our bank and insurance company have not offered any assistance despite our twelve year relationship.  We are trying to raise $40,000 with our fundraiser, to be matched with $40,000 of our own money.  The total amount will give us the ability to do the repairs, continue to pay the monthly bills, and get that beautiful front door reopened.

We hope to get this process started as soon as possible so we can have the Idle Hour up and running by the end of summer.  The plan is to bring back the bar as close to what it was before.  If, however, we manage to exceed our goal, we plan to put all the extra funds towards opening our second floor.  This will give us the space to handle the busy weekends, as well as have the ability to host private events and bigger parties; perhaps even some live music from time to time.

We have some great incentives at various gift levels to make sure each individual gets something in return for their contribution.  To be sure, reopening the bar is the greatest reward of all, but we also want you to get something special.  From stickers to T-shirts, CD's to private events, we have something for everyone.

For you Chartreuse drinkers out there, we've got a great perk - the introduction of The Idle Hour Chartreuse Bottle Club. Only fifty lucky people will be able to join this limited club.  Chartreuse VEP is very hard to come by and is rarely seen in liquor stores, let alone bars. You can become a member of the world's only VEP Bottle Club right here in South Baltimore. If this one sells out we are half way to reaching our fundraising goal!

And now for a little fine print- Donations can be processed using your credit card with PayPal or billed directly.  By using the PayPal option, funds will be available to us six to eight weeks sooner than using your credit card directly,  Either option will work, but the sooner we have the funds, the sooner we can start construction. Shipping is available for most of the perks, but we would much rather deliver them to you at the bar when we reopen so we can shake your hand and say thanks in person.

Thank you so much for the good times.  Let's keep them going.  Long live Idle Hour.

Sincerely,

Randal Etheridge & Brendan Finnerty




Shot and a Beer


Shot of Green


Chartreuse Bottle Club


Last Call

story:
La Boulettes Box 

Une seule envie, retrouver la saveur des vraies boulettes de famille chez vous dans une boite écologique à déguster de suite, seule ou entre amis.

J'ai des trucs à vous dire !

La recette est secrète (car celle de ma mère) mais le goût est partagé par tout le monde.

Profitez vous aussi des meilleures boulettes de Casa (en la casa).

story:
Welcome to Recologie!

Hello!  We are Maria Cisneros and Judith Weber, partners and co-founders of Recologie Lifestyle, a brand new 6000 square foot flex-space which exists to support community engagement, healthy living, socially responsible shopping and most of all to provide for those who wish to have a space to call “home” when away from home and work.

Here you will find an eco-conscious boutique, a vegan/vegetarian café, a gallery supporting artists working in recycled materials, a commercial kitchen  and soon…a larger space which will support a flexible theater, a place for workshops, classes, music, private parties and just about everything else!

We have completed about 50% of our project and are bursting with successful experiences and want to finally finish the space that will allow many more people to enjoy and participate in what we have created.  We firmly believe that a PLACE needs to exist to provide an atmosphere of community - a place to share ideas, test new projects, exchange ideas, relax, entertain and be entertained.  We believe that people need to connect and we want to help make that possible!

We have completed the front portion of our new space and with adequate contributions we can develop the rear portion and buy new equipment for our commercial kitchen, renovate the space to include a flexible stage, an audio visual system to present documentary films, a sound and lighting system to support the many artists and entertainers who would like to develop their projects and can’t yet afford to buy their own equipment.  We want to install flooring to support dance and air handling equipment to assure a healthy environment.  Funding will allow us to hire staff and increase marketing to let everyone know about us.  Our space is community friendly and we want to be able to encourage exploration and experimentation for artistic and health-oriented programs. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking an initial amount of $20,000 to help get us going for our second phase of development.  The funds will first go to complete our kitchen which needs some new equipment, lighting and an electrical upgrade.  Our space came with a commercial kitchen but it needs to be brought up to current code!  The remaining funds will support the open space.  We would like to install reclaimed wood flooring, a platform for staging, general track-lighting and a stage-specific lighting sound system. 

The campaign perks we have to offer are unique and specific.  They are a sampling of what and who you will find at Recologie.  From eco-forward fashion to vegan dining, our perks will demonstrate the value of Recologie to the community.

If we do not reach our goal, we will at least complete the kitchen which will, in itself, allow us to create a catering center and to support culinary classes for those who want to learn to cook vegan/gluten free meals and learn about healthy eating with “real food”.  The kitchen will allow us to create a revenue stream to be able to continue our work towards our fully equipped flex-space.

The Impact

We have spent a year in development and have successfully overcome many of our obstacles, both financial and logistical.  Your contribution will help to fully realize our next phase and be able to fulfill the promise of what we began.

Recologie is a special place. It is a space that provides a personally rewarding environment.  It is what place-makers call a "Third Place" - where people can go to interact and connect with their community, a place to network and build new relationships, to share talents and interests.  It has a vegan/vegetarian café that offers a growing health-conscious community an alternative place to dine that recognizes their food preferences. It supports local farmers and, in the gallery, supports local and global artists who design and create using repurposed and sustainable materials.  Recologie’s mission is to raise awareness and educate about environmental and personal well-being.  The boutique supports Global Fair Trade products honoring fair business practices and pays forward to support communities of creative people working to support their villages in under-developed countries.  It is a place that welcomes others to create their visions

Maria Cisneros established the Recologie Boutique five years ago in the village of Larchmont, NY and within a very short time discovered that her clients loved her mission and the products she offered.  There seemed to be an amazing need and respect for an alternative shopping experience and the success of the boutique prompted our new partnership and the desire to incorporate the boutique into a destination which would include food, a gallery, and a public space.

Judith Weber, an artist and arts advocate, began developing Artist Lofts in 1978 to provide affordable space in a community environment.  In 1983 she co-founded Media Loft, a 33,000 sq ft factory building which would make space available to over 30 artists. In 2001 she converted it to a legal mixed-use Artists in Residence for affordable living for artists.  The need for community is what drove her desire to develop space and it is the need to create space for the community that drives her passion for Recologie.

Together we feel that our skills and commitment to serving the community will again be successful.

Recologie is about the community and recognizes the need for a place to connect.  Those who come in are somehow immediately comfortable and return over and over. They enjoy what we offer and very often bring us new ideas and now have an opportunity to share them with others.  We care and everyone feels it.

Our Commitment to Success

We have developed a comprehensive business plan which guides us through the steps of development.  We realize that by creating a complex business which needs to develop concurrent revenue streams, we have taken on a challenge.  We are confident that by aligning each of these businesses (food, entertainment, events, retail and exhibition) with a singular mission we can integrate the goals and measure the results making it possible to re-balance as we grow.  

Maria established the successful original Recologie and has many years of experience as a retailer as well as also being a Naturalist Artist making her contribution to the Gallery invaluable. Judith, an artist, arts space developer and recent President of the New Rochelle Council on the Arts, brings an ability to envision, create and manage the Gallery and create the outreach which builds the cultural events calendar. 

We have a Technology Director who manages and grows the website and a team of community members with professional experience in the theater and health industries to help guide us through the correct choices and evaluate our success.

We are a TEAM.  Each with skills and determination to succeed and build a space that will serve us all.

We appreciate all support.  If you can’t donate, please:

·  "LIKE" Recologie on Facebook and SHARE our posts to help spread the word.

·  Follow us on Twitter@Recologie

·  Subscribe to our newsletter on our website www.recologie.com 

·  If you are in the area, please come by for a meal or to explore our shop and gallery and even spend an evening enjoying our workshops, music, poetry and much more.

·  SHARE WITH YOUR FRIENDS!

responsible shopping and most of all to provide for those who wish to have a
space to call “home” when away from home and work.

an eco-conscious boutique, a vegan/vegetarian café, a gallery supporting
artists working in recycled materials, a commercial kitchen  and soon…a larger space which will
support a flexible theater, a place for workshops, classes, music, private
parties and just about everything else!
We have completed
about 50% of our project and are bursting with successful experiences and want
to finally finish the space that will allow many more people to enjoy and
participate in what we have created. 
We firmly believe that a PLACE needs to exist to provide an atmosphere
of community - a place to share ideas, test new projects, exchange ideas, relax,
entertain and be entertained.  We
believe that people need to connect and we want to help make that possible!
We have completed

equipment for our commercial kitchen, renovate the space to include a flexible
stage, an audio visual system to present documentary films, a sound and
lighting system to support the many artists and entertainers who would like to
develop their projects and can’t yet afford to buy their own equipment.  We want to install flooring to support

story:
Empowering individuals to lead communities with vision, integrity, compassion and purpose.


WE ARE A NON-PROFIT START-UP NEEDING $10,000 TO FUND OUR SUMMER OVERNIGHT CAMP-OUTS 


MISSION STATEMENT: Ute Springs Experiential Learning Center endeavors to reach people of all ages; to promote self-awareness by cultivating social/emotional learning through nature-based experiences.

WHY: Ute Springs Experiential Learning Center (USELC) has been created to ignite a path to the authentic self, alive in each individual. Once this connection has been awakened, a trust in self forms. When an individual, whether 7 or 107, leads their life trusting their choices, a wholeness is felt, purpose is found.

                                          

                                


A LIFE IGNITED WITH INNER PASSION SPIRALS INTO A THRIVING COMMUNITY.



HOW: We have designed a mobile camp to bring our programming alive! We have six - one week camps: High School Leadership Camp, Middle School Challenge Camp and Elementary Adventure Camp. Each week there will be one night out in the wilderness - our OVERNIGHT CAMP-OUTS!!!

CAMP: USELC Summer programs develop and foster leadership and teambuilding, teach social/emotional skills, and provide tools for personal growth. These enriching programs will reach students from 1st through 12th grades, and are designed in alignment with each camper’s developmental needs.

RETREATS: Spanning from September to May, retreats will be created for adult learning. Passionate, dedicated scholars and life coaches will be sought to facilitate 4 and 5 day sanctuaries where reflection and expansion can occur in a safe and inspiring environment.



UTE SPRINGS EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING CENTER WILL ENDEAVOR TO PROVIDE ENRICHMENT TO ALL WHO SEEK IT.


Community Impact... 

The need for this type of nature-based curriculum is so high our Elementary School Adventure camps filled in 3 DAYS during early registration!! 
Our community support has been incredible and the belief in what we are creating has shown in the excitement to collaborate with our programming! We look forward to a healthy future but we need your help too!!

Just so you know...., ultimately, we are looking to purchase ranch/camp land in Eagle County, Colorado for our summer camps and retreat center. 

Since Ute Springs Experiential Learning Center will be located in the heart of Eagle County, the effects of place-based nature experiences will radiate throughout the valley and beyond.

Once on camp property, during their stay, campers and retreat attendees will sink into the natural surroundings creating a connection with nature.  Attendees will then feel more committed and work to insure special places like our camp be preserved for future generations.


The social/emotional benefits of this type of learning build self and community awareness, leadership and relationship skills, and instill self regulation and responsible decision-making.


OUR GOAL AT UTE SPRINGS EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING CENTER IS TO SCHOLARSHIP 10% OF ALL ATTENDEES OF ALL PROGRAMS!



How you can help...

Our ultimate ask...purchase of the above mentioned camp/ranch land located in Eagle, Colorado-$3,000,000


FOR OUR OVERNIGHTS:


5 Four person tents - $1,500

Sun Shelter - $450

6 small cook stoves - $750 

2 large multi-burner cook stoves  - $400 

6 mess-kits - $750  

20 Sleeping Bags  - $3,500  

6 Ground Sheets  - $450  

4 12x16 Tarps - $340 

Tools (shovels, ax, etc)  - $250 

20 Medium sized Backpacks - $1,600


OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

Sponsor the high school leadership camp (one session)-$10,000
Sponsor 5 local, in-need kids for camp for one week -$1,250
Provide healthy meals for one session of camp  - $1,000
Sponsor a summer’s worth of activities- $2,000
Help bring a school to Ute Springs- $2,000
Sponsor a camp week for one camper- $250
Transform the life of one kid- prices may vary 


Helping can take the form of getting the word out ....
pass along www.UteSpringsELC.org 
or contact me at Linda@UteSpringsELC.org 
or Amy@UteSpringsELC.org for more information.
In TREMENDOUS GRATITUDE, we appreciate your consideration, Linda and Amy

story:
10,000 Pushups, 10 days - Clean water for thousands of children

Hey guys, for those of you who don’t know me, my name is Tyson Mayr.

For the past 4 years I have been full time travelling around the world, volunteering every chance I can & also carrying & installing water filters to schools in need, for an amazing non-profit charity organisation, RainCatcher.

On December 3rd I left for Uganda with 100 water filters, to meet with RainCatcher to help bring clean water to thousands of little children.

While I was there I decided to do 10,000 pushups in 10 days to help raise more money & awareness. on my next mission to Uganda to help regions that are in desperate need of clean water.

The video above was made by a Primary School in a small town of Wyoming who was so inspired, they wanted to join in on the cause!  I want to thank everyone for sending in your pushup videos from around the world joining in, the link below is HUGH JACKMAN helping join the cause!

http://instagram.com/p/jUsF4CChCm/ 

For the rest of this campaign I am going to continue meeting with schools & doing my pushups to raise money for clean water & I want to thank everyone who has become involved :)  While $100 is enough to provide an entire village with Clean Water & $50 will provide a school or orphanage a RainCatcher water filter, which will provide clean water for years to come, just $10 alone is making a huge difference & saving lives!

Follow up video coming - please keep sharing, commenting & sending in the pushups videos - together we can really make a lasting difference :)


“According to the World Health Organization, 1.1 billion people lack access to clean water. More than 4,500 people a day or 1.6 million people die every year from diseases attributed to contaminated drinking water, 90% of these people are under the age of 5”

That means by the time you have read to here, another child right now, under the age of 5 has died, simply from not having access to clean drinking water.  Something i'v never had to think about, especially as a child...


RainCatcher is a non-profit organisation dedicated to healing communities by providing clean water for children in the developing world using affordable and sustainable solutions.

When I first discovered RainCatcher I was in awe at all of the progress they had made, helping literally hundreds of schools & projects around the world through the installation of water filters & water harvesting systems - with big plans on helping more.

I quickly became an ambassador & from that day forward would always carry water filters in my bag that I could quickly & easily install into any schools or villages affected by contaminated water that I might come across during my travels.

WHY PUSHUPS

I like to create fund raising challenges that are not only engaging, but challenging to myself.  I believe raising money for charity, even if it might be a sad situation, can be done in a fun way that can further promote the cause, spread awareness & help get others involved. 


How This Fundraiser Will Help

It will literally be saving lives.  We are passing thousands of children every single day who are drinking contaminated water & within minutes we can install a life saving filter that will provide clean water for years to come.


I remember I was helping build a school in Guatemala earlier this year. It was 2 hrs away from the closest city in a remote village with several hundred children living there.  I ran out of bottled water & followed two small girls from the school to where the local water supply was. The stream they took me to was a major reality check.  When I saw the colour, insects & pollution of that water, I didn't want to go near it let alone drink it.  Yet here were to young children filling up a bucket just meters away from 2 pigs using the same water supply as there toilet.

In this situation I was able to pull a water filter from my bag, find an old bucket & within a few minutes, provide a solution that allowed there whole village filtered water for years to come.  It cost me $50.


Now imagine what it would be like to walk for miles at a time to find a similar supply.  

If I can raise $10,000 it means, through the help of RainCatcher, I am going to be able to install 200 water filters to schools, villages & orphanages who desperately need clean water. That is over 100,000 children with clean water.  100,000 children who do not need to drink muddy water anymore & worry about being sick or seeing there little brother or sister die.


Please take a quick look at the perks I have listed for donations & please remember - while a $100 donation is enough to provide a full village with clean drinking water for years - Just $10 alone is helping save lives!! 

Please Tweet or Facebook me if you do donate so I can organise a thank you letter or new PenPal from the children you are helping & please do not hesitate to contact me on the links below for any additional questions!

Join me on this mission as I share everything from start to finish & don't forget to like & share this campaign!

Thanking you all from the bottom of my heart in advance :)

Together we can make a difference!


Tyson Mayr

Facebook.com/TNTraveller

RainCatcher.org/tyson

Instagram.com/tysonTRAVEL

Twitter.com/tysonTRAVEL
