story:
Remote control Page Turner For Music


Patent pending.....
In case this looks familiar, I felt obliged, for the sake of most visitors who were using cell phones, to present more information in the main video. Thanks for visiting.

It has been a long time since people began wanting a page turner, especially for music - and nothing has ever been available that is affordable, easy to set up, and simple to use.

Enter Cue Page Turners: take seconds to set up, are stable on a music stand or piano, use  wireless remote control, are based on sound mechanics that won't break down with normal use, they are fun to use, and they are elegant.

They will be quite inexpensive and everyone should support this.

This project goes back almost fifty years, when I started participating in the public school music program. Not that I thought of a page turner at the time. It was the experience of contending with various instruments, music stands and sheet music all at once, which left a bit of mostly forgotten frustration lurking quietly in my memory.

Just a few decades later a suggestion from a friend that I design a wood music stand, got me thinking about a page turner to go with it.

The basic idea was simple; I wanted to emulate an arm and two fingers. From there it turned into a drawing on the blackboard. Now it just wanted a turning mechanism. I was obsessed by now, so, gathered whatever scraps of metal and plastic I could find around my shop, then ran to my favorite hardware store, spent an hour there and bought a bunch of generic stuff I could make comply with my plans.


Arriving back to my shop, I spread out my horde on a work table. For a long while, I stared at my horde, then at my blackboard art and back and forth. Eventually the parts desired began to stick out from the crowd. With some alterations, I had what is called a dry assembled prototype. From there, it was easy to determine what was needed to make these parts cooperate in turning a page back and forth, (for repeat sections).

Ordinarily, when I finish with a design it gets built. In this case, that did not happen. The reason is that I could not afford the casts that are necessary for plastic injection. This is how the plastic components are made. There were no 3d printers at the time. I committed the project to a set of mechanical drawings and put it on the proverbial shelf.

Late this last spring, I went to the Amazon website, and got distracted by some comments under the kindle product. The one that caught my eye was from a customer who said that a reasonable mechanical page turner would be preferable to a computer screen. I agreed, especially for music.

Not needing a lot of encouragement, I made patent drawings, wrote a description and filed for a patent. Before filing I carried out a patent and prior art search.

I need at least one 3d printer. Two is preferable for producing in plasticine and metal. Having the 3d printers and my 3d drawings, I could settle some details and produce a manufacturer prototype. The details include whether to use plastic or metal for the arms. The arms need to stay straight in order for the mechanism to work well. In addition, the fixed ends of the arms are connected together so they can rotate independently. This is something I can do in several ways and need to decide.

While the 3d printers are making parts I would want to finalize the options. This has to do with providing a vacuum drive, (no electricity), and electric drive. There will also be the issue of a foot controller for each type of drive. Rechargeable batteries need to be tested, and a wireless connection applied.
So it doesn't fall over, the turner will have a vacuum bottom. This is similar to the suction bottoms on pencil sharpeners that are engaged with a small lever.

At the end of this project, I expect to have a manufacturers prototype. The differences between that and my 3d modeling visually, would be actual finishes, rounded corners, all parts would be showing and it will be in a real environment. This is still patent pending so there is a limit to the details I can make public. Those details amount to options I still have in the design.

patent pending..

***NOTE: You do not need to join Paypal to use your debit or credit card.

Some comments regarding the various digital solutions being 'offered' lately.
          1. i phones  2. i pods  3. tablets  4. laptops
You probably know the cost of these devices and maybe even the various foot operated controllers available to emulate pages turning. Add to that the cost of software, scores, etc...I think it adds up to at least $200 - $300 to get started.

What do you get for the investment?

A. The type of device that's infamous for its propensity to have its screen shattered
B. A type of device that displays a page of score so small, that if used on a stand or piano would cause eye strain in many people. Myself for one.
C. If you magnify a page you'll see part of it and will have to hand scroll on the screen to see the rest.
D. Reflection and glare.
story_txt:
Remote control Page Turner For Music




Patent pending.....In case this looks familiar, I felt obliged, for the sake of most visitors who were using cell phones, to present more information in the main video. Thanks for visiting.It has been a long time since people began wanting a page turner, especially for music - and nothing has ever been available that is affordable, easy to set up, and simple to use. Enter Cue Page Turners: take seconds to set up, are stable on a music stand or piano, use  wireless remote control, are based on sound mechanics that won't break down with normal use, they are fun to use, and they are elegant.They will be quite inexpensive and everyone should support this.

This project goes back almost fifty years, when I started participating in the public school music program. Not that I thought of a page turner at the time. It was the experience of contending with various instruments, music stands and sheet music all at once, which left a bit of mostly forgotten frustration lurking quietly in my memory.Just a few decades later a suggestion from a friend that I design a wood music stand, got me thinking about a page turner to go with it.The basic idea was simple; I wanted to emulate an arm and two fingers. From there it turned into a drawing on the blackboard. Now it just wanted a turning mechanism. I was obsessed by now, so, gathered whatever scraps of metal and plastic I could find around my shop, then ran to my favorite hardware store, spent an hour there and bought a bunch of generic stuff I could make comply with my plans.
Arriving back to my shop, I spread out my horde on a work table. For a long while, I stared at my horde, then at my blackboard art and back and forth. Eventually the parts desired began to stick out from the crowd. With some alterations, I had what is called a dry assembled prototype. From there, it was easy to determine what was needed to make these parts cooperate in turning a page back and forth, (for repeat sections).Ordinarily, when I finish with a design it gets built. In this case, that did not happen. The reason is that I could not afford the casts that are necessary for plastic injection. This is how the plastic components are made. There were no 3d printers at the time. I committed the project to a set of mechanical drawings and put it on the proverbial shelf.Late this last spring, I went to the Amazon website, and got distracted by some comments under the kindle product. The one that caught my eye was from a customer who said that a reasonable mechanical page turner would be preferable to a computer screen. This is something I can do in several ways and need to decide.While the 3d printers are making parts I would want to finalize the options. This has to do with providing a vacuum drive, (no electricity), and electric drive. There will also be the issue of a foot controller for each type of drive. Rechargeable batteries need to be tested, and a wireless connection applied. So it doesn't fall over, the turner will have a vacuum bottom. This is similar to the suction bottoms on pencil sharpeners that are engaged with a small lever.At the end of this project, I expect to have a manufacturers prototype. The differences between that and my 3d modeling visually, would be actual finishes, rounded corners, all parts would be showing and it will be in a real environment. This is still patent pending so there is a limit to the details I can make public. Those details amount to options I still have in the design. patent pending..***NOTE: You do not need to join Paypal to use your debit or credit card.Some comments regarding the various digital solutions being 'offered' lately.          1. i phones  2. i pods  3. tablets  4. laptops
You probably know the cost of these devices and maybe even the various foot operated controllers available to emulate pages turning. Add to that the cost of software, scores, etc...I think it adds up to at least $200 - $300 to get started.What do you get for the investment?A. The type of device that's infamous for its propensity to have its screen shattered

B. A type of device that displays a page of score so small, that if used on a stand or piano would cause eye strain in many people. Myself for one.

story:
Short Summary

Hello,

My name is Indigo Geschwind and I am currently a nursing student. I have a few jobs at the moment but am trying to get my doula business (Indigo Blue Doula Services) going and am working on certification through DONA to become a certified birth and postpartum doula. Research has shown that doulas can improve birth outcomes by being there to support women before, during, and after labor. I help all women but focus on those going through difficult situations and some are unable to pay. Your contribution will help these women have the support they need during a life changing event in their lives.

What We Need & What You Get

I provide 2 prenatal visits, full support throughout the whole birth and 2  postpartum visits 4 hours each for $300. I also provide the women with the notes I take on the birth because it's hard to remember when and what happened for them! If women need additional help I provide it and extra postpartum care is charged on an hourly basis. Any amount I raise will go toward paying the difference between what a woman can pay and the total fee. By doing this I will be able to afford to serve more women. Also, if their insurance does reimburse for part or all then the money raised will go to another woman who does not have these benefits.

The Impact

Research studies have shown the innumerable positive outcomes having a doula can make. For example, doulas decrease the likely hood of c-secitions and pain medication use. They also lessen the chances of abuse after a child is born by providing information about development, breastfeeding, and catching and reffering clients with symptoms of postpartum depression because they are in the home with families.

Doulas are not medical professionals but are there to support and educate the mom in her choices and help her through this stage in her life. Doulas help in home, birthing center, and hospital births, even c-sections!

My resources:

http://www.dona.org/PDF/positionpaper_PPdoula_0...

http://www.healthtalk.umn.edu/2013/02/14/doula-care-for-low-income-women-could-save-taxpayers-money/

http://evidencebasedbirth.com/the-evidence-for-doulas/

Other Ways You Can Help

If aren't able to contribute let other people know about this and tell them the benefits of having a doula. Some hospitals are now offering them for a low/no fee because of the benefits and even a few insurance companies partially reimburse though it can take a lot of work!

story:
Short Summary

Hey everyone! I am Michelle Austin! I am planning to move across country to continue my career in the entertainment and art world. My small business is doing alright in Vegas but I need to move out to NYC where it can become a big success. I have a friend out there I am partnering with to expand my business and projects.

What We Need & What You Get

I need everyone's help in this big move. I cant do it alone, because I make mostly enough money to pay my bills and live. So by helping contribute to the cause you can help me achieve my dreams. Everyone will get something in return! You can donate as much or as little as you can. Everything will go to my move. This is really happening. If you pick a "Perk" on the side in whatever amount you will get that "perk!"

The Impact

The impact this will have on me, will be amazing. Ever since I was a kid had a dream to live in NYC and to work and be a part of. About four years ago I ended up homeless in LA, and it changed my life and my world. I was sleeping in alley ways and stuggling to make ends meat. But I got out of that hole and someone suggested moving to Vegas because it was cheap. I did, and have been there 3 years. I am back on my feet but most of what I make goes to paying bills and living. This fundraiser will help me get back to a place and help expand my growing entertainment work and business. It will put me in a place where I have friends and people I care for.

Thank you in Advance,

Love, Michelle

story:
Veterans Co-op

Hi! I'm Matt. I'm an eleven year veteran of the U.S. Marine Corps. I have watched some of my brothers and sisters struggle since leaving the service. I have watched others become prescription pill addicts for pain management. The truth is I can solve both of these problems with upcoming legislation.

I have formed Veterans Co-op Inc. It is a not for profit company owned and operated by military veterans. It is governed by direct DEMOCRACY. Each member has one vote for any and all decisions to be made by the board of directors. My goal is to create jobs, independence, and compassionate care alternatives for military veterans and the surrounding community.

I realize that some people do not agree with medical marijuana. I implore you to ask yourself: why not? The only other options out there currently are over the counter meds or highly addictive opiates. 

What We Need & What You Get

I am trying to raise $50,000 for legal costs, licensing, consulting, and training to get us going.

  • We have stickers and T-shirts that we will be adding as an incentive for your donations.
  • If we do not reach our full goal, all funds donated will be put to the best use possible towards reaching our ends.

Mission

Our Mission is to provide a safe, consistent and high quality product for regulated used as permitted for by law.


Vision

Our vision is to create jobs, independence, and compassionate care for veterans and our community while growing and guiding an emerging industry through community service, direct democracy, and the needs of our customers.



Other Ways You Can Help

Please -  Spread the word. I truly believe that we can make a positive change in our great country. If you cannot donate but would like to support us we can use all the help we can get through volunteers, work of mouth, and just believing in us.  

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Help A Friend Get A Car!

Dear Friends,

Let's get right to it - I am in need of a personal vehicle to get to and from work, as well as to organize activist projects in the Southeastern United States. I've fallen on hard financial times, but your generosity can help me secure steady income and bring much needed social justice activism to the region.

Mutual Aid in Action

Your contribution will go directly to securing a personal vehicle. In return, you get a great gift.

The first twenty donors to give $50 or more will receive a signed copy of The Enemy in Blue: The Renatta Frazier Story, a creative non-fiction book I co-authored with my mother.

This historical work chronicles the true story of my mother's experiences with racism and sexism while a police officer. The power of a city against her, Renatta Frazier fights back against a corrupt system, enduring relentless public criticism, police intimidation, and upheavals in her life and career. With the help of a journalist committed to the truth, the undying love of her family and an unwavering faith, she changes the landscape of an entire city, setting a lasting precedent. It's an important piece of Illinois history.

I've allowed a month to raise $2700 to purchase a reliable vehicle. If I don't reach my goal, the funds will be added to my personal contribution. Either way, all donations will be used to purchase a vehicle, nothing else.

Help A Friend Change The World

In the state of Georgia, it is very difficult to be effective as an activist without consistent reliable transportation. Public transit is limited to Atlanta and a handful of metropolitan areas, and it is expensive to utilize on a regular basis as the city continues to raise rates.

Securing a personal vehicle will not only allow me to earn steady income to assist in the care of my household, but it will also allow me to expand activist projects in the state of Georgia and in the Southeast region. Some of these projects include:

  • recruiting local activists for anti-oppression and anti-extraction
  • animal rights direct actions in the city of Atlanta
  • anti-human trafficking in Atlanta - the nation's worst city for human trafficking
  • pro-feminist education for men
  • coalition building with regional organizations

But it's not just the state and region you will be impacting - I am part of an international network of environmental and social justice activists, and I attend conferences, gatherings and actions across the country. Your contribution will ensure that myself and my comrades will have the resources to continue resistance to empire.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Let's put our ideals of community, mutual aid and solidarity to action.

  • Share this donation page on your social media sites
  • Know anyone with a good spare vehicle? Give me a price, or ask them to donate it!

Thank you for your generosity, your friendship and your consideration.

Sincerely,

Kourtney Mitchell

story:
Summary

At August Rose Press, we love to read and write. We also want to publish authors who take reading and writing seriously. We have found some great authors simply do not have a traditionally accepted market for their work. We have also found that not every author (especially from minority groups) fits into Urban Literature or other mainstream categories.We want to change that. We offer the opportunity for authors to express themselves without being pigeon-holed into strict categories.

We review manuscripts for style, clarity, content, and storytelling. All authors are welcome to submit their work. We do not accept manuscripts that focus solely on erotic content. Our goal is to bring "new classics" to the marketplace that have underlying themes that are grounded firmly in the American Experience. Since the United States is a uniquely diverse place, we know that many kinds of fiction and non-fiction can fall under this umbrella. This is why we take the time to evaluate every manuscript we receive on an individual basis. 

After review of a manuscript, an author is offered a contract to be published under August Rose Press. We do not accept authors that have not been previously reviewed by us, and authors cannot pay us to be their publisher. 

What we provide authors with:

  • Supervision over the editorial process and revisions to their work
  • A customized marketing plan that is suited for their project
  • Execution of the marketing plan, paid for by August Rose Press

What We Need & What You Get

Here is what the money is primarily used for:

  • Authors are responsible for all editing fees, but we help finance these fees to make the costs more manageable for the author
  • We execute a marketing plan that makes sense for the book. It might be a speaking event at a local school, an interactive website to engage readers, or it could be a book trailer.
    For an example of a book trailer, you can take a look at this one for Somewhat Close To Normal: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wMZTbZEsqoo
  • Advertising to seek out new talent for publication. We've found incredible talent in the most unlikely places.

This is where the money is going:

  • $4,000 towards operational expenses (e.g. attorney fees, office supplies, publishing software, website maintenance, updating the writing resources blog, advertising for existing publications, advertising for manuscript acquisition).
  • $3,000 for editing financing fees for 2 - 3 unpublished authors (e.g. authors repay investment that company originally puts up on their behalf)
  • $8,000 for marketing execution for upcoming books (e.g. press release distribution, book catalog submissions for booksellers and libraries, social media advertising, print advertising for events, event spaces for book signings and talks, conferences, book fairs)

The Impact

Authors who publish with us will have the support of a team that cares about the work, not just the bottom line. Authors under August Rose Press not only get their work published, but guidance about what makes sense for them. 

Authors who may not have been accepted by major publishers can get keen attention that they may not have otherwise had. Authors who would have otherwise self-published will have a marketing machine behind them, as well as real exposure to the market. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate, but know an author that may be interested in working with us, let us know about them! Have them send us an email to: mystory [at] augustrosepress [dot] com.

story:
For the love of bread.I 


  • Greetings:  I am Ahura Z. Diliiza.  I am headmaster at Unicorn Cove School of Metaphysics and....  An accomplished baker.  I have since the age of 6 had the predilection to put things together that were good to eat.  I have learned first by being the eldest of 8 to cook, but I have a passion for serving good food.  I have worked in every position of restaurants for a total of 12 years, from dishwasher to management.  I began my quest to open a low to no sodium bakery when I stopped into a bakery and asked for a nutritional value chart and the woman said. "If your'e looking for nutrition, this is not the place for you"  I was appalled
  • and decided then that we needed a place that is good for you.
I began researching ways to step around too much salt and preservatives in food when I spoke to a doctor that told me that we as humans only need 2,500 ml of sodium a day, and that true most health food dieters declare war on fat and cholesterol but completely miss the massive intake of sodium that is un necessarily put in our food.  He said that most Americans consume between 10 and 15, 000 ml. a day and that too much sodium is chiefly responsible for hypertension and other complications.  I too have been affected by this and thus was forced to give up much of the food that I loved.  I however decided to do the work and Find ways to create recipes that are low to no sodium and low cholesterol with high nutritional value.  I will use only organic products and non GMO ingredients.  I will also not use preservatives as my bread is meant to be eaten.  I keep myself healthy and fed, and I can make sure that you all have at least one place that is able and willing to make sure that you get baked goods that you do not have to be afraid of.  This Campaign is important to me because I know what its like to worry about what you eat, and look at others enjoying what you would like to but cannot because of what food makers put in our food now these days.  Please help me accomplish the creation of Daily Bread low sodium bakery.  
I am looking to raise 25 to 50,000 Dollars
Your support will help me bring a goal to life and also provide food for those that do not have enough.  I will every week donate a portion of the baked goods to local food pantries and homeless shelters so that people can at least have home baked bread to eat.  I will do this weekly with love and Joy as I know what its like to be hungry.  REALLY hungry.  No one should go without food.  While I cannot end world hunger I can at least with your help end it wherever Daily Bread Bakery is.
  • By helping me you would make it possible for me to repay everyone that has ever reached out to me when I needed help and change not only my life but the lives of everyone that will get to have their Daily Bread.


What the money is for:

I need 25 to 50,000.00

First off.  I will lease a place that has already been used for a restaurant and change it to suit the needs of Daily Bread.  This takes money.  I know how to stretch a dollar but it is always better to start with paying a few months rent right up front.

Second we will need supplies such as  mixers bowls tables utensils and bake ware.I prefer milling the flour daily by hand so that we keep the personal touch.

I am looking to spend on what has been mentioned thus far about 12,000.

We will make sure to get everything that is needed so that we don't have to corrective spend.

Ingredients and stock:  As I said earlier my goods are meant to be eaten so we will need to shop for the best organic and even gluten free flour, and other ingredients.  fresh produce can get expensive and organic can be even more expensive but if we again start with proper funding.  I can make certain that each loaf that comes from Daily Bread is perfection,  I will only shop locally so other businesses will benefit as well.  I will also have tea, as nothing goes as great with fresh baked bread as a good herbal tea.  I will decorate and make Daily Bread feel like home.  When people come, even the atmosphere will comfort them and promote healing indwell being.

The rewards that you will receive are thoroughly planned and I hope generous.  I have always fed people and so all of the perks will make sure that I get to do something that I love to do.   Bake for you.

If I do not reach my goal, and you have supported me.  I will still use the money that we raise towards supplies for Daily Bread.  I will buy equipment and start small.  I will still honor the rewards named to the letter.  Not reaching my goal does not mean giving up.  I will still even to the best of my ability bake for you.  I have been in business for 15 years in Maine as a teacher and headmaster.  There are no wealthy teachers but there are teachers that love to serve and I am one of them.


This is huge for me

I am putting one of my dreams on the line and it has taken me 54 years to decide to expose this part of myself.  

While I am confident

That Daily Bread will be successful.  I know the risks of starting such an endeavor.
The economy could fall, business may not be so good, supplies may be hard to find, etc.  I have kept my school afloat for 15 years.  I have seen good days and bad.  When tough times come you stick to the simplicity of doing business and stay disciplined.  The way I see it?  Discipline is freedom.  I am well versed in handling a crisis.  I am invested in this project.  I hope you will be as well.

There are other ways to help

You could donate supplies we will need mixers equipment and even if you have a space for rent that is suitable.  Maybe even in the future come and allow me to instruct you on bread baking and help out.  You won't be sorry.  Beyond that tell as many as possible about my project.  Help me give it wings.  Remember.  Indiegogo.com.  Share it

Thank you for helping me.  As long as I have Daily Bread.  You will not have to go hungry, and you will not have to be afraid of what you eat.
story_txt:
For the love of bread.I 
  Greetings:  I am Ahura Z. Diliiza.  I am headmaster at Unicorn Cove School of Metaphysics and....  An accomplished baker.  I have since the age of 6 had the predilection to put things together that were good to eat.  I have learned first by being the eldest of 8 to cook, but I have a passion for serving good food.  I have worked in every position of restaurants for a total of 12 years, from dishwasher to management.  I began my quest to open a low to no sodium bakery when I stopped into a bakery and asked for a nutritional value chart and the woman said. "If your'e looking for nutrition, this is not the place for you"  I was appalled
and decided then that we needed a place that is good for you.

I began researching ways to step around too much salt and preservatives in food when I spoke to a doctor that told me that we as humans only need 2,500 ml of sodium a day, and that true most health food dieters declare war on fat and cholesterol but completely miss the massive intake of sodium that is un necessarily put in our food.  He said that most Americans consume between 10 and 15, 000 ml. a day and that too much sodium is chiefly responsible for hypertension and other complications.  I too have been affected by this and thus was forced to give up much of the food that I loved.  I however decided to do the work and Find ways to create recipes that are low to no sodium and low cholesterol with high nutritional value.  I will use only organic products and non GMO ingredients.  I will also not use preservatives as my bread is meant to be eaten.  I keep myself healthy and fed, and I can make sure that you all have at least one place that is able and willing to make sure that you get baked goods that you do not have to be afraid of.  This Campaign is important to me because I know what its like to worry about what you eat, and look at others enjoying what you would like to but cannot because of what food makers put in our food now these days.  Please help me accomplish the creation of Daily Bread low sodium bakery.  
I am looking to raise 25 to 50,000 Dollars
Your support will help me bring a goal to life and also provide food for those that do not have enough.  I will every week donate a portion of the baked goods to local food pantries and homeless shelters so that people can at least have home baked bread to eat.  I will do this weekly with love and Joy as I know what its like to be hungry.  REALLY hungry.  No one should go without food.  While I cannot end world hunger I can at least with your help end it wherever Daily Bread Bakery is.
 By helping me you would make it possible for me to repay everyone that has ever reached out to me when I needed help and change not only my life but the lives of everyone that will get to have their Daily Bread.     What the money is for:

story:
Hali Koda! ("Welcome, Friend!" in Dakota)

    Help welcome tourists to Pipestone, Minnesota with fun & funky PASSPORTS! With your help, more curious visitors can explore the top 15 historical and cultural wonders of our unique prairie community while collecting iconic "stamps" in their souvenir passport! 

    • Spearheaded and fundraised by The Historic Calumet Inn and Pipestone County Museum in April 2014, these beautiful Passports to Pipestone have been a popular hit, especially among families and couples. 
    • In order to keep up the good energy of town pride and cultural tourism, we need YOUR HELP in printing 2,200 more copies! 
    • Help a tourist find their way and fall in love with our friendly and fascinating city! Home of the Native American Peacepipe Quarries, the Pipestone National Monument, and the stunning quartzite buildings in our historic downtown, Pipestone is not just a "rest stop"...we are a destination! 


    What We Need & What You Get

    • In order to print 2,200 more Passports, we need $1,900 to cover printing costs. 
    • Even if we do not reach our goal, we will print as many Passports as possible with the funds collected. 
    • YOU will receive our most heartfelt appreciation and some cool prizes too! 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are unable to contribute today, we hope you can still spread the word! Make some noise on your social media and spread the word about Pipestone, Minnesota! We hope to host you someday so we can show you what Midwest hospitality is all about!

Hali Koda! ("Welcome, Friend!" in Dakota)

Help welcome tourists to Pipestone, Minnesota with fun & funky PASSPORTS! With your help, more curious visitors can explore the top 15 historical and cultural wonders of our unique prairie community while collecting iconic "stamps" in their souvenir passport! 

Spearheaded and fundraised by The Historic Calumet Inn and Pipestone County Museum in April 2014, these beautiful Passports to Pipestone have been a popular hit, especially among families and couples.  In order to keep up the good energy of town pride and cultural tourism, we need YOUR HELP in printing 2,200 more copies! 
Help a tourist find their way and fall in love with our friendly and fascinating city! Home of the Native American Peacepipe Quarries, the Pipestone National Monument, and the stunning quartzite buildings in our historic downtown, Pipestone is not just a "rest stop"...we are a destination! 

   What We Need & What You Get 
In order to print 2,200 more Passports, we need $1,900 to cover printing costs.  Even if we do not reach our goal, we will print as many Passports as possible with the funds collected. 
YOU will receive our most heartfelt appreciation and some cool prizes too! 



Other Ways You Can Help

 If you are unable to contribute today, we hope you can still spread the word! Make some noise on your social media and spread the word about Pipestone, Minnesota! We hope to host you someday so we can show you what Midwest hospitality is all about!

story: After working for years for others, I feel it's time to do it for myself.  Off and on over the last few years, I have made and sold gift baskets-primarily featuring my homemade biscotti as well as other baked goodies. I am in desperate need of assistance with making this a success. My goal is to start off by renting a kitchen and focusing my attention to a website based mail order business and branching out to deliver to local businesses for resale. Please help me achieve this with your donations..

Please help me achieve this with your donations..

story:
Help my Dad, #hedeservesit

My Dad is a good worker, even after all the bad things that happened to us in these years.

  • I'm his son, the only one, I'm nineteen years old and I live in Italy. I'm trying to do the best I can to help my dad to repair his car or get a used one for less.
  • Why? Because my Dad needs his car to go to work everyday, and if he can't go because of the broken car, he will lose his job and that means that we will lose our house.
  • Even with a small contribution you could help him. He lost his wife (my Mother) in 2012, but he is still strong, he has never made me miss anything even with all the problems we had.
  • We ran out of money to pay lawyers in a bank case, where we are the injured party, where we are right, but the bank is prolonging the terms so we have to pay a lot untill it will be ended.

We are standing still, even with all the problems we have, but we need your help.

How much he needs?

He has to pay the mechanic for the broken car parts that he has to change, and also his workforce.

If it will be possibile, we will buy a used car to replace the smashed one.

Whether we will exceed the goal we will also give half of the "extra" money to charity! 

Since we care about people less lucky than us, if we will reach the goal of 3500 euros and get extra money, we will use half ot the extra money to pay our lawyer and the other half will go to charity.

For example: If we will have 500 euros of extra money, we will use 250 euros to pay our lawyer and the other 250 euros will go to charity.

We will prove the donation by posting a picture of the donation bill.

What will happen if we don't reach the goal?

If we will not reach the goal, we will keep what we got anyway to help us pay a part of the mechanic bill.

If you can't donate you could share this campaign

I know that there are a lot of people less lucky than us, so if you can't donate, you can still help us by sharing this campaign! We will really appreciate that.


Sincerely, son.

story:
“Give a woman a fish, and you feed her family for a day.

Teach a woman to run her own business, and she feeds her family for a lifetime.”

Announcing the launch of the “Freedom Stitchers” project to create self-sufficiency for marginalized and jobless women in Gaza.

The “Freedom Stitchers” project begins in Gaza, in late autumn 2013

ABOUT

“Freedom Stitchers” will be a sustainable project run by women in Gaza. This micro-business is based on the idea that Palestinian women possess their own unique artistic and design skills, but they need a process to sell their finished products to the world, (with a little help from their friends at “Freedom Stitchers.”) They have the right to set up businesses, but are prevented in selling their artistry by the illegal blockade on their borders. 

We therefore intend to help set up this business for women in Gaza to market not only their exquisite embroidery, but to also enhance their artistic skills by teaching them how to knit, crochet, do silk ribbon embroidery, beadwork, felting, and other types of hand stitching for textile art which can then be sold.

The three of us organizers, Sinead MacLochlainn, Mary Hughes Thompson and Greta Berlin are long-time activists for justice in Palestine. You can read more about us on our bio page and on the website at www.freedomstitchers.org 

HOW YOU CAN HELP US

“Freedom Stitchers” will work to set up a trade route to import supplies and then export the finished products made by these women. This idea has worked in other countries, but because Gaza is occupied and blockaded, no one has ever tried to import yarn, needles and material and export the finished goods. “Freedom Stitchers” aims to change this by creating a Trade-not-Aid project. Donating to this project provides the raw materials for the art work, something that is very difficult for the women of Gaza to receive. Your donation will help us set up a micro-business and will enable the project to be video-taped and perhaps even live streamed. 

Your donations will help to enable these women to ‘Stitch for Freedom." Payments can be accepted by clicking on the CONTRIBUTE button that Indiegogo has set up for us. For more info or if you want to send us a check instead, contact us at donate@freedomstitchers.org or freedomstitchers@gmail.com 

or visit us at www.freedomstitchers.org 

DOCUMENTING THE PROJECT

The “Freedom Stitchers” group intends to videotape parts of our initial three-week project, as we set up and run workshops with various women’s groups. You will have the opportunity to meet via video, some of the women and women’s groups in Gaza who hope to benefit from the “Freedom Stitchers” empowerment project, hear their personal stories and get to know them. You can share in our workshops as the women progress towards self-sufficiency via their work, as we see them progress from raw materials to finished projects ready for export.

FREEDOM STITCHERS ETHOS

Seven years ago, we were told we would never be able to sail boats into Gaza. Of the five co-founders of the Free Gaza movement, four were women, Mary Hughes Thompson and Greta Berlin being the major organizers from the beginning. We proved the naysayers wrong, and we did set sail for Gaza. We believe in the power of women, we believe we can help to empower our sisters in Gaza to be more self-sufficient and generate a small income if we share our knowledge, abilities and skills, if we reach out and join our hands, and stitch for Freedom!

We know women can make a difference. We have done it already. We have sailed boats into Gaza. We have taken delegations into Gaza. We have organized and nagged and prodded and pulled dignitaries, members of civil society and journalists to come to Gaza and see what is happening. It’s not enough. The next step is to begin to empower, and who better than women to take up that task?

We want to raise $25,000 USD (£16,400) as start-up money for this project. The money will be spent as follows:

  1. Implementing the project for up to 5 women’s groups in Gaza
  2. Purchasing all supplies for project implementation for up to 5 women’s groups. e.g. yarn, embroidery ribbon,  embroidery threads, all sewing supplies, knitting needles and crochet hooks.
  3. Funding to cover the project, including shipping items to and from Gaza, duty fees and transfer fees and miscellaneous government fees.
  4. Shipping in five containers of yarn and needles, plus embroidery thread and other supplies, since many women cannot continue to embroider the beautiful Palestinian patterns for lack of raw materials. Embroidery thread is often not allowed into Gaza.
  5. Paying a Palestinian videographer from inside Gaza (hopefully a woman) and an editing suite to produce a documentary of the project from beginning to end.
  6. Website implementation, internet hosting for the sales site, design of logo and other creative work by Palestinians as needed.

Teach one …Make one…Market to the World  

Together we CAN make a difference in the lives of our Palestinian sisters, but we need your support and your donations to make it happen. Join with us. You will be part of a small business. You will be able to contribute in creating work for women in Gaza who might never have had the chance for any income.  So we ask all women and men around the world to support us, to follow us, to encourage us. To contribute to our project of breaking the siege, one woman at a time, through empowerment as we reach out our hands to our sisters in Gaza.

story:
What the heck is this Fit Body Boot Camp (FBBC) thing all about?

The short of it? It is the first Indoor Boot Camp.  It is also the exercise regime I’ve done for a year and one I wholeheartedly believe in.  As an educator at a school district I know what child obesity looks like that’s why I am also looking to use this as a way to help youth get in shape and be healthier. 

See, once I open my doors every year I am committed to sponsoring a total of four inner city youth who will pledge to take part in work outs four days per week for 12 weeks. So while I am raising money to start my own business I want to use my business to give back to young people and the surrounding community but I need your help to make it happen! 


Why Fit Body Boot Camp? 

Because as a member I believe in it.  I have seen people my age as well as 60-year-old grandmothers and grandfathers take part in the workouts and not only shed weight but also feel alive again. 

Because I believe our body is our temple and if we don’t take care of it, who will? 

Because I have what it takes to not just run a business but do it so well that every person who walks in through the door will be impacted by the services I provide. 

Because I want to continue to impact youth in a way that is meaningful and fills my soul yet allows me do what I am passionate about.

Because working out was what kept me sane in high school and in college.  No matter what dysfunction was going at home or in my life working out made everything better.

Because most importantly it is researched base. Fit Body Boot Camp offers workouts done in 30 minutes from warm up to cool down. The secret to the massive fat loss results that the client gets is due to the After Burn™  the workouts produce. At Fit Body Boot Camp each and every workout combines elements of high Intensity Interval Training, Exercise Stacking™ as well as Active Rest Periods making sure to give you the best possible workouts and most calories burned in every session.  These are all key components to creating the After Burn Effect.  The average Fit Body Boot Camp workout burns 600-1000 calories in under an hour - that's twice the calories burned over any other workout program out there. The elements that encompass a Boot Camp workout create the perfect physiological state for continuous calorie burn for up to 28 hours after a workout session. 

And because I honestly have dreamt of owning my business for as long as I can remember and it has taken me 15 years to figure out what that business should be, now that I have figured it out I am going all out to make this happen. 

Why $8,200?

My overall budget is $20,000, I am in need of $8,200 to make this dream come true.  The $8,200 will pay for equipment, marketing and finalize the purchase.  Once everything is final my doors will open within 90 days. 

What you'll get by giving to the Fit Body Boot Camp Start Up Project?

How about warm, fuzzy feelings, for starters? Or knowing that you are helping someone, who growing up couldn’t fathom this opportunity, to make her dream come true.  Not enough? Okay, check out the Perks and while you are doing that know that every dollar is getting me closer to opening my doors and eventually giving four to five inner-city youth, per year, an opportunity to get healthy.  Also consider this, for every youth and client I touch they will touch and influence someone in their household to become a bit healthier.  Eventually we will have dozens of people making healthier choices everyday and in time hundreds. 

Here's how you can help

First, PUNCH IN YOUR CREDIT CARD NUMBER. (Don’t worry I promise it will feel good.) Give $1 to $25 and you will get a BIG THANK YOU.  The truth is everybody will get a thank you BUT YOURS, YOURS will be EXTRA SPECIAL!

$50 and get a FBBC Water Bottle

$75 and get a T-shirt. You can wear it to workout in! :)

Or choose to sponsor a youth.  THIS will really make your heart all warm and fuzzy!!!

Equally, or perhaps more importantly, tell all your friends to give us their money. Seriously: spread the word! "Like" us on Facebook! Tweet something hilarious and/or heartfelt (bonus points for doing both in 140 characters).PLASTER the campaign link everywhere and anywhere.

Because as a member I believe in it.  I have seen people my age as well as
60-year-old grandmothers and grandfathers take part in the workouts and not
only shed weight but also feel alive again. 
Because I believe our body is our temple and if we don’t take
care of it, who will?  
Because I have what it takes to not just run a business but do
it so well that every person who walks in through the door will be impacted by the
services I provide.  
Because I want to continue to impact youth in a way that is
meaningful and fills my soul yet allows me do what I am passionate about. 
Because working out was what kept me sane in high school and in
college.  No matter what dysfunction was
going at home or in my life working out made everything better.Because most importantly it is researched base. Fit Body Boot Camp offers workouts done in 30 minutes from warm up to cool down. The secret to the massive fat loss results that the client gets is due to the After Burn™  the workouts produce. At Fit Body Boot Camp each and every workout combines elements of high Intensity Interval Training, Exercise Stacking™ as well as Active Rest Periods making sure to give you the best possible workouts and most calories burned in every session.  These are all key components to creating the After Burn Effect.  The average Fit Body Boot Camp workout burns 600-1000 calories in under an hour - that's twice the calories burned over any other workout program out there. The elements that encompass a Boot Camp workout create the perfect physiological state for continuous calorie burn for up to 28 hours after a workout session. And because I honestly have dreamt of owning my business for as
long as I can remember and it has taken me 15 years to figure out what that
business should be, now that I have figured it out I am going all out to make
this happen. Why $8,200?My overall budget is $20,000, I am in need of $8,200
to make this dream come true.  The $8,200
will pay for equipment, marketing and finalize the purchase.  Once everything is final my doors will open
within 90 days. 
What you'll get by giving to the Fit Body Boot Camp Start Up
Project?
How about warm, fuzzy feelings, for starters? Or knowing that
you are helping someone, who growing up couldn’t fathom this opportunity, to
make her dream come true.  Not enough?
Okay, check out the Perks and while you are doing that know that every dollar
is getting me closer to opening my doors and eventually giving four to five inner-city youth, per year, an opportunity to get healthy.  Also consider this, for every youth and client I touch they will touch
and influence someone in their household to become a bit healthier.  Eventually we will have dozens of people
making healthier choices everyday and in time hundreds.  
Here's how you can help
First, PUNCH IN YOUR CREDIT CARD NUMBER. (Don’t worry I promise
it will feel good.) Give $1 to $25 and you will get a BIG THANK YOU.  The truth is everybody will get a thank you BUT YOURS, YOURS will
be EXTRA SPECIAL! 
$50 and get a FBBC Water Bottle 
$75 and get a T-shirt. You can wear it to workout in! :)
Or choose to sponsor a youth. 
THIS will really make your heart all warm and fuzzy!!! 
Equally, or perhaps more importantly, tell all your friends to
give us their money. Seriously: spread the word! "Like" us on
Facebook! Tweet something hilarious and/or heartfelt (bonus points for doing
both in 140 characters).PLASTER the campaign link everywhere and anywhere.

story:
***TO COMPLY WITH INDIEGOGO'S POLICY AND TO PROTECT MY FAMILY'S PRIVACY, THIRD-PARTY NAMES HAVE BEEN CHANGED***

My name is Raul, I am currently a student at Concordia University in Montreal, Canada, and this is my cry for your help.

In 2008, my former stepfather (Horace) and my brother (Michael) co-signed for the purchase of a house in Laval, Quebec. The agreement was that my parents would make all mortgage payments and that my brother would only "lend his name" to have the mortgage loan approved, under the condition that his name would be removed in due time.

Things were relatively stable for 3 years and my mother managed to make ends meet with my parents' income. However in 2011, Horace decided he was tired of wearing a mask and he turned against us after 16 years of marriage and a family.

He cheated on my mom and asked her for divorce. The house was then put on sale to liberate my brother's name. In the meantime, Horace fell behind on all his payments, while working two jobs, claiming he had no money. This put a lot of pressure on my brother as he is equally responsible for the payments regarding the house. Horace kept the house in deplorable conditions, making the process of selling the house extremely difficult. He had also falsified my brother's signature for a personal loan of $9000. My brother found out two years later when the bank contacted him to claim a late payment. To conclude his heinous acts, Horace has recently declared bankruptcy, while still working full-time, washing his hands from all his responsibilities and leaving the ENTIRE burden on my brother, who will face legal prosecution if the payments are not made.

Despite all the pain and suffering we have endured, my brother has been incredibly diligent to maintain the proper legal processes. He was forced to learn about property law in order to protect himself.

At this point, we are very close to selling the house at last, much cheaper than its value, and we are losing an incredible sum of money that we don't have. Whether we sell or not, my family and I face expenses that require immediate attention.

This battle has been fought for two long years. It is a fight against injustice, a fight against evil. We haven’t lost hope for a resolution and we aren’t going to stop until we have won. However, we are only three people strong, and we can’t fight alone.

Help us win this fight. Your support will help us pay for insurance, school taxes, a large outstanding balance on the mortgage, and/or renovations for the house in the event that it does not sell.

I will be glad to provide updates, as the situation is constantly evolving, but PLEASE do not hesitate to contact me should you have any questions.

My e-mail is rerg15@hotmail.com (please write "LAVAL HOUSE" in the subject line) and my phone number is 514-927-5361.

From the bottom of our hearts, we are so very grateful for any and all help that you can offer. Don’t underestimate the difference you'll be making in our lives.

Other Ways You Can Help

By spreading the word, you are literally tilting the probabilities of success in our favor. If many people support us with a small amount, we will reach our goal in no time!

story:
A Legacy is not something you make for yourself, but the influence you’ve left on others.

That's part of how it started...  The sideways smile of our then pre-teen children learning how to take their first shots.  Finding it harder and harder to find range time for them or us to practice because there is nothing close where you'd be comfortable taking your child.  Recognizing, as a parent, that you look for a different type of range when you're involving your kids.  It's very different to get swept when it's just you...but when a total stranger sweeps your kid because they have not been taught the proper way to handle a firearm - it immediately becomes a different issue.

It became more and more evident that there really are not a lot of options for indoor ranges (good or bad) that were in close enough proximity to get as much practice time as we wanted.  In speaking with friends and relatives that are active or retired law enforcement or military, it was the same story...nothing close enough and finding time to practice (especially LEO) before qualifications are imminent.

As we travelled well over an hour to obtain our certifications from reputable trainers in a high caliber range, we spent most of that time discussing the need for something closer to us. 

 

What we're planning to build...

Our Legacy will be to bring a range closer to home for not just us, but the many pending members, local law enforcement, and Boy / Girl Scouts.  Our plan is to build more than a range; but a Guntry Club that will partner with local law enforcement, civilians, youth and adult groups.  Legacy Indoor Range and Armory will be state of the art - have the best of the best and eliminate the worst of the worst.

A project of this magnitude is not  inexpensive.  Finding banks and investors can be overwhelming due to the polarizing nature of the industry.  The area in which we are looking to build has nothing like this within 50 miles.  The needs of local law enforcement groups and civilians are great.  Already having obtained preliminary and final site plan approval for the property where we would like to build, we need people willing to believe in our vision and help us obtain the funding to move to the next step.

With over 20 years of shooting and archery experience between them, the founders, in addition to being NRA Certified Instructors, bring a background from multifaceted fields of expertise.  Andrew, a Tax Accountant by trade, and Melissa, a Process Improvement Expert, bring an extensive background in business, financial, and logistics operations experience.  As parents of children who enjoy both the shooting sports and archery, it became increasingly difficult to find suitable ranges that were the environment in which they wanted to teach their children.  Shooting sports in general is a vastly popular industry.  Women and children, in particular, represent the fastest growing demographic portions of the shooting sports industry.  Legacy and RBAC (property management company) will afford the community access to a state of the art indoor training facility that is safe, family friendly, clean, and reputable.

RBAC, by custom design, will build a facility for Legacy to provide local access to classrooms, onsite gunsmithing, retail firearms and accessories, trained firearm professionals, and specialized training for our local law enforcement.  In addition, our large training facility will provide the community an opportunity to utilize our indoor ranges, and classrooms for meeting and team building events, women’s only and children’s events, and private instruction.

 

How your funds can help...

Land:  We have found an excellent plot of land - just over 5 acres

Building:  New customized tilt up construction

Inventory:  Enough to build up roughly 5000 sq ft of an Armory

Range / Port Construction:  Best around.  Automated Targeting system; certain areas able to be dynamic for Law Enforcement drills.  50 ports in all + 25 archery lanes and a Shoot House for Law Enforcement.

State of the Art Ventilation System:  Air will be pulled in from the outside and filtered before being returned to the outside.  No recycled air in the ranges.

Classroom Media:  Flat screen displays for classes.  Controlled and standardized training materials.  Excellent trainers and firearm instructors.

The Impact...

By our building this easy, accessible, state of the art range, we are enabling many people the opportunity to properly educate themselves on how to use their firearm and then have a place to practice that is closer to home.  We are giving law enforcement and our military personnel a centralized location to train and practice using their firearm.  In addition, we will provide a different level of training to our local law enforcement and first responders.

Given the distance between our location and other indoor ranges, we will maximize your range time by reducing travel time to the range. 

Risks & Challenges

The largest risk in this industry is always the perception that our politicians will vote to remove our gun rights.  We keep this threat in perspective, of roughly 11,300 attempts to change our Constitution; only 27 Amendments have been passed.  In addition, constitutional analysts have shown that congress has repeatedly been unable to muster enough votes to evoke change to the 2nd amendment in general.  Lastly, each time there is a potential risk or discussion of additional gun control laws, gun sales ultimately thrive.

  • We hope to better educate people on their rights and strive to help people have the ability to talk about rights and infringement impact.
  • We will teach regular everyday people how to choose the proper firearm for them as well as giving them the opportunity to practice.
  • We will give law enforcement more opportunities to train to avoid accidental discharge.
  • We will provide tactical training to teach law enforcement an improved methodology for unique situations.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, get the word out!  Let other people know about Legacy...

We hope to better educate people on their rights and strive to help people have the ability to talk about rights and infringement impact.
We will teach regular everyday people how to choose the proper firearm for them as well as giving them the opportunity to practice.
We will give law enforcement more opportunities to train to avoid accidental discharge.
We will provide tactical training to teach law enforcement an improved methodology for unique situations.


Other Ways You Can Help

story:
Why we started..

Our campaign goal is to bring an innovative alternative to the fast growing food truck community to cities everywhere, but it won't just be a boring food van.  It will be a perfectly restored nostalgic VW bus outfitted with all the necessary equipment to bring healthy snacks and smoothies to customers near and far.  I grew up working on VW's and continue restoring them to this day, and the majority of the work on the van restoration will be done by myself and my company 'The Project Factory'.  We also hope to make the majority of the snacks for the van in-house with fresh, all natural ingredients. 

 

Where we started.. My name is Alex Fountain and I am the founder of Munchin' Around™.  By trade I am an industrial designer, which includes prototypes to production of retail products.  I also have vast experience in graphic and multimedia design, but overall I would say I'm a modern day inventor.  My creativity and passion for design stems from a family history of turning ideas into realities. My great-great-grandfather rubbed elbows with the likes of Henry Ford in Syracuse, NY in a little facility called Lipe- Brown Rollway. Google it :)   So, needless to say, all design work and restoration will be completed in-house.

I am joined by my wife, Shannon on this snack bus adventure.  She is a talented interior designer by day but a project enthusiast, like myself, at all times. 

Along side is my brother Kevin to help design and assist on day to day projects.

We have a strong crew of friends and family to help us along the way.  We're not alone.

How we'll do it..

 

    The money we raise from this campaign will go towards the purchase of the FIRST van to be restored.  Any money over what we hope to raise in our first goal will go towards the build-out and restoration of the van while investors are secured.   To start our dream of Munchin' Around™, we have a goal of $5000 to purchase the initial vehicle and begin the restoration. The first $3000-4000 will go to the purchase of the actual van, anything left over will be used to start the awesome build-out, which will include everything from brakes to paint, and freezers to blenders.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

What you'll get..

Our perks will be relatively simple, Sweatshirts, T-shirts and stickers.  There will be options of a Munchin' Around™ t-shirt and stickers AND also The Project Factory (our parent company) t-shirt and stickers.   Send us a message with your  SIZE CHOICE  (We would recommend adding a size as they run a little small)

  There will be 2 larger perks which are very limited.  Check them out on the right side bar above.

Join Us on this New Adventure!

 

 

 

 

 

PERKS

story:
Hi everyone, 

My name is Priscilla, I am trying building my dream and fulfilling my life's work:  to open my fantastic ethnic shop!

This shop will be a place where everyone can feel at home and find something that makes him happy; 

often, during weekends, there will be also a lot of yoga classes and different workshops to learn meditation and flexibility.


To realize all of this I need your help;

I want to create a beautiful community and strong friendship; a place that encourage intercultural knowledge and exchange, to promote peace in our society. I know that my work can be only a small thing, but I believe in it and it could be a start.

I need 40,000€ to get this dream off the ground. The money will go towards start up supplies such as a logo, forniture, restructuration and goods.


EtnicoMix Vintage Shop hopes to reach its goal by the end of August, to open  by the end of October, since I want to open the shop this year. With your support my dream can come true and is sure to be a succes!

The money I raise with this campaign will be used towards opening my EtnicoMix shop from the ground up.

I want to be in full construction of the premises by late July this year and I aim to open by November 2015 - January 2016. My plan is also to have all the merchandise available to buy from me and from an online store at my website.


              


Dear supporters, every single Euro helps my cause and I appreciate all your support, but if you can't afford to contribute money, you can still help me greatly by sharing this campaign with with all your friends and family in social media and all over the internet. This will help raise awareness for this campaign and ultimately help raise money for the shop. 

Here’s a few ways how you can help:

you can help me out:

Like on Facebook

Follow on Twitter

 Share my link to your friends and family. Here is the short link you can use: 

http://igg.me/at/etnicomixproject/x/11036961

Write a blog

Comment and give me feedback, let's perfect this idea together


                                                       

WHAT KIND OF ARTICLES DO YOU SELL?

my proposal is quite varied: from typical clothing of cultures like the kimono and haori, or traditional Indian skirt, pants with African wax print etc .. to the objects for the house up to the piece of furniture of medium / large size or silver jewelry with semiprecious stones in ethnic style.

The underlying theme of all is the reuse of used items, avoid waste and give new life to things vintage.

WHAT KIND OF EVENTS WOULD YOU MAKE?

I would like to create different types of events all aimed to learn more about the customs and traditions of different peoples; then there may be mere seminars, but also evenings where you will learn, for example, the famous Japanese tea ceremony, or a full day of yoga to go also to organize a simple aperitif but with specialty of a distant country or tribal dances.

HAVE YOU THOUGHT OF MAKING A CARD TO SUBSCRIBE TO THE EVENTS?

surely there will be, I just have to open the store and start contacting cultural associations!

AND FOR THE FUTURE?

I plan to add some handmade products such as jewelry designed and assembled by me and also for body care products entirely organic.

--------------------------------------------------

                                                

I have a wide array of perks / rewards for you to choose from. I will be adding more perks for you shortly. 


Please share this with all your friends and family.


Thankyou so much!

Many blessing

Priscilla Manari

Please share this with all your friends and family.

Thankyou so much!
Many blessing
Priscilla Manari

story:
“When it is understood that one loses joy and happiness in the attempt to possess them, the essence of natural farming will be realized. The ultimate goal of farming is not the growing of crops, but the cultivation and perfection of human beings.”  -Masanobu Fukuoka.

"You are what you eat!" So eat right!

How long it had been that you had a juicy apple? Ever wondered why mangoes in market nowadays doesn’t taste the same as you had them in childhood?

The way of farming makes all the difference. We are practicing only chemical farming now.

So, now the billion-dollar question arises…. Can’t we really practice organic farming and still have the same productivity?

The answer is Yes, Its Possible!!!  Its high time we shift to organic farming!!!

About Us:

Team

We – Vinoth Kumar & Raja S Pandian will be doing this project and need to travel at least 6 to 8 months to finish it.

Vinoth Kumar

Hi , I'm Vinoth Kumar, an organic farmer.  I’ve studied Electrical Engineering and Masters in Human Resource Management. I’ve worked for 6 years in different corporate companies like Allsec Technologies, Zoho Corporation , Groupon & Standard Chartered bank.




I’ve given up my corporate jobs to do full time Organic Farming and I’ve spoken to lot of farmers and convinced them to practice Organic Farming. I come from a agricultural family, we have been doing farming since many decades here in Cheyur. We are so full of pesticides that we no longer know what is good for our health.



When I started Organic Farming, the access to the organic and traditional methods was very difficult, because they were not documented properly. All the information are restricted to specific area. I had to travel a lot to visit lot of farmers, especially old people and collect a lot of information about the traditional methods which they followed 30 to 40 years ago. I got brilliant results when I applied them in my farm and I really would like to share them with as many people as possible.

Raja S Pandian

Not everyone's turning point in life starts with turtles. I am lucky to be among that clan, which made me meet different people and helped me carry myself towards different experiences through these people. I work as a volunteer for SSTCN to conserve turtles in coast of Chennai. I also work to regulate the waste management issue of the city by being part of Paperman. Backpacking happened between all this. I am constantly finding ways to add meaning to my travel trips by giving back to the society. My next travel plan will be on the same. To travel for a cause, to travel to document the practice of sustainable agriculture and to promote it across South east Asia.


Mission of this project:

We want to take this to the next level, after successfully doing Organic Farming and converting people to do Organic farming in Cheyur, we feel the importance of documentation of Organic farming, Traditional Methods and the need for Sustainable Living which are fast disappearing. It is important that we eat healthy and stay healthy, the poison pumped in most of the farms are slowly killing us and most importantly destroying our planet.

Phase 1 - India :



Phase 2 - South East Asia :



We have planned to " CYCLE " to across South East Asian countries like Srilanka, Indonesia, Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Laos, Cambodia, Vietnam, Myanmar, Bangladesh and Bhutan. India has a strong cultural relation with these countries and we would like to take it as an advantage to document their traditional practices.

We have traveled extensively in India, Nepal & Bhutan to meet many farmers. We will also be meeting many more farmers, students in schools, Universities. We strongly believe that the messages conveyed to kids are like seeds sown in the soil. It will definitely grow and create a forest!

We feel travelling and meeting people as a vital tool in creating people’s movement and to address or spread knowledge on organic farming and sustainable living.

We have documented the traditional methods followed in different parts of India, Nepal and Bhutan. Once we are back in India, we will release the documentation as a book and a soft copy. We will also setup a place in my farm where everyone from across the world can come and practice Organic farming.

 How you can contribute:

1.)  Please talk to as many people as possible, friends , colleagues , relatives and tell them the importance of Organic food or ask them to follow our page in Facebook I will explain to them.

2.)  Please extend your support by contributing as much as you can!

3.)  Start practicing organic farming and sustainable living.

story:
Can you imagine?

Can you imagine being a baker and always needing to borrow a mixer, or what about a carpenter without a saw, or a fisherman without a boat? Well for the past seven years, we at The Food Initiative have been farmers with no tractor. We have been fortunate to borrow a tractor when needed, but we really need a tractor dedicated to the farm work. While we have been able to produce thousands of pounds of produce with the help of volunteers and our summer youth workers, this tractor will increase our growth exponentially. If you have ever farmed, you know what its like to work against time and the weather. We need the right equipment to get the job done in those tight seasonal windows. The right equipment makes it possible to stay ahead in the spring which allows us to stay on schedule throughout the growing season. All of our production and our educational programs revolve around the farm and it is essential that the work be done timely, be done well, and be done correctly. 

 


What We Need:

We are seeking $9,000 to purchase a tractor. We already have $12,000 dedicated to this purchase from a generous grant from the CMC Community Health Foundation, however, in order to purchase this tractor we need the additional $9,000. These funds will allow us to purchase a 36 horse power tractor with a front end loader. We have searched and talked to experts in the industry and this tractor will have the capacity to tackle all of our tasks on the farm. Tasks like plowing, cultivating, bed preparation, mowing, scooping, maintaining gravel driveways, and other essential tasks to maintain the farm site and produce healthy foods. All funds raised will go towards this tractor and any additional funds will help to purchase implements. This tractor is a necessary tool to move TFI forward. 

The Impact:

We have operated a successful, sustainable farm for seven years now that has produced thousands of pounds of organically grown produce. This has been accomplished on less than three-quarters of an acre with limited access to a tractor. We are now ready to employ this new tool to develop and expand our operation on our new twelve acre site. This will increase our supply of fresh produce for this community that will be distributed at local markets, our CSA program, and through local hunger relief organizations. Expanded production will also allow for expanded educational opportunities for our high school youth workers, elementary school trips, our partnership with Austin Peay State University, and other groups. Expanded production also allows for increased revenue streams that support all of our educational and outreach programs. This helps to create not only a sustainable garden ecologically but also financially. 


Risks & Challenges:

Farming is a continuos learning process. Every season is different. Even with this new tractor, we will not reach our maximum potential next year, or the next year, and probably not even the year after that. While to some that might sound discouraging, to us that sounds like opportunity. Each year, we learn how to better care for the farm and how to better utilize our tools. We are excited to employ a tractor that will help us to continue to improve our production and our care for the land. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We need all hands on deck to make this possible. If everyone of our social media followers would give towards this effort, it would take less than $10 a person to surpass our goal. We are asking you to give what you can. Share our story and make some noise for us. The Food Initiative is here for our community and we are here because of our community. Help us reach our goal!
