story:
OLOIMUGI TRADITIONAL MAASAI ECOVILLAGE

Oloimugi Traditional Maasai ecovillage ,is a new project which has been started in ISIOLO COUNTY of Kenya.As a Maasai warrior,who despite going to school has maintained his traditions and culture;i felt it important to bring the lost chemistry,friendliness between human beings and wildlife back.It is much disheartening that the menace of poaching has continued to put our world in the risk of wildlife extinction.The number of rhinos and elephants estimatedly in our country is decreasing every second.This has been caused by the poor relationship environment;involving residents living around the wildlife regions and wildlife.Community no longer owns conservation of wildlife as it used to do before.The government and other stakeholders have left community in matters wildlife protection,which has given poachers a gap to sneak through and butcher our wild animals.

WHAT IS OLOIMUGI  VILLAGE ABOUT?

This is a Maasai village which brings all members of the community together,through culture and traditional dance.All is aimed to bring conservation our wildlife as a matter of priority.The structure of the village is supposed to be circular in shape,with traditional Maasai huts.There will be accomodation for our guests who would like to spend wit us in the village;either as tourists or volunteers to help in wildlife and general environmental conservation.Maasai people are known for their outstanding and stylish,unique culture.Many people have always wanted to experience it at its best and this is the best place to have that;we plan to organize traditional Maasai weddings,rites of passage and many other cultural things that were and are still practiced in Maasailand.So,we welcome people from all the world to visit this grand project and have the best experience of a life time,.

It is my plan to bring members of the community together under my project.There are special conservation education program-mes which i am planning to develop covering all members ,starting from young children,adults and the elderly members.This will go a long way in making sure that the entire community is aware about conservation and why it is important.

Already,i have been able to identify a group of Maasai warriors who will specifically deal with conservation of wildlife.The team is composed of 25 members and will spread the message of conservation,through traditional dance and culture.In this, i intend to reach the youth.They are very important in this campaign,since they are ones being paid cheap and misused by big poaching cartels,to go to the bush and slaughter our wildlife.The same group of warriors will also preach peace,healing and reconciliation so that we can have a tranquil society that lives in harmony across the country;hence be able to look after the valuable,pride and heritage(wildlife)The same dance project can benefit youth through employment since,they can visit hotels,tour resorts offer entertainment and get pay.This will reduce the idleness among the youth which has always made them turn to illegal acts like;drugs,violence with robbery and Poaching.

Campsite project:This particular region is endowed with a lot of resources;a beautiful scenery and wildlife.However,it is sad to note that this community here is still lingering in poverty while they have resources with untapped potential that can be turned into cash and help earn a descent living.The Maasai community here,is continuing to depend on pastoral ism as a way of earning  life,something which is not able enough to sustain their lives.The huge cloud of poverty has made them desperate,hunt  animals in the bush because of lacking food and also some of them secretly collaborating with poachers from other places of course under cheap pay to destroy our wildlife.It is my plan therefore to have this campsite project,where tourists can visit,eat,camp,have camel rides and cultural experience.The income generated will go to help the community in starting empowerment programmes;improving health facilities and education.So disheartening to that pregnant mothers here,walk more than 5 kilometres to the nearest health center.small children also walk long distances to few,under-resourced schools in an environment full of wild animals like elephants,leopards,lions etc.Funds from the campsite and donations from willing friends will help improve such services.Employment opportunities will also crop up  e.g room attendants,shop keepers,tour guides,chefs,drivers ,house keepers etc.This will go a long way in reducing poverty and  motivating locals to own up conservation of wildlife,since there are benefits associated with it.

Beadwork project..Maasai people are known to have the best ,excellent ,colourful bead work in the world.It is made by women and small girls in the village.Under my project, i plan to bring all women together,,form a group and create an account under the ecovillage umbrella.They will be making their products and i will liase with friends to  help source local and international markets.Those women will get empowerment through the money generated from the work of their hands as opposed;to being dependent on their husbands who have nothing enough to give,apart from sharing poverty.Conservation still is the main priority since,from the benefits,the women will realise that it is the same wild animals that have brought them together for fruitful projects as such.

In short,there are many good things that am planning for the community.It is just a matter of time and support from willing friends;that will make it a success.

At the moment,i have just rolled out the project.There is much to be done,especially the first phase of building Maasai huts in the village.With your support,i will be able to start the building the first phase of 20 Maasai huts;paying and feeding the workers.Also equipping the village with necessary items like solar panel installation ,water tank purchase .etc.

Let us move!It is time to conserve nature for peace and sustainability......!!!


 

What We Need & What You Get

For a  start,we need 5000 US Dollars.

USD 2400-Labour cost

10 workers for 3O days,each paid 8 dollars a day

10x30x8=2,400USD

USD 900-FOOD

10 workers for 30 days,each spending 3 dollars a day

USD 1000-PURCHASE OF TENTS &KITCHEN STUFF

USD 700-FENCING OF THE SITE,PURCHASE OF A SOLAR PANEL,WATER TANK,2 COMPUTERS,2 CAMERAS and TRANSPORT COST.

What do you get in return?

As a friend we will design the best cards for you with beautiful wildlife photos.Also send you great photos of  the outstanding nature,that will make your walls colorful.Under your request,since in the Maasai village we plan to make bead-work;we could avail some as a gift for your kind contribution.If you have a business,we could advertise for you here in our school visits and community forums across the country.


The Impact

Your donation,will surely make an impact in the whole world;not here alone.!When we have an empowered and educated community,it will learn to treasure and value wildlife,hence cases of poaching will decline.Wildlife is important to the environment through the carbon cycle.It is also an admirable thing to be walking in a world of beauty,where one can see different types of animals.Yes!such projects as this,have had much impact in the community and a good example is the Northern Rangelands Trust,which has managed to work with communities across Kenya on the issue of paching;and so far,there is much that can be celebrated.This is real,happening and impacting!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Sharing and spreading the message about our campaign,and reach as many people as possible.This could be through the social media;facebook,twitter etc.
  • Kindy remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
OLOIMUGI TRADITIONAL MAASAI ECOVILLAGEOloimugi Traditional Maasai ecovillage ,is a new project which has been started in ISIOLO COUNTY of Kenya.As a Maasai warrior,who despite going to school has maintained his traditions and culture;i felt it important to bring the lost chemistry,friendliness between human beings and wildlife back.It is much disheartening that the menace of poaching has continued to put our world in the risk of wildlife extinction.The number of rhinos and elephants estimatedly in our country is decreasing every second.This has been caused by the poor relationship environment;involving residents living around the wildlife regions and wildlife.Community no longer owns conservation of wildlife as it used to do before.The government and other stakeholders have left community in matters wildlife protection,which has given poachers a gap to sneak through and butcher our wild animals.WHAT IS OLOIMUGI  VILLAGE ABOUT?This is a Maasai village which brings all members of the community together,through culture and traditional dance.All is aimed to bring conservation our wildlife as a matter of priority.The structure of the village is supposed to be circular in shape,with traditional Maasai huts.There will be accomodation for our guests who would like to spend wit us in the village;either as tourists or volunteers to help in wildlife and general environmental conservation.Maasai people are known for their outstanding and stylish,unique culture.Many people have always wanted to experience it at its best and this is the best place to have that;we plan to organize traditional Maasai weddings,rites of passage and many other cultural things that were and are still practiced in Maasailand.So,we welcome people from all the world to visit this grand project and have the best experience of a life time,.It is my plan to bring members of the community together under my project.There are special conservation education program-mes which i am planning to develop covering all members ,starting from young children,adults and the elderly members.This will go a long way in making sure that the entire community is aware about conservation and why it is important.Already,i have been able to identify a group of Maasai warriors who will specifically deal with conservation of wildlife.The team is composed of 25 members and will spread the message of conservation,through traditional dance and culture.In this, i intend to reach the youth.They are very important in this campaign,since they are ones being paid cheap and misused by big poaching cartels,to go to the bush and slaughter our wildlife.The same group of warriors will also preach peace,healing and reconciliation so that we can have a tranquil society that lives in harmony across the country;hence be able to look after the valuable,pride and heritage(wildlife)The same dance project can benefit youth through employment since,they can visit hotels,tour resorts offer entertainment and get pay.This will reduce the idleness among the youth which has always made them turn to illegal acts like;drugs,violence with robbery and Poaching.Campsite project:This particular region is endowed with a lot of resources;a beautiful scenery and wildlife.However,it is sad to note that this community here is still lingering in poverty while they have resources with untapped potential that can be turned into cash and help earn a descent living.The Maasai community here,is continuing to depend on pastoral ism as a way of earning  life,something which is not able enough to sustain their lives.The huge cloud of poverty has made them desperate,hunt  animals in the bush because of lacking food and also some of them secretly collaborating with poachers from other places of course under cheap pay to destroy our wildlife.It is my plan therefore to have this campsite project,where tourists can visit,eat,camp,have camel rides and cultural experience.The income generated will go to help the community in starting empowerment programmes;improving health facilities and education.So disheartening to that pregnant mothers here,walk more than 5 kilometres to the nearest health center.small children also walk long distances to few,under-resourced schools in an environment full of wild animals like elephants,leopards,lions etc.Funds from the campsite and donations from willing friends will help improve such services.Employment opportunities will also crop up  e.g room attendants,shop keepers,tour guides,chefs,drivers ,house keepers etc.This will go a long way in reducing poverty and  motivating locals to own up conservation of wildlife,since there are benefits associated with it.Beadwork project..Maasai people are known to have the best ,excellent ,colourful bead work in the world.It is made by women and small girls in the village.Under my project, i plan to bring all women together,,form a group and create an account under the ecovillage umbrella.They will be making their products and i will liase with friends to  help source local and international markets.Those women will get empowerment through the money generated from the work of their hands as opposed;to being dependent on their husbands who have nothing enough to give,apart from sharing poverty.Conservation still is the main priority since,from the benefits,the women will realise that it is the same wild animals that have brought them together for fruitful projects as such.In short,there are many good things that am planning for the community.It is just a matter of time and support from willing friends;that will make it a success.At the moment,i have just rolled out the project.There is much to be done,especially the first phase of building Maasai huts in the village.With your support,i will be able to start the building the first phase of 20 Maasai huts;paying and feeding the workers.Also equipping the village with necessary items like solar panel installation ,water tank purchase .etc.Let us move!It is time to conserve nature for peace and sustainability......!!! What We Need & What You GetFor a  start,we need 5000 US Dollars.USD 2400-Labour cost10 workers for 3O days,each paid 8 dollars a day10x30x8=2,400USDUSD 900-FOOD10 workers for 30 days,each spending 3 dollars a dayUSD 1000-PURCHASE OF TENTS &KITCHEN STUFFUSD 700-FENCING OF THE SITE,PURCHASE OF A SOLAR PANEL,WATER TANK,2 COMPUTERS,2 CAMERAS and TRANSPORT COST.What do you get in return?As a friend we will design the best cards for you with beautiful wildlife photos.Also send you great photos of  the outstanding nature,that will make your walls colorful.Under your request,since in the Maasai village we plan to make bead-work;we could avail some as a gift for your kind contribution.If you have a business,we could advertise for you here in our school visits and community forums across the country.The ImpactYour donation,will surely make an impact in the whole world;not here alone.!When we have an empowered and educated community,it will learn to treasure and value wildlife,hence cases of poaching will decline.Wildlife is important to the environment through the carbon cycle.It is also an admirable thing to be walking in a world of beauty,where one can see different types of animals.Yes!such projects as this,have had much impact in the community and a good example is the Northern Rangelands Trust,which has managed to work with communities across Kenya on the issue of paching;and so far,there is much that can be celebrated.This is real,happening and impacting!Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
Sharing and spreading the message about our campaign,and reach as many people as possible.This could be through the social media;facebook,twitter etc.
Kindy remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

Fox, a young adult in Orlando, FL, is disabled and in need of a service dog to become fully independent. Currently sleeping on a friend's couch, this early 20-something year old is not the type to ask for handouts and instead prefers to work for any assistance given. That is why we have started Fox's Fantasy, for it is their fantasy to make enough money selling their chainmaille crafts to support themselves and gain independence. However we can't get this started on our own!


What We Need & What You Get

You know the saying, "It takes money to make money," and this is very true for us here. To begin selling our chainmaille, we'll need to buy our supplies in bulk, set up branding for ourselves, register the business for tax purposes, and afford table fees at local conventions. 

In return for helping us reach our goals, you'll be really storing up some sweet, sweet karma for yourselves. You'll be filled with joy knowing you're helping an unfortunate soul reach their simple goals. You'll also get some rad chainmaille gear that will be custom woven just for you! 

If we don't reach our entire goal, we wont give up! Every last penny would still go right back into the company to sustain itself and we will focus on online sales and grow from there.

*Sorry, but we are unable to ship overseas unless you are able to pay for shipping.

The Impact

I'm not sure I'll ever be able to describe what giving someone hope looks like, but please know that this is making a huge difference in this kid's life. Even if you make just a $1 donation, that is one more person that believes in them, and that means the world. 

Fox also fully intends to give back as much as they can to both the crowdfunding communities and other youth in need. The message, "It gets better" needs to be spread far and wide from people that have really struggled, and it can start here.


Risks & Challenges

Because of Fox's disabilities there will be days that they are unable to work as much due to days stuck in bed or extended stays in the hospital. However we have been quite generous in the amount of time we expect items to be finished. So more often than not customers will end up getting their items early! 

We also worry that we wont reach our goal and wont be able to make as much on each piece due to not being able to buy in bulk. While this mean we wont be able to afford convention table fees, we will still be able to offer Fox's pieces on websites like Etsy. 


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out! Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, etc. (Indiegogo has great built in share tools)
  • Volunteer time, food, or clothing to your local youth (<24) shelter. This may not help us directly, but there are still lots of other kids out there that need the same hope!

Pattern and Color Options for Jewelry



Bonus Super Vibrant Colors if $3,000 is Reached!

Bonus Design options if Goal is Reached!



Limited Designs

story:
Je me présente je m'appelle Stéphane et je suis préposer au bénéficiaire en santé mental pourquoi en santé mental parce que se sont des personnes vrais avec qui ont se doit d'être vrais sinon on ne pourra jamais les approcher et crée un lien confiance,et  ce que j'aime par dessus tout ses que jamais il te jugeront a ton apparence,mais bien au petit geste du quotidien qui améliore leurs destin,je suis une personne qui croit au karma donne au suivant,aide ton prochain,est ma ligne de conduite,et indiegogo est apparue wowww chapeau une communauté qui s'entraide j'adore.

j ai un dicton que j ai pris d'une chansons de un de mes artiste que j'apprécie bcp qui dit que (l'amour ses comme du sucre a la crème quand tu en veut tu en fait) loin de moi de vouloir faire pitié mais du a un diagnostique de mon médecin bientôt je devrai réorienter ma carrière et le choix était plus que restreint.et je doit subvenir au besoin de ma belle et grande famille.

J'ai toujours aimer les publicité,et les documentaires un jours mon beaux-frère ma montrer un mini drone,wow après quelque recherche sur les drone je me suis vite aperçus,de toute les possibilités que pouvait offrir les drone,en publicité,pour les mariages,faire des documentaires d'une façons original et exceptionnelle,et plus encore

– surveillance de quartier et de parc protégé

– surveillance et contrôle des voies maritimes, des clandestins mais aussi détection des pollutions ;

– surveillance des oléoducs, gazoducs, lignes à haute tension ;

– missions de sécurité civile (surveillance du trafic routier, des manifestations, protection des zones réservées ou interdites, évaluation des catastrophes naturelles...) ;

– inspection des ouvrages d'art tels les ponts, les viaducs, les barrages ;

– épandages agricoles, surveillance des zones cultivées ;

– relais de communication.

 -Journalistique couvrir les événement

.Aide au secours,au personne perdu en foret, agriculture, surveillance de la pollution : les potentialités du drone sont très nombreuses

Les drones peuvent également embarquer de multiples capteurs, ce qui les rend capables d'effectuer toutes sortes de relevés. En Chine, les autorités envisagent d'en utiliser pour traquer les industries trop polluantes. Dans un tout autre domaine, on peut utiliser ces avions intelligents pour connaître la date idéale d'une récolte. 
         D'autre part, l'absence de pilote rend possible l'emploi des drone sans pilote dans les situations critiques, comme à Fukushima, où les autorités japonaises ont ainsi utilisé des drones pour effectuer des relevés depuis la zone interdite. Dans les Landes, les pompiers se sont dotés d'un drone pour mieux surveiller l'avancée des feux.
         Les solutions présentées ici ne sont qu'un petit aperçu des possibilités d'utilisation des drones dans un cadre civil. De manière générale les drones peuvent être utilisés avec profit pour remplacer l'homme dans une multitude de tâches rentrant dans la catégorie des 3D (dirty, dull, dangerous = sale, ennuyeuse ou dangereuse). Les UAV peuvent être utile pour des relevés environnementaux, pour la cartographie, pour le transport de marchandises et dans de nombreux autres domaines. La liste des secteurs pouvant bénéficier de l'apport de ces petites merveilles n'a sans doute pas fini de s'allonger.Ce moyen est une alternative à la surveillance par satellite a moindre coût les drone sont l'avenir.

Je promet que peut importe le montant amasser tout cette argent serviras que a acheter l'équipement nécessaire a la création d'une petite entreprise et pour maximiser votre investissement nous magasineront les prix les moins cher car du matériel neuf nous coûterais pratiquement le double du montant demander.Notre futur entreprise servira la population sous tout les angle possible L'argent amasser servira a acheter 3 drones,un portable  avec des programme pour les montages vidéo,un drone professionnelle le dji s1000  (si possible) avec nacelle 3 axe muni d'une bonne caméras celui la servira aux documentaires ,aux publicités  pour les compagnies et a l'arpentage de terrain et aux personnes perdue en forêt,policier ,pompier et plus encore,et deux autre drones quand même de bonne qualité qui serviront  pour les mariages,les festivals,ou immortaliser une partie de chasse ou de pèche de façons original et peut être un drone a la location.
Même que les 2 a 3 première année je garderai mon emploie pour m'assurer de ne pas manquer d'argent, j'aurai  un partenaire qui est un grand ami une personne que je respecte énormément et travailleras sur notre page web qui est présentement en construction et sera a part entière avec moi ,et nous auront surement un employer a temps partiel au début.
Alors pour finir un gros merci a tous ceux et celle qui croiront en moi et m'aideront dans mon projet qui seras aussi le votre en quelque sorte .
Et qui ses je sauverai peut être un jours un membre de votre famille perdu en foret on ses jamais ce que la vie nous réserve,sur ce bonne fin de journée a tous,même pour ceux qui ne pourront m'aider financièrement faite passer sur les réseau sociaux donner au suivant ses tellement important

Why are we crowdfunding?

Zion Lutheran Church in Pittsfield, Massachusetts is in the midst of a $600,000 capital campaign to raise funds to restore our historic 1892 sanctuary and transform it into a fully accessible, safe, energy-efficient, and flexible community space, the first of its kind in the Berkshires. 

Just imagine: a fully-accessible room (open to everyone!) with vibrant stained glass windows, gorgeous hardwood flooring, and a perfect wainscoted ceiling, partnered with a new, efficient heating system and air-conditioning system, audio-visual hookups, WiFi access, a moveable grand piano, an impressive pipe organ, superb acoustics, and moveable chairs, tables, and platforms that can be configured and adapted for nearly any event.

We need your help! Your contribution to this crowdfunding campaign will help make this sanctuary a community sanctuary: your support will help us replace our fixed pews with comfortable, moveable chairs, as well as add the portable tables, platforms, and other flexible furnishings we need in the space to maximize its community-building potential.

If our capital campaign is successful, the sanctuary at Zion Lutheran Church will become an unparalleled place for the community to gather in downtown Pittsfield. It will become a sanctuary in the truest sense—a place of refuge and a place for community unlike any other in the Berkshires.

The Impact: an unparalleled community space

Our vision is a brilliant sanctuary that will be accessible to everyone and completely flexible for a wide variety of community events and activities—and not just a large Easter Sunday worship service or a festive wedding celebration or an intimate Jazz Vespers service—but so much more.

Here are some of our latest ideas as we imagine the possibilities:

• How about an educational (and fun!) movie night co-sponsored by a local nonprofit? But instead of in a cinder block auditorium, how about under the canopy of a gorgeous hardwood ceiling? With a huge parking lot right across the street?

• How about hosting theater rehearsals? And theater performances? With the comfortable chairs and portable platforms right where the director needs them? How about theatre in the round?

• How about a community food and toiletry bank right in our sanctuary, where everyone from the community is welcome? 

• How about a choral or orchestra concert in the summer? When it's 90 degrees outside? We'll have air-conditioning! :)

• How about a co-working space, where writers, visual artists, graphic designers, and many more creatives can work, collaborate, and dream in a friendly space?

• How about transforming our sanctuary into a true sanctuary—meaning a fully accessible place of refuge and place for community? You can help make this happen in downtown Pittsfield!

The Perks: Thank you for your support!

Here are the current perks—more will be added throughout the campaign!

$30 - A cool, collectible trivet!

A beautiful tile trivet depicting the first Zion Lutheran Church building (1860) to add to your dining table.

$30 - Indulgences! (no, really)

You'll receive a small package of sweet indulgences (yes, we mean cookies!) from our awesome team of bakers.











$60 - Awesome postcards!

Receive a set of assorted postcards, including the one pictured above, that depict historic photos of Zion Lutheran Church and Pittsfield Common. Own a piece of Pittsfield history, then share with friends!

$80 - Book of indulgences + a bonus!

You'll receive a booklet of a few of our favorite sweets recipes, including the amazing cookies pictured here... and, as a bonus, we'll even include the winning recipe from the 2014 Zion Lutheran Chili Cook-off!

$100 - A pair of engraved beer mugs!

From the church that brought Beer & Hymns to Pittsfield, two beer mugs (or wine glasses!) engraved with the Zion Lutheran logo and great beer-related quotes from Martin Luther himself :)

$250 - Set of six engraved beer mugs!

What a deal! A set of six beer mugs (or wine glasses)! 

$250 - A pew! (no, really)

We'll give you one of our pews (10' 7") that will soon be replaced by movable chairs. Perfect for your porch, backyard, or basement! You have to come get it yourself, but we'll do our best to help :)

$350 - A longer pew! (no, really)

We'll give you one of our longer pews (12') that will soon be replaced by movable chairs. Also perfect for your porch or basement! You have to come get it yourself, and we'll still do our best to help!

$2,500 - Beer & _______ in your honor!

Beer & Hymns is an awesome sing along event held at a restaurant in Pittsfield (usually Baba Louie's Pizza). As the donor, you get to help pick the date, help choose the theme (Beer & ????), AND the proceeds from the free-will offering will go to benefit a Berkshire county nonprofit of your choice! These will be scheduled in the order of gifts received.

$5,000 - Pastor Tim will play for you!

Pastor Tim will play a public organ recital! As the donor, you get to help pick the date, consult on the repertoire, AND the proceeds from the free-will offering will go to benefit a Berkshire county nonprofit of your choice!

Two helpful hints about perks: 1) please note that receiving a perk reduces the tax-deductibility of a gift, so if you don’t want a perk, you don’t need to request one; 2) we can be flexible on perks: for example, if you want to donate $100, but would like the $80 perk instead, that’s fine! Just let us know!

Who is Zion Lutheran Church?

Zion Lutheran Church of Pittsfield is a congregation of the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America (ELCA), one of the largest progressive Christian denominations in the United States. Together with nearly 10,000 congregations and over 4.5 million members, we share a “living, daring confidence in God's grace.”

We worship weekly on Sundays, and on Thursday evenings we host Jazz Vespers, blending elements of modern jazz, blues, and gospel with the centuries-old tradition of evening prayer. Our children come to know God through our faith formation ministries; our youth love the ELCA Youth Gathering. We sing hymns at Baba Louie’s Pizza to raise funds for local charitable organizations. This is how we build community: we gather, we get to know one another, and we discover that we are stronger together than we are apart.

We collaborate with and support organizations who love the Berkshires as much as we do. We partner with and host several nonprofits, including the Barrington Stage Company, Berkshire Music School, Berkshire Concert Choir, Stockbridge Sinfonia, Downtown Pittsfield Farmers Market, and 12-step groups. We support the Christian Center, the Elizabeth Freeman Center, and Soldier On, as well as people around the world through ELCA World Hunger and ELCA Disaster Response.

One last thing (a friendly caveat)

Because Zion Lutheran Church is an active church community, we function like a church community: decisions are not made unilaterally by its board of directors, or its pastor, but by the congregation as a whole. If we don't reach our fundraising goals, or if our funding dries up or doesn't come through, it's possible that we won't fulfill our vision as it's described here. 

It's also possible that the amount we raise here will exceed what we need for flexible furnishings (how exciting would that be?!) In any case, please know that any donations to this crowdfunding campaign that can't be used to purchase moveable chairs and other flexible furnishings will be directed to a newly-established fund to support community initiatives in the City of Pittsfield.

As you consider whether to give, we ask that you trust us—as we trust God—that a place for community sanctuary will come about in downtown Pittsfield.

$2,500 - Beer & _______ in your honor!
Beer & Hymns is an awesome sing along event held at a restaurant in Pittsfield (usually Baba Louie's Pizza). As the donor, you get to help pick the date, help choose the theme (Beer & ????), AND the proceeds from the free-will offering will go to benefit a Berkshire county nonprofit of your choice! These will be scheduled in the order of gifts received.


$5,000 - Pastor Tim will play for you!
Pastor Tim will play a public organ recital! As the donor, you get to help pick the date, consult on the repertoire, AND the proceeds from the free-will offering will go to benefit a Berkshire county nonprofit of your choice!
Two helpful hints about perks: 1) please note that receiving a perk reduces the tax-deductibility of a gift, so if you don’t want a perk, you don’t need to request one; 2) we can be flexible on perks: for example, if you want to donate $100, but would like the $80 perk instead, that’s fine! Just let us know!
Who is Zion Lutheran Church?


Zion Lutheran Church of Pittsfield is a congregation of the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America (ELCA), one of the largest progressive Christian denominations in the United States. Together with nearly 10,000 congregations and over 4.5 million members, we share a “living, daring confidence in God's grace.”
We worship weekly on Sundays, and on Thursday evenings we host Jazz Vespers, blending elements of modern jazz, blues, and gospel with the centuries-old tradition of evening prayer. Our children come to know God through our faith formation ministries; our youth love the ELCA Youth Gathering. We sing hymns at Baba Louie’s Pizza to raise funds for local charitable organizations. This is how we build community: we gather, we get to know one another, and we discover that we are stronger together than we are apart.
We collaborate with and support organizations who love the Berkshires as much as we do. We partner with and host several nonprofits, including the Barrington Stage Company, Berkshire Music School, Berkshire Concert Choir, Stockbridge Sinfonia, Downtown Pittsfield Farmers Market, and 12-step groups. We support the Christian Center, the Elizabeth Freeman Center, and Soldier On, as well as people around the world through ELCA World Hunger and ELCA Disaster Response.

One last thing (a friendly caveat)

Because Zion Lutheran Church is an active church community, we function like a church community: decisions are not made unilaterally by its board of directors, or its pastor, but by the congregation as a whole. If we don't reach our fundraising goals, or if our funding dries up or doesn't come through, it's possible that we won't fulfill our vision as it's described here. 
It's also possible that the amount we raise here will exceed what we need for flexible furnishings (how exciting would that be?!) In any case, please know that any donations to this crowdfunding campaign that can't be used to purchase moveable chairs and other flexible furnishings will be directed to a newly-established fund to support community initiatives in the City of Pittsfield.
As you consider whether to give, we ask that you trust us—as we trust God—that a place for community sanctuary will come about in downtown Pittsfield.

story:
Short Summary

Students With a mission (SWAM) is a Nigerian based charity that was registered in 2010.  Our aim is to reduce poverty and disadvantage faced by communities.

SWAM is based in the Kaduna Nigeria with over 1000 members across the world..

In the Nigeria, our programmes promote the interests of disadvantaged members of the community, our main beneficiary target group though not exclusively are refugees, asylum seekers and those affected by HIV/AIDS and Black and ethnic minorities.

Internationally, SWAM works mainly through a range of community-based organisations and as well as in partnership with a range of development NGOs in the Africa to support its International Programmes. Both in the Nigeria and Abroad SWAM projects seek to address the needs of our beneficiaries by their promoting health, and  socio-economic development and betterment.


What We Need & What You Get

Our Challenges include funds, facilities and infrastructures to provide quality care, education and support these children, youths, and women deserve. As we progress with this great vision, we trust God that you would be a part of this noble cause to put a smile on the faces of the less privilaged.

We invite you to be a part of our dream of a greater Nigeria devoid of street urchins, beggars and homeless children and widows labouring for little or nothing in abominable conditions. YOUR $100 CAN SAVE A LIFE


The Impact

Most African children die from malnutrition, diarrhea and childhood ailments which might be considered common in other parts of the world. In nearly every case, vaccines exist that could prevent the contraction of these illnesses.

"The children of Africa are suffering more than any group ever has in the history of the modern world." Fr. Roy continues. "People ask me how long things will continue this way. In many ways, I think the answer to that is mostly up to us. Most of the world has an abundance of food, clean water and medicine -- I am praying that those of us who can -- will reach out to these children who are suffering . . . to send them the help they need to survive."

Giving them better opportunities in life with regards to:
  • Food
  • Portable Water
  • Shelter
  • Clothing
  • Medicare
  • Education

These opportunities will be provided in a home filled with love and care, enabling the children become valuable members of society.

Rehabilitation: The children would be rehabilitated under the most conducive environment and shown unconditional love.

Reformation: This would be achieved through education and extra curricula activities. Education is the best investment any child could have. This project is designed to help train the children as far as the university level in any chosen career of their choice, with the help of a counselor.

Reintegration: Some of the children would be reintegrated into the society through adoption and fostering.

We hope to partner with the Ogun State Government, Corporate bodies, Religious groups and Social philanthropic organisations (for the adoption and fostering process).

We strongly believe these children need to live in a homely environment with lots of love and care, this would enable them adjust well in adulthood.

In addition we hope to remove the stigma attached to the "orphan status" by creating a leverage that will promote equality amongst these children and their peers all over the world.


Risks & Challenges

Africa's Suffering Children

With thousands dying daily, how long can they survive?

HELP
SAVE
A
LIFE
DONATE!!!

Low food supplies, unclean and unsafe water -- accompanied by diseases such as malaria, pneumonia, measles, whooping cough, tetanus and tuberculosis are claiming the lives of African children in record numbers. In most cases, death from these illnesses is preventable -- and even curable.

Immunization, nutrition, clean water and simple, basic health-care monitoring and treatment could save the lives of thousands of children every day.


Other Ways You Can Help

Help orphans and widows living in poverty. Donate a home, education or care for orphans, widows, and children.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Like many others, it has always been a dream of mine to get into the drivers seat of a high performance exotic vehicle and experience the thrills of pushing the car to its limits while listening to beautiful sound of the engine as it roars. Luckily I got that chance and I can definitely tell you its an experience I will never forget.

Driving around in any exotic car is truly a once in a lifetime experience and I want to provide that experience, that same thrill to the average driver where you will be able to drive various exotic vehicles on a race track or even rent it out on an hourly basis around NYC without having to worry about the troubles and headache of owning an exotic car.
 
Instead of having to spend all of your life savings to enjoy a phenomenal ride, help me make this dream a reality for many at a cost CHEAPER than purchasing an Ipad 2...

This is why I am creating Emerald driving experience... allows you to stop dreaming and start living...

 

Why Emerald Driving Experience will need your help:

My team and I are halfway there to being able to provide such an excellent service to all. At this point our initial finances are being stretched before we can officially get running.

From track fees to car financing, certificates, licenses, insurance, preventive maintenance and gas... we need to raise more money and with your help it will allow us to accomplish our goals much quicker to get this show on the road...

**Also please check out the perks 

 

what happens if we surpass or goal..

Then drinks are on us.. lol, if we surpass our goal of $45,000 then the excess money will be put towards keeping the vehicles on the road and towards expanding our fleet so drivers like yourself will be able to have more of a variarity of cars to choose from to fully experience your sports car dreams....

 

Useful information:

We plan on operating in three possible locations: lower Manhattan for actual street driving experience, Riverhead Raceway in Long Island, NY for track experience as well as Englishtown Racepark in NJ. These locations are still being negotiated.

The car we are currently working with is the Aston Martin vantage (James Bond 007). Hopefully we will soon be able to add more to our fleet.

Its not written in stone but we are looking to charge around $237 for a 3-5 laps on the race track and about an hour of street driving experience.

Thank you very much for your time and investment so that we may help you stop dreaming and start experiencing!

story:
Hello.  My name is Mary Anne DeZur.  I designed a device called Time for Change™ for my son, Lou, who was diagnosed with Juvenile Diabetes when he was just 14 years old.  Keep reading, because it turns out the device can also be used by anyone who needs to take a medication or a shot, or remember to do something every so many days.  If you still think this doesn’t have anything to do with you, I can relate.  You see, when Lou’s pediatrician told us he had Juvenile Diabetes, I didn’t know anything about diabetes, let alone there are 2 very different kinds called Type 1 (aka Juvenile Diabetes) and Type 2.  No one in either of our families had diabetes.  Lou was a healthy kid!  He wasn’t overweight!  It didn’t matter.  Lou’s story is worth hearing, because Type 1 diabetes strikes both children and adults AT ANY AGE.  It comes on suddenly, causes dependence on injected or pumped insulin for life, and carries the constant threat of devastating complications such as kidney failure, blindness, nerve damage, amputation, heart attack, stroke, and pregnancy complications.  Type 1 diabetes strikes 80 people a day in the U.S. alone.  In the U.S. alone, a new case of Type 2 diabetes strikes every 30 seconds.

After a year of painful daily insulin shots, Lou was upgraded to an insulin pump (he’s called a “pumper”).  Now Lou had more control over when, where, and what he could eat because his insulin was always with him.  But as wonderful as graduating from 3 insulin shots a day to wearing an insulin pump was, it had its downfalls; like losing track of changing and rotating the site where the pump tubing connects to his body, every 3 days.

Lou clips his insulin pump onto his belt.  Thin tubing carries the insulin from the pump to his body.  He injects the end of the tubing into his thigh (his site).  Every 3 days, Lou has to change his site, just like every pumper does.  This means removing the old tubing and injecting new tubing to a different site.  When Lou wasn’t changing his sites on time, his legs were not healing, sites became very painful; his body wasn’t absorbing insulin correctly, and a few times his pump actually stopped working.  No matter what we did, we kept losing track of when the 3 days were up. 

To solve this problem, we invented Time for Change™.  Shaped like an hourglass with a magnet on the back, it sits on the front of our refrigerator.  The top reminds Lou when he has to change his site and the bottom reminds him when he changed it last (so we really know how much time is running out).  Every time Lou opens the frig, he sees his reminder.  It reminds all of us in the house so we can be his support group.  Amazed that it actually worked for Lou and for the whole family to know his schedule, we gave prototypes to other pumper families and they loved them!  Younger pumpers took more responsibility for changing their sites when they could control their own timer on their own frig.  Lou kept a timer on the frig in his college apartment.  It helped him manage his diabetes and change his sites more often. 

We’ve also created a keychain version of Time for Change™.  It can be attached to car keys and younger kids can attach one to their backpacks, teddy bears, or dolls.  It’s a cool little gadget I designed to empower our little diabetics; and it’s a convenient accessory older diabetics will appreciate, especially when traveling.

PLEASE SEE PHOTOS ON GALLERY TAP AT TOP OF PAGE

What We Need & What You Get

We just received approval on our 2 pending patents.  When this Indiegogo campaign is successful in reaching the funded goal, molds for both versions of Time for Change™ will be manufactured and production will begin.  The goal is to put these timers in the hands of other diabetics worldwide.  Distributing them through retail pharmacy chains would be one way, but the cooler way would be to hawk Time for Change™ to the health care and insurance industry for providers to advertise with their logos and then give away for FREE to the public as a promotional product.  So if anyone out there can make a connection for us, we appreciate the leg up!

I shopped around to 6 local manufacturers to produce Time for Change™.  Approximate costs include:

$27,850:  Tooling for magnetic version
$27,850:  Tooling for keychain version
$  1,200:  Add’l. CAD drawings
$13,350:  First production run
$  6,323:  Processing Fees 
$76,573:  Total pledges needed

I’ve tried to create some unique perks to win you over to our side.  Hopefully they will make you smile, but more desperately, they will make you pledge to our cause.

Why is this cause so important?  Why should I invest in you?

Pledging your hard-earned money to our cause, impacts so many more people than just us.   I created Time for Change™ as a solution to a real life problem.  Nearly 26 million Americans have diabetes in the U.S.  Diabetes currently affects 366 million people worldwide and is expected to affect 552 million by 2030.  (American Diabetes Association.)

My heart breaks for my child because of this ridiculous and deadly disease.  At times I am out-of-my-mind with grief for Lou and what he has to deal with every single day of his life; knowing that if he does not deal with it the right way, he will die.  For a Type 1 diabetic, something as simple as a severe low blood sugar from too much insulin, left untreated, will lead to a seizure, then a coma, and ultimately death.  A severe high blood sugar from not enough insulin, left untreated, will lead to ketoacidosis, which can end in kidney failure, coma, or death.  That’s the seriousness of being a diabetic and being responsible for making sure you get the correct amount of insulin pumped in to your body to cover every single little morsel of food or ounce of drink you put in your mouth.  And it’s not just what an insulin-dependent diabetic eats.  Their diabetes reacts to everything in daily life; like if the weather is cold or if it’s hot; physical exertion; puberty; hormones; stress; a little cold; the flu, emotions; and the list goes on.  Don’t even get me started on the needles.  Imagine having to give your little baby or child 3 or more shots of insulin a day and test their blood sugar 6-10 times a day by poking their fingers with a very sharp needle (don’t believe those commercials that say it’s painless – it’s a sharp needle breaking your skin!).  Or imagine being an adolescent or young adult or old adult and having to give yourself those shots or having an insulin pump connected to you every waking minute.  It’s not very glamorous.  All Type 1 diabetics, JustLikeLou.com, never get a break from any of this and that’s what’s heart breaking.

3 million Americans have Type 1 diabetes, just like Lou.  But not just Type 1 diabetics are wearing insulin pumps these days.  Many Type 2 diabetics use insulin therapy, and many wear insulin pumps.

Your investment in our cause is also a forever investment in funding the current research that is getting closer to finding the cure for diabetes.  As a family, we are making the life-long commitment to donate a portion of everyTime for Change™ sold, to the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation (JDRF).  Stretching across nearly 20 countries, JDRF is the largest charitable supporter, funding research to cure, treat, and prevent Type 1 diabetes.

I have one more reason why this cause is so important . . . he’s in the other room, changing his site.

Other Ways You Can Help

Many times I’ve wanted to donate $ to a good cause, but just didn’t have any to give.  If you are in the same boat, but you still want to help, you can!  Just spread the word about our cause.  Use the Indiegogo share tools to email, twitter, or facebook our link to everyone you know.  We thank you for your support!

What happens to my money if this Indiegogo campaign does not reach the funded goal?

We’re not giving up, even if we don’t get the money we need to start production on at least one of our designs.  The money will be banked while we pursue the balance of funds from other avenues.

What will you do with the money if it goes over your goal?

The goal I set will purchase the 2 molds and a very small first production run.  Any extra money will also be put into the project to go towards advertising, marketing, packaging, shipping & handling, and other manufacturing costs, etc.  If our fabulous supporters pledge some crazy, insane amount like some of the other projects, we will start with a bigger first production run and also use the money to promote Juvenile Diabetes awareness within the school system.  Lou was actually publically humiliated in high school by a teacher who didn’t think he should be drinking a fruit juice in his class, even though Lou was experiencing a low blood sugar and was unable to make it to the nurse’s office.  The teacher was not aware of the complications Juvenile Diabetes inflicts.  My awareness campaign would also make students aware of the symptoms of Juvenile Diabetes.  Because the symptoms are very common and are not usually recognized as warning signs for diabetes, students and their parents often times ignore them until the student needs hospitalization.  Way-over-the-top funding will be used to create an awareness campaign that could save a child’s life.

Thank you for listening to our story.  We would love to hear your family’s experience with Diabetes.  How did it start for you?  How are you doing now?  Leave us a comment or write to my email.

Thank you for listening to our story.  We would love to hear your family’s experience with Diabetes.  How did it start for you?  How are you doing now?  Leave us a comment or write to my email.

story:
Sycamore Family Resource Center is a forming organization in Lincoln, NE, that needs your help!  Our goal is to create an inclusive space that offers a wide variety of resources to help empower our community in making choices along the full spectrum of their reproductive health.

Sycamore Center is founded on these ethics:

  • inclusivity
  • diversity
  • accessibility 
  • sustainability

Our goal is to create access to resources that support informed consent in every stage of life.

We are advocates of:

  • peaceful parenting & fearless birth
  • healthcare for all
  • evidence-based medicine & traditional healing
  • sex-positivity 

We have some real opportunities to provide education to low-income and minority childbearing families (eventually adapting a program designed by the Nebraska Dept. of Health and Human Services to provide prenatal and postnatal education and advocacy based on the doula model of care).  We are currently expanding on our events to include support groups for fathers and people with postpartum depression, childbirth education classes, women's health workshops, and more.

We're starting the campaign to raise enough funds to incorporate with the State of Nebraska as well as file for tax exemption with the IRS (as a 501(c)3).  We've met with attorneys from MEEM Consultants for Creative Endeavors and they have generously agreed to donate half of the required services for us to file.

Here's the breakdown:

  • $400 flat fee
  • $300 filing fe 

It's been recommended to us that it would be wise to have a bit of a cusion financially, which is why our fundraising goal exceeds our legal fees.  Our goal is to raise enough money to file by January 1, 2013.

in addition to achieving tax exemption, our fundraising goals will help support the growth of our lending library, the purchase of teaching aids, and the ever-present costs of printing materials such as flyers and brochures.  

We are completely volunteer driven but are working toward a future in which we can create nonprofit sector jobs for birth workers and other professioals who are dedicated to creating safer and stronger communities.  Our ultimate goal is to restore an age-old model of care- one where community family support is rewarded and sustained by that community.

Please join us.

story:
Help Toronto's only bicycle courier owned and operated messenger company purchase a cargo bike!

Who we are and what we do:

Frustrated with the backwards thinking of the downtown courier industry and tired of the abuse and disrespect received from the big companies, we decided to stop complaining about what was wrong, get organized, and start our own courier company.

Send It is Toronto's only courier owned and operated bike messenger company. Our focus is local. We live here, we work here, we play here. Our goal is to support Toronto’s thriving local businesses and residents. We offer lower rates compared to larger courier and shipping companies so that same day delivery service can be accessible to smaller businesses and our neighbors. 

Check out our website to learn a little more about us and our clients.

 What We're Asking

 

We need $3,500 to purchase the Bullitt Clockwork cargo bike. These bikes are the real deal work bikes. They are built in Denmark and designed to be worked on everyday. Courier companies around the world use these bikes to handle transporting just about anything.

With your help, we can expand our business to carry oversized boxes, large signs, and loads of coffee beans- just about anything up to 400 lbs by bike- quicker and cheaper than gas guzzling delivery vans.

We are turning to you through Indiegogo to help us expand our capability while concurrently helping Toronto's local businesses. A cargo bike will give us the competative edge we need to pioneer affordable bike delivery in the city of Toronto. It's cheaper, faster, great for the environment, and it's fun.

What We're Offering:

What do you get if you donate? In addition to becoming our personal heroes and changing the way local delivery can be made in Toronto you can choose from some excellent perks including:

- Having your name listed forever on our website and facebook page under our cargo delivery description as being responsible for making it possible for us to offer this service.

-Free delivery service

-.Bikes On Wheels T-shirt

-Bike socks made by Defeet

-Send It Courier t-shirt

-Your name tattooed on our riders (Now thats permanent!)

What if we beat our goal?

Any money we receive over our goal will be donated to Charlies Freewheel, an organization that provides employment and training in basic bicycle maintenance for youth in the Regent Park community, Toronto. 
 

Why it matters:

To Us:

Having a cargo bike will enable us to offer a more dynamic service, as well as raise the bar for bike messengers in the city of Toronto. The demands put upon the same day courier industry have changed drastically with a greater focus on the transportation of items that can not be electronically transferred. A cargo bike is a necessity for the shift from envelopes to larger deliveries such as goods and merchandise. This cargo bike will make us the most versatile bike delivery service in Toronto.

To the Industry:

Bike messengers get a bad rap for being surly and mean, and a lot of that negativity manifests as a result of being disresepected by employers that refuse to pay fair wages and provide benefits.

We LOVE our jobs and we want people to take us and our profession seriously. Operating as a collective was a politically intentional decision made on our parts to make sure we are all paid a fair wage and treat each other, our clients, and our community with respect.

We work hard everyday to raise the bar for the profession that we love. We are the bike messengers that show up with smiles on our faces every day because fair treatment in the workplace can change the employee mindset.

Can't donate? Here is how you can help:

If you can't help by making a cash donation help spread the word! Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Instagram, whatever. Use social media to let your friends and family you know that you support us. More importantly, use our services! Maybe you or someone you know needs a reliable courier service? Call us!

What if we don't beat our goal?

If we don't reach our goal the money still goes towards the cargo bike. We will keep saving until we reach the goal on our own and will honor all donations and their affiliated perks made throughout the duration of this campaign.

story:
Summary

Casa Sana- The Healing House will be a place where teens, living in poverty, can make positive changes in their lives. 

Impact

The facility we plan on constructing will house a dorm, study hall, and vocational education center.  By giving these impoverish teens a place to educate themselves and get job experience you will be helping them break the cycle of poverty. The majority of teens in Piura have dreams of going to college but no means of attaining that goal.  By offering vocational training we can help these teens bring themselves, and future generations out of poverty.  Part II of the program, pending funding, would be to offer college scholarships to the deserving individuals that come through Casa Sana.

What We Need

The total cost for the residence, vocational education center, and study hall is $250,000.

The cost is broken down as follows:

$25,000- Demolition of Old Building

$225,000- Construction of New Facility

$25,000- Furnishing New Facility

What can you do?

Donations of any amount go a long way. 

Spread the word to family, friends, co-workers, random people on the street.

story:
Short Summary

Well, many of you already know me as i am posting this to my facebook friends and family.  I hate to even ask for money for myself, and kind of embarrassed but its to the point where i am using all of my funds to move, and am barely getting food into the house.  I havent been able to buy steven any school clothes this year, which we can get by without as he has been fortunate enough to have uncles who give him lots of hand me downs.  Its just been a hard time, a long summer of lots of driving in the car using gas money to keep steven occupied so he dont go into his violent rages and im sure things will look up, but at this point i have nothing left to sell, so here i am asking for your help, anything will help at this point.

What We Need & What You Get

I have enough money to move in, and to pay the first months rent but after that, its going to be a struggle.  I dont know how i am going to buy food for stevnes lunches at school, and just plain survive.  I think with $500 it should get me ahead to where i will be alright as far as bills, and food.  What i am offering for any donation of at least $10 is a BOOK that i have written about my life with LGS.  Its only about 40 pages, but it really goes into every aspect of LGS, as far as the diets, meds, behaivors, surgeries.  I think it can be very informative to soemone who has a child with LGS, or just for anyone who would like to read what life with a LGS child is like.  For a donation of at least $10 i will send you my book.  It isnt published and isnt in a paperback or even a hardback, its just plain ol paper printed from my computer, but its just the same.  I was hoping to publish it someday, and maybe i will, but for now this is all that i can offer.

The Impact

What your donation will do, no matter how small, is it will help me to be able to breathe a little and make sure that i can take care of Steven and other household finances.  Its just been such a struggle lately, out of nowhere, i just dont know how i got to this point, well...i guess the whole move thing plays a big part with having to rent a uhaul, pay for some of the utilities to be turned on which i didnt have at this house cause its all electric.  If i reach my goal, i can get steven a few new pairs of jeans to wear to school since he has outgrown all of his jeans from last summer.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just keep us in your prayers, i know that everything will work out eventually, but its just this valley we are going thru at the moment, so prayers are most important.

story:
Nunkui Cakes was born out of three occurrences: finding I needed to eat gluten-free many years ago, long before most people had ever heard of gluten; realizing most of the gluten-free baked goods available tasted like compacted saw dust; and my insistence on having great-tasting, fresh food. After my doctor gave me that news, I played around with recipes in the tiny kitchen in my then NYC apartment. For me, an Italian-American whose mom is a terrific cook and whose dad is a great baker, I needed one sweet treat that I could enjoy and also share with friends and family who can indulge in any desserts they choose. An elegant cake was born, a phenomenal flour-less chocolate cake that is loved by the gluten-free and gluten-full alike! 

The growing demand for gluten-free foods and encouragement from friends in the food business have spurred me to take my business to the next level, to go beyond baking for friends and begin supplying the food market. Restaurants and high-end stores are ready and waiting to carry Nunkui Cakes and your support will allow me to supply to them. Step two: supplying corporate food services at companies that feed their employees. Currently I am equipped to make only a few cakes at a time and the market is demanding that I increase production. Your donations will go toward the purchase of a larger commercial mixer, pots and pans, local organic ingredients, space and storage in a larger commercial kitchen, and goods to package and insulate our cakes for delivery. Funds raised, along with profits from sales, will enable us to get some momentum. The more we raise, the more likely we will grow steadily and not have to engage in another campaign in the future. Even if we don't reach our goal, the funds we receive will enable us to grow, just at a slower pace.

Nunkui Cakes will be sourcing ingredients from local organic farms and local businesses, supporting local economies, strengthening local agriculture, and minimizing carbon footprint. The chocolate we use supports the indigenous people who farm it through Fair-trade and again, we source it locally. We've started in the San Francisco Bay Area and plan to have future locations elsewhere. Would you like Nunkui Cakes to be available where you live? Donate and let us know.

I started thinking about starting this business when an acquaintance called and invited me to Thanksgiving dinner. She mentioned that her daughter, then 19, had loved the chocolate cake I brought to the 50th birthday party of a common friend. I reflected and realized that friend was now 55. So her daughter, a 14 year-old girl with undoubtedly many other things on her mind, remembered that cake for 5 years. Cynthia, who lived at a distance, was invited to my home for a dinner party. She was tired the day of a party and called to decline the invitation. I told her I was serving ‘The Cake,’ and she replied, "I'm gettin' in the car," and she did. Laura, a guest at a holiday party heard raves in the kitchen, tried the cake and responded, "I don't even like chocolate and I love this cake!"

We'll be having tasting parties during our Indiegogo fundraising campaign and it would be my sincere pleasure to meet you! Message me here and I'll get details to you.

You may be wondering about the name "Nunkui." There's a story there. I've always had a passion for indigenous cultures and for years, led small groups into indigenous territories in the Amazon Rainforest and High Andes. Nunkui is the Shuar Indian word for "Goddess, Mother Universe, Time, and Space." I've always felt a connection with Nunkui and feel her support always and so I honor her in my business. I know it's a lot for a cake to carry, but this cake can handle it!

Let's talk about what you get for supporting our work. It would be my honor to share a delicious cake with you. Maybe you prefer a couple tartlettes for you and your sweetie. Perhaps you and your friends would like to pool your resources, make a larger donation and gather for an evening of cake, coffee, and conversation. We've got party packages as part of our perks that would suit you. All donations come with a signed letter of appreciation from our founder. And Nunkui Cakes freeze well!

I have a solid business background in medical sales and marketing and interactive medical technologies along with a smart business plan. I helped a start-up get off the ground successfully. I insist on sustainability and social responsibility. When we are profitable, a minimum of 2% of proceeds will go to nonprofit organizations.

Thanks for visiting Nunkui Cakes' Indiegogo page! I really hope to meet you to thank you for your support. Please spread the word, make some noise about this campaign, especially to those who care about local food, local farming, organic, gluten-free, and women-owned businesses. Indiegogo has share tools here to make it easy to let others know about Nunkui Cakes.

My sincere thanks, Christine

story:
Hi.

I'm Andrea Lipomi, licensed massage therapist, esthetician, and very-soon-to-be-licensed nail tech.

I'm currently the owner/operator of Feetish Spa Parlor. It's a tiny day spa on the second floor of the Emergency Arts building on Fremont Street in Downtown Las Vegas, Nevada.

Since Feetish opened in February 2013, I've been joyfully pampering my facial and body treatment clientele -- and I've also been getting a steady stream of requests for nail services, too. It makes complete sense: Feetish, feet, amazing pedicures. I get it.

So long story short, I just spent seven months in nail school. I'm taking my state exams within the next few weeks, and I'm on track to be fully licensed and set up by May.

Why I Appreciate Your Support Immensely:

Licensing fees, equipment and supplies are not inexpensive.

  • I require a brand spanking new cosmetology establishment license that includes permission to perform nail services. 
  • You'll appreciate high quality supplies like OPI nail polish, Gelish and IBD gel polish, nice scrubs, paraffin wax, a large bolster, and other sundry items required to perform kick-ass manis and pedis.

How You Can Help:

Please share, contribute, and/or promise not to get upset with me when I saturate your Facebook news feed with all things Indiegogo. Thanks.

But Wait! There's More!

You can learn more about Feetish at feetishspa.com.

Feetish is also on Facebook and Twitter.

Check out #AndreasBeautySchoolAdventures on Instagram for crazy nail school shenanigans.

XOXO

A special thanks to my good pal Geoff Carter for filming and editing my campaign video. Excellent work, Captain!

Hugs and gratitude to Chef Nat of eat., my favorite breakfast restaurant in DTLV. Her pep talks were integral to this leg of the journey.

And finally, here's to you. You make it fun, and great, and worth it. Thank you. <3

You'll appreciate high quality supplies like OPI nail polish, Gelish and IBD gel polish, nice scrubs, paraffin wax, a large bolster, and other sundry items required to perform kick-ass manis and pedis. 
How You Can Help:Please share, contribute, and/or promise not to get upset with me when I saturate your Facebook news feed with all things Indiegogo. Thanks.But Wait! There's More!You can learn more about Feetish at feetishspa.com. Feetish is also on Facebook and Twitter.Check out #AndreasBeautySchoolAdventures on Instagram for crazy nail school shenanigans. XOXOA special thanks to my good pal Geoff Carter for filming and editing my campaign video. Excellent work, Captain!Hugs and gratitude to Chef Nat of eat., my favorite breakfast restaurant in DTLV. Her pep talks were integral to this leg of the journey. And finally, here's to you. You make it fun, and great, and worth it. Thank you. <3

story:
Short Summary

My name is Lorne Mallin and I am a friend of Nafuna Omulokole, a 65-year-old Ugandan refugee now living in suburban Vancouver, BC. Nafuna would dearly love to be in affordable contact with her family in Uganda. We're trying to raise funds for an iPad Mini so she can use Skype.

What We Need

We need $600 for an iPad Mini, a cover and a wifi connection. That's $319 for the tablet and $45 for the case, plus taxes, and the balance for wifi service.

The Impact

Clearly, funding a tablet is not a life or death situation. But it will make a big difference to Nafuna's quality of life to be able to see the faces of her family. I lived in Uganda 2009-2010 and know how important family is there. She escaped Uganda during the tyranny of dictator Idi Amin in the 1970s and lived in a refugee camp in Kenya. In 2006, she came to Canada as a refugee and lives on social welfare. Nafuna also wants to contact a pastor in Uganda who is offering to try to recover her identity documents so she can prove her age to Canadian authorities.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please help get the word out – try the Indiegogo share tools. Thank you so much.

story:
Why SoupGrant?

SOUP is unique & simple. We fund micro-grants in our community by bringing folks together for a simple soup and bread dinner once a month. Anyone can apply for one, too! We take a $5 donation at the door to help fund everything from vitamins and health supplements for low-income Lansing residents to gas money for volunteers who bring groceries to people's homes to miniature, "little free libraries" in our community.

Who are we?

We're a small team of three people: Heather, Terry and Joel. Heather is the brains and the vision behind the operation, getting things going in the summer of 2013. Terry (Heather's mom) is our awesome SOUP chef, specializing in vegetarian recipes. Joel joined after attending a SoupGrant dinner and has been running our internet presence ever since.

So what about this money you give out? How do you decide who gets it?

We don't! You do! We have two or three different proposals on the night of SoupGrant and everyone who shows up to our SOUP dinner gets a vote for their $5 donation. The project with the most votes at the end of the night wins and takes home the money!

So why do you need more money?

The donations we take at the door go to fund our micro-grants which support grassroots projects in the city. We don't take any of that money in.

Any crowd-sourced money we raise here will be used for the following:

  • Purchasing necessary supplies for our soup dinners
  • Grace Lutheran-ELCA, our gracious host which has provided us the space to meet every month
  • Gas money for volunteers who help put up posters around town
  • Hiring a local graphic designer to create a new logo for us
  • Helping foot the monthly bill for a Meetup group to help reach more people

SoupGrant is not only about supporting worthy causes, but it's also about bringing the community together to share and discuss and learn. We're excited about what we've accomplished so far since our beginnings in the summer of 2013, but we're even more excited for 2014.

Please join us. If you can, support us with a donation. We meet together every 3rd Thursday of the month at Grace Lutheran-ELCA on MLK Blvd in Lansing. We hope to see you there.

story:
Help Gertie, The Pink RV Make a Comeback So She Can Do Good in Palm Springs And Beyond! 

Palm Springs-based comedian, community volunteer and all-around do-gooder Shann Carr owns an RV affectionately named “Gertie.” Gertie had a life changing adventure taking a 13,000-mile comedy tour across the US and she touched lives wherever she showed up!  Sadly, soon after the tour, Gertie had a breakdown on her way home from Vegas! Now, Shann and her friends want to get Gertie’s powers for good back on the road and we need your help! 

Where Gertie goes, smiles happen!  When we get Gertie up on her feet, we intend to use her to support everything from collecting food donations for local food banks, to transporting crated pets to and from pet adoption locations, and shuttling visitors to fundraising parties and events.   We want Gertie to be available for use by non-profit organizations for the nominal cost of her actual operation, as well as affordably rentable for business and pleasure.  Everything from a doing real shuttle gig at Modernism Week, to being a community Center's pride float, or taking Shann out on another little comedy tour.  Gertie's destiny is to do well while doing good. 

What Gertie Needs and What You GET!

The currently pink, sunglass-wearing, rhinestone emblazoned, Gertie needs a mechanical and cosmetic makeover!  The Friends of Gertie have set out to raise $15,000 to transform her this summer, so she is fresh and hip to hit the road when season returns in October. 

This mid-life crisis make-over includes covering the cost of:

-  A new engine 

-  A new radiator (It's hot in Palm Springs!)

-  Six new “shoes” (Gertie has two front tires and four back tires)

-  Special insurance that allows for a variety of do-gooders to drive her 

-  AAA-RV coverage

It adds up quickly! 

Gertie Will Also Be Getting:

- An exterior mid-century modern facelift, including designer custom paint! 

- An interior all-over, mid-century modern wardrobe change!


Some Of The Cool Perks!

$1000 Sponsors Will Be Featured on the Back

Gertie won't be pink when we're done with her but, we will highlight our $1000 Sponsors right on the back, for all to see, wherever Gertie goes, for ONE YEAR!  These sponsors also get 4 hours of shuttle service in Gertie for the event of their choice.  There are two special $1000 perks, one that also includes a total of $1500 in advertising in 6 local media publications and another $1000 perk that comes with $500 gift certificate at Contour Dermatology.  All of these also include all the perks that come with the $500 sponsorship level.  


We'll email every donor of $25 or more a personalized, signed photo of Shann with Gertie and her angel-dog, Beckham! 



Donors of $50 or more will receive a private link to download a copy of "Out For Laughs" as part of their perks package. Over 20 years ago, "Out For Laughs" was featured as the final film in SF's Frameline Film Festival!  Honestly, now it is so amusingly dated, let's call it vintage...you will laugh at it, as well as with it.  This pilot, Shann's first foray into writing and producing, featured 5 male and 5 female gay*ish entertainers doing sketch comedy.  The then Bay area comedians who starred in "Out For Laughs," who are still working comedians include: Shann Carr, Justin Bond, Amy Boyd,  Scott Capurro, Mark Davis and Marilyn Pittman!  Pretty good odds considering they were mostly in their 20's at the time! 


Exclusive to the $250 donors is this limited perk - Shann Carr's book,"You're Going To Be Gay!" The book features childhood pictures of her friends and celebrities, that show how obvious it was that they would be gay, even then! Each kid picture is paired with an adult pic and a funny little story.   Printed long before "Born This Way" Shann donated lots of copies of this book to LGBT youth and adult organizations to raise funds.  Now, only 8 copies of the original printing remain.  They're yours!

 


Your Support Makes This Possible!

Friends of Shann are doing all they can to help support the cause via an Indiegogo Campaign.  IndieGogo is one of the groundbreaking "crowd funding" mechanisms that has made it possible for indie artists and creative thinkers to follow their vision like never before... with the power of a community behind them.  

Please help by giving whatever you can. Every dollar helps, and the more you contribute, the quicker we can get Gertie on the road doing good stuff in the Community. If you can't give money, cheer us on, pass the word and let us know if you think of a way that Gertie might be of assistance around town! We'd love to hear from you! 

Thanks for your help getting Gertie back on her feet and on the road to being Palm Springs’ first Community, Mobile Multi-Purpose Vehicle!

*NOTE: Indiegogo PayPal payments will appear as a Paypal Payment to “dcaasi” which is Dennis Caasi, who is the man heading up this campaign and helping to manage the funds.

story:
Short Summary

We're looking to raise money to expand our non-book items, do more unique events, expand our book section to include more new books and books from local authors and add a small café.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $100,000, and are looking to get $50,000 from Indiegogo.

We're looking to expand our non-book section, so part of the money will go to buying literary-themed tote bags, t-shirts, and other cool items. We'll be focusing on Maryland-based companies, but we'll also have products from Literary Threads, Papaya! Art, and Out of Print Clothing to sell in the store.

Some of the money will go to expanding the book section to include more new books and books by local authors. We'd love to sell books by Maryland authors Austin Camacho, Jen Michalski, Madison Smartt Bell, and Natalie Standiford. We'd also love to sell new copies of books like Arcadia, by Lauren Groff; The Laws of Harmony, and Isabel's Daughter, both by Judith Ryan Hendricks; Time Was Soft There, by Jeremy Mercer; and Redshirts, by John Scalzi.

Part of the money will go to adding in a café selling Zeke's coffee, specialty coffee items, and desserts.

Perks range from a free bookmark and coffee cup when you contribute $5, a free t-shirt when you give us $30, to goodie bags full of cool items when you give us $75.
