story:
Short Summary

For those who don't know me,  I am Joshua Brown and i'm 16 years of age and i'm from Sydney, Australia and a student from Marcellin college in Randwick. I have luckily been chosen to head up to Thursday Island in Queensland along the Torres Strait to help out with communities in need, with partaking in building community projects, listening and being part of the culture and completing any other activities that are set. For people who don't know Thursday Island, it is populated to around 2,610 people, where many communities filled with indigenous Australians and Torres Strait islander natives, these people live a very simple life without the things we take for granted like running hot water when we want it and also a large amount of food supply. 

What We Need & What You Get

The whole trip is around $2500, I have other people, like my parents contributing, but that still isn't enough money for me to go. I need serious people who want to help me but most definitely want to help communities like the one up in Queensland and I want people to understand that helping me will affect the outcome of help needed for their communities. 

what you get from me receiving funds is that knowing that i will be helping communities in need and that you helped me get there with your kindness, thoughtfulness and generosity which what those communities need. you also get a sense of accomplishment because sometimes we constantly search for ways to help people but don't know how and helping me go on this exploration will definitely be a good opportunity to help others.

    The Impact

    The impact of sending me funds for this trip is that not only will you feel satisfied of helping others but that i will be helping people with tasks that take a lot more will power. Another impact which plays a role in this trip is that this is an experience in which i may not get the opportunity to do at this age again. Experiencing how other less fortunate people live and helping so that i can take away a good morale and mindset which will set me in the right direction for the future. 

      Risks & Challenges

      obviously there will be challenges and risks which take part in this trip; with a change from an environment that i am used to and experiencing different cultures face to face will be difficult. To overcome these barriers, myself and 4 other boys will be participating in this trip together and to be a team, to help each other out when we think we can't do something and keep moving forward for the result which those communities desperately need and want. 

        Other Ways You Can Help

        I know that most likely that some people can not donate at this time which is totally acceptable, but what you can do is just spread this around to anyone you might think will have an interest in supporting me and the people i will be helping. the smallest donation goes a long way in helping me partake on this trip. i honestly mean that even a $2 donation would be great because it all adds up at the end. 

        if by any chance i can't reach my goal, the money which has been donated will most definitely be going towards my trip, because as i said before, the smallest amount is greatly appreciated.

story:
Hey there my name is Alex and this my idea.

My friends and I decided to start a trip that would mean something. We dont just want to see the world but we actually want to do some good. On Youtube I have always seen these videos where people go around handing out food to the homeless, and the smiles they get are priceless. One day i just thought hey I wanna do that! Me and friends along with my beautiful girlfriend had this idea, why dont we start an end hunger trip, but lets not just try once city or province or state, lets really do this bring smiles to those who dont have much to smile about on a daily basis. We want to provide backpacks full of supplies to the homeless all around the world. Those supplies will include, food, a nice set of clothes, shoes, money, lists or resources, water, toothbrushes, toothpaste, hair brushes and lots of other goodies.

Our goal is to provide these backpacks to as many homeless around the world. Bring a smile to their faces and let them know that someone actually cares and wants to help. Most people would just walk by and ignore or give them that dime that has been sitting int he bottom of your pockets or bags since forever. But we are all human, none of deserve a live on the streets, we all deserve a chance at life and better opportunities, and most importantly we all do not deserve to be judged based on our appearances or where we live or where we come from.

I want to make a difference and make as many people smile as I can so please help make this a reality.

PS we will be documenting our entire trip and posting daily to youtube.

story:
Another Plant Barber Shop 2014

APBS is not your typical, mundane barbershop; on arrival customers are hit with Sci-Fi fantasy twists! Hairstyles that are ready to wow the world one city at a time! This business will take off like a NASA shuttle leaving earth’s atmosphere into the endless opportune boundaries of space! This is our business genre and what sets us apart from other shops. Business is all about supply and demand; there are so few shops that supply the artists needed to create the sophisticated-cuts that a huge number of patrons are looking for. Our marketing will be directed at these individuals. Another Planet Barber Shop can help people looking for an opportunity to artistically create the personality and appearance that speaks to the image they so desire. These fantasy cuts are fun and generate an enormous audience for the non-conforming individual. The cuts in combination with color can create a wow-factor that screams “look-at-me! You can see I’m different.” APBS is anxious to become the Top Gun when it comes to Sci-fi cuts and colors in Philadelphia. All of our APBS barbers want to come together to catapult this business to the forefront of Sci-Fi fantasy cuts in the area. Our barber-team knows that each of us carry the same responsibility toward growing the business and satisfying our customers. 

Behind the Scene Business Practices

At APBS we feel that good barbers have a memory for all of their clients; names, clothing, shoes, and hair. If a customer visits a first-rate barber regularly, the barber will become familiar with the shape of the customer’s head, texture of their hair and will know how to cut and style their hair just the way the customer likes it. Customers will be able to walk in and the barber will call them by name and ask if they want the usual. A good barber will listen to the customer’s woes better than any bartender, and the barber will know the names of the customer’s spouse and children. The whole idea is that a customer should look forward to their next haircut. For prospective customers that are new in the APBS neighborhood or are not satisfied with their current barber, the first thing they should do is ask people that know us and our shop about the up-to-date, out-of-this-world hair styles. We are sure they will recommend us. We would ask new customers to especially seek out referrals from people in our area who always seem to have creative-haircuts--We think they will recommend us too. New customers will find that we are not the same as the unisex cut places. We are a place for relaxation, conversation; a more creative, non-conforming establishment. We are all about helping people feel, look unique, and confident. Most people have found that APBS barbers are the artists that they will want to trust their unique looks to. We are a group of barbers supremely confident in our ability to shape hair into the look the customer has been waiting for. Our confidant barbers will look their customer in the eyes, smile, and give them a firm handshake when entering the shop. In addition, customers should have a barber who can confidently tell them what would work best for them depending on the customers requests along with their face shape and structure. Advising our customers is something that the APBS barbers are especially good at doing. Barbers without much experience or confidence in their craft will do exactly what the client says, even if what the client asks for will look unappealing. A good barber will have the confidence to speak up and offer suggestions to the customer to help guide them to something more suited for their face and will provide the client with the best outcome and unique appearance. We pride ourselves on everything being handled electronically. Our client leaves the salon looking outstanding--Ready to conquer the world and convinced that APBS is terrific! Now the paperwork; the part we used to hate. Well, not anymore. With our new unique Barbershop software, we're in complete control - effortlessly. It's almost too good to be true. The Barbershop’s System asks a few questions, the receptionist fills in the blanks, clicks and incredibly, there it is! ‘The perfect bookkeeping system.” The simplicity of our software must have been its own mother of invention. The programmers started out with a very simple idea--To make Barbershop software that has lots of features, but very simple to use. So simple that our receptionist doesn't have to keep one eye on the screen and one eye on the instruction manual; and simple enough that the user doesn't need a degree in computer programming to operate it! It even makes a non-typist comfortable at the keyboard. But the most important thing is our books are in order, our promotions happen on time, invitations for the free birthday cuts go out as needed, inventory is always well stocked, and the barber is left to have fun cutting hair and enjoying their work.

Promotions:

• Free birthday haircuts with I.D. – this will be the best way to get the City talking about the shop. Everyone appreciates a free birthday gift. With the value of $25, anything exceeding will just cover the difference.

• Bring 3 people= free – not only that it’s a word-of-mouth promotion; it motivates the client to bring you business to receive a handsome reward. Resets after 3 referrals.

• Give a Yelp or foursquare review with proof= $5 off. This offer will speed the building a name process. A $5 discount will hopefully bring me 5 people.

• Every 10th visit you’ll receive a free hair cut- promotes a loyal, retaining clientele.

• FATHER’S DAY! - Half-priced services!!

The Goal:

To transform a old bridal shop into a sci-fantasy solar system! I can get the rest of the funds but 10,000 will be just to get my foot into the door, get the initial setting up. Lets make this visual a reality together!

RISK AND CHALLENGES:

A risks that could occur is that I wont get the prime location I want because of my age. But despite that I well prepared with a business plan, financial balance sheet & letter of serious intent for this building. This money will allow me to put a hold on it until I can get a loan for the remaining for the interior design and IT software apps.
story_txt:
Another Plant Barber Shop 2014
APBS is not your typical, mundane barbershop; on arrival customers are hit with Sci-Fi fantasy twists! Hairstyles that are ready to wow the world one city at a time! This business will take off like a NASA shuttle leaving earth’s atmosphere into the endless opportune boundaries of space! This is our business genre and what sets us apart from other shops. Business is all about supply and demand; there are so few shops that supply the artists needed to create the sophisticated-cuts that a huge number of patrons are looking for. Our marketing will be directed at these individuals. Another Planet Barber Shop can help people looking for an opportunity to artistically create the personality and appearance that speaks to the image they so desire. These fantasy cuts are fun and generate an enormous audience for the non-conforming individual. The cuts in combination with color can create a wow-factor that screams “look-at-me! You can see I’m different.” APBS is anxious to become the Top Gun when it comes to Sci-fi cuts and colors in Philadelphia. All of our APBS barbers want to come together to catapult this business to the forefront of Sci-Fi fantasy cuts in the area. Our barber-team knows that each of us carry the same responsibility toward growing the business and satisfying our customers. Behind the Scene Business PracticesAt APBS we feel that good barbers have a memory for all of their clients; names, clothing, shoes, and hair. If a customer visits a first-rate barber regularly, the barber will become familiar with the shape of the customer’s head, texture of their hair and will know how to cut and style their hair just the way the customer likes it. Customers will be able to walk in and the barber will call them by name and ask if they want the usual. A good barber will listen to the customer’s woes better than any bartender, and the barber will know the names of the customer’s spouse and children. The whole idea is that a customer should look forward to their next haircut. For prospective customers that are new in the APBS neighborhood or are not satisfied with their current barber, the first thing they should do is ask people that know us and our shop about the up-to-date, out-of-this-world hair styles. We are sure they will recommend us. We would ask new customers to especially seek out referrals from people in our area who always seem to have creative-haircuts--We think they will recommend us too. New customers will find that we are not the same as the unisex cut places. We are a place for relaxation, conversation; a more creative, non-conforming establishment. We are all about helping people feel, look unique, and confident. Most people have found that APBS barbers are the artists that they will want to trust their unique looks to. We are a group of barbers supremely confident in our ability to shape hair into the look the customer has been waiting for. Our confidant barbers will look their customer in the eyes, smile, and give them a firm handshake when entering the shop. In addition, customers should have a barber who can confidently tell them what would work best for them depending on the customers requests along with their face shape and structure. Advising our customers is something that the APBS barbers are especially good at doing. Barbers without much experience or confidence in their craft will do exactly what the client says, even if what the client asks for will look unappealing. A good barber will have the confidence to speak up and offer suggestions to the customer to help guide them to something more suited for their face and will provide the client with the best outcome and unique appearance. We pride ourselves on everything being handled electronically. Our client leaves the salon looking outstanding--Ready to conquer the world and convinced that APBS is terrific! The Barbershop’s System asks a few questions, the receptionist fills in the blanks, clicks and incredibly, there it is! ‘The perfect bookkeeping system.” The simplicity of our software must have been its own mother of invention. The programmers started out with a very simple idea--To make Barbershop software that has lots of features, but very simple to use. So simple that our receptionist doesn't have to keep one eye on the screen and one eye on the instruction manual; and simple enough that the user doesn't need a degree in computer programming to operate it! It even makes a non-typist comfortable at the keyboard. Everyone appreciates a free birthday gift. With the value of $25, anything exceeding will just cover the difference.•	Bring 3 people= free – not only that it’s a word-of-mouth promotion; it motivates the client to bring you business to receive a handsome reward. Resets after 3 referrals.•	Give a Yelp or foursquare review with proof= $5 off. This offer will speed the building a name process. A $5 discount will hopefully bring me 5 people.•	Every 10th visit you’ll receive a free hair cut- promotes a loyal, retaining clientele.•	FATHER’S DAY! - Half-priced services!!The Goal:To transform a old bridal shop into a sci-fantasy solar system! story:
Ecuador is the second poorest country of south america. Besides seventy percent of the population is in the age of under thirty. Making us assume that healthcare is in a poor condition. 15 % of the population lives with under one dollar a day. Most of the studens will abandon school after primary grade.


It is obvious that help is needed!


Hello my name is Evelyn, I am from Germany and I just finished school. The upcoming free time gives me the opportunity to help people in need. Ecuador seemed to be the right decision when choosing a destination. I am travelling with the organisation "Youth World" which provides me projects to work on. My specialties will be to help youth groups and children in need. Furthermore we have planned missions on the streets of Quito. 


What I Need

Going to Ecuador is an expensive thing. Costs like flight, expensive Internet and insurrances dig a great hole into my budget. Thats the part where you come in: I beg you to spare some dollars to support my work. See the following list of the costs I had.


  • Flight                                             1500$
  • Pocket Money                                 350$
  • Formalities                                      250$
  • Internet                                           185$
  • Shelters when being outside           300$



Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant spare a few dollars please make sure to help me by sharing this campaign  via twitter and facebook.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Matthew Ward, and my wife's name is Erin. We currently reside on the East side of Saint Paul, Minnesota with 2 Italian greyhouds, 1 golden retreiver and 2 cats.  I was very close friends with Erin"s brother in Highschool, and that is when I met her. We went our seperate ways and reconnected through facebook (of all places) a few years down the road. We hit it off and fell in love. We were married in the fall of 2010, and over these past few years we have have adopted our animals. Our animals are a huge part of our lives, and couldn't imagine a day with out them! But we want to expand our family on a human level as well. Ever since the beginning, we have talked about adopting our own children. Erin was adopted herself and sees adoption as the biggest calling she has ever had, and we both have wanted to adopt since we were teenagers.

Erin has traveled to many places around the world. She has experiences that most people will not have their lifetime. She loves children and has a desire to help kids in need. Just out of college, Erin completed an internship at Walt Disney World expanding her horizons. During her travels, Erin developed an affection for children with special needs and children with out the comfort and safety of a family unit. Erin loves to volunteer for the under priviledged. A couple of years ago, she was offered an opportunity to give back to the community working with Americorps. She completed 1 year of service volunteering with families as a PCA for children with special needs. She is thankful everyday for that experience. Erin continues to volunteer, and will continue to do so through out her entire life.

After Highschool, I went to school off and on for about 2 years. Upon the completion of my second year, I decided I was going to follow one of my dreams of being in the military. I enlisted in the U.S. Army and joined the Infantry. I was medically discharged after completing infantry school, came back home and worked for about a year. My experience in the military was one that I will never forget. It gave me the skills to succeed in life and teach others to do the same. The military is responsible for the increase in my cultural awareness. It expanded my horizons, and taught me that I am stronger than I thought, and with a little will power, determination, and heart I can accomplish the goals I set out before me. After working for about a year after the military, I knew that I had to finish school to get where I want to be in my life. During my first semester back in school, I studied abroad for the summer in Mexico. Traveling to different orphanages, I saw the amount of unwanted children and I knew that my wife and I could provide a loving home for these kids. I am now in the process of completing my B.A in criminal justice.

There are so many kids out there in need of a home. During our research, we have found that many kids are passed over for specific needs that should not make them unadoptable. We have found that the amount of HIV positive children waiting for homes is catastrophically high. With the amount of strides that modern medicine has made in the HIV epidemic, it is possible for these kids to live normal lives with possibly minimal special medical care. We want to give a kid that is passed up due to the lack of knowledge on the HIV virus a life worth living.

We decided that we wouldn't talk about children for atleast 1 year after our wedding to allow us time to just be married. After our 1 year anniversary, we started the adoption talks and are starting to look into the process. International adoption is about $33,000 dollars, that is why we are asking for your help! Help us a give a child a loving home.

What We Need & What You Get

Your donation will help us with:

  • Agency fees
  • Legal fees
  • Medical expenses
  • International adoption expenses
  • Travel expenses

The Impact

Your contributions will help give one special child a safe, stable, forever home.

  • There are so many kids out there without families, help us make THEIR dreams a reality

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word about our fundraiser!

story:
*** Awaken Cafe in the Sunday San Francisco Chronicle: "Entrepreneurs Get Creative to Raise Funds" by Stacy Finz ***


***While you can begin using your perks as soon as the campaign is complete at our Espresso Cart, we'd love it if you could wait to redeem your perks until we open the full cafe, projected for February 1st.  That way we can keep your contribution working for us!***


The Full Cafe is Almost Complete

With the mission to bring people together and launch movements, Awaken Cafe is in the final push to open our new doors in downtown Oakland (Broadway @15th).


The new Awaken Cafe will be a green community hub, espresso bar (serving FOURBARREL Coffee), microbrew and wine bar, local and organic eatery, and event venue.  Our new beautifully designed space will have plenty of seating and be open all day 7 days a week.  It will be a place to meet, commune, and hatch ideas for Oakland's next movements.

While we're doing a chunk of the work ourselves, we have employed a dozen different East Bay contractors.  We're reusing tons of materials from the old cafe, purchasing green and reused whenever possible, and doing business with local companies.  We're keeping our costs low, while trying not to sacrifice quality and attention to detail.  


We'd Like Your Support

We wish we could invite you and the rest of our community to be investors and own a little piece of a local, independent business that will make a real difference in our community.  But we can't.  Business finance law prohibits us from selling equity to the public (change is on the horizon in the form of H.R. 2930 which just passed the House of Representatives), which is what brings us back to indiegogo for your support.


We've already raised the bulk of the capital needed to finance this project from a small circle of friends and family, and a smaller Indiegogo campaign earlier this year.  As the project nears completion, we are raising the final $10,000 through this campaign to find some interesting old furniture, installation of our reclaimed oak floors, concrete counter tops and other special details. 

We've got some great perks at several different levels of participation.  We invite you to join us in creating an amazing local economy in downtown Oakland.  Making a contribution will do more than help Awaken Cafe, it will help support the thriving local community of independent business and artists in downtown Oakland.

Thank you for your time and your attention.  We're honored to have your support.

A Few Other Ways You Can Help:  

(1) Donate to our perks.  Have a product or service you'd like to contribute to help us meet our goal, let us know.

(2)  Share on Facebook and Twitter.  We'd love it if you could share it a few times over the course of the campaign.

(3)  If you have or know of any hardwood tables, chairs, bar stools or fixtures with character that you think could work in the cafe, get in touch.

(4)  Same goes for any trade skills you think we might need in completing construction at on a cafe.


 This video was created and donated to this campaign by the rock-stars at French Press Films.


NOTE:  A few people who participated in our two other crowdfunding campaigns have not claimed their perks.  If you think that might be the case for you, please contact us and we'll get you squared away.

story:
Our Story

 We are Damola Rufai (a graduate from Howard Univerity's undergraduate architecture program) and Ebikiri Aboro (a graduate student of University of Pennsylvania's Software engineering program), together we hope to impact the way you discover and share content online. This idea was born from the noticeable rise in online sharing culture today.

  A lot of us love to share things that we deem cool or important but we also love to discover new things that add to our scope of the world. The thing about sharing in most of today's world though is that most of the content shared is usually curated from a single perspective, its one source generating content for a host of others;opposing that idea is what led us to this project. 

 Creating a way for shared content to become multifaceted, to comprise of more than one perspective, and for sharing to become more of a conversational exercise. A lot of thought went into how we could make that possible and finally the idea for amalgam surfaced. A free web app that would allow multiple users to create sharing hubs called amalgams. An amalgam is essentially a collection of posts gathered into a bundle. They can be created by a single user or multiple users (preferable and a lot more fun). Think of each one as a bag of m&m's or trail mix but for digital content. 

 This is not a blog aggregator though, its more specific and selective than that. In every amalgam is an interconnected network of users simultaneously sharing content in real-time with each other. Perhaps the greatest thing about amalgams is the fact that there's no telling how far each one can go because contributors to an amalgam have the ability to invite people that might find the posts relevant and those new people also have the opportunity to post content in the amalgam. This way there's almost always an element of surprise, you never know what you might learn or who you might meet in an amalgam. 

 There's also no limit to the amount of amalgams you can simultaneously participate in, no limit to how much you can discover and learn from so many different sources. We've so far been working on the GUI (which you can see samples of below and in our gallery) and back end development in Ruby on rails. We have a lot more to do but we are really enthusiastic about this idea and have the determination to see this through to the end



The Impact

 We want this app to be something that really enhances your online sharing/learning experience. We also hope that it makes the idea of sharing more social, fostering better interaction and even attaining a level where even groups of trusted educators, artists and news agencies can create amalgams that are open to the public to discover, share and participate in. 

 An environment where everything shared is a bit of everyone. The vision is to meet our goal and have this project done in the upcoming months after we are funded so that you all can see the result of your belief in us, if we are not able to reach our funding goal though we will use part of the money to develop what we can of the app and use the rest to make sure we deliver on all the perks promised to those that support us, the beta testing invite perks might take longer because we'd have to find another source of funding before we can get the application to beta but let's hope it doesn't come to that, we hope that you all are just as enthusiastic about this idea as we are and are stoked to see it come to life.


What We Need & What You Get

 To really get this project to work like we'd want it to work, it will require feedback from you guys, funding for marketing, and development of the project, right now it's two of us working on the GUI and coding of the app but eventually we will need more hands on deck and your funding will go a long way to help us achieve that. Part of the funding we recieve will also definitely be designated to perks for you guys. 

 Some of the perks we have for you include cool digital promotional material that can be used as posters, stickers or postcards, beta testing invites for you and your friends, getting credit on the website for being a supporter once its done. Since our project is about sharing we're also using this opportunity to share the work of an artist that we really admire, Nour Tohme (http://nourtohme.com/typolettering/draw-me-a-songtm/). Check out a sample below. Her artwork will be included in the perks available to higher tier supporters. If we're able to exceed our campaign goals we will definitely be dishing out more perks to you guys and we'll also implement more cool features into the app.



Other Ways You Can Help

 You can also help us get the word out to other people who might be interested in this project by tweeting, facebooking, and word of mouth. You can also follow us on twitter and like us on facebook. We appreciate every bit of help we can get from you and hope you'll be able to help us achieve the goals we have for this idea that we are strongly determined to complete.

 An environment where everything shared is a bit of everyone. The vision is to meet our goal and have this project done in the upcoming months after we are funded so that you all can see the result of your belief in us, if we are not able to reach our funding goal though we will use part of the money to develop what we can of the app and use the rest to make sure we deliver on all the perks promised to those that support us, the beta testing invite perks might take longer because we'd have to find another source of funding before we can get the application to beta but let's hope it doesn't come to that, we hope that you all are just as enthusiastic about this idea as we are and are stoked to see it come to life.


What We Need & What You Get
 To really get this project to work like we'd want it to work, it will require feedback from you guys, funding for marketing, and development of the project, right now it's two of us working on the GUI and coding of the app but eventually we will need more hands on deck and your funding will go a long way to help us achieve that. Part of the funding we recieve will also definitely be designated to perks for you guys. 
 Some of the perks we have for you include cool digital promotional material that can be used as posters, stickers or postcards, beta testing invites for you and your friends, getting credit on the website for being a supporter once its done. Since our project is about sharing we're also using this opportunity to share the work of an artist that we really admire, Nour Tohme (http://nourtohme.com/typolettering/draw-me-a-songtm/). Check out a sample below. Her artwork will be included in the perks available to higher tier supporters. If we're able to exceed our campaign goals we will definitely be dishing out more perks to you guys and we'll also implement more cool features into the app.



Other Ways You Can Help
 You can also help us get the word out to other people who might be interested in this project by tweeting, facebooking, and word of mouth. You can also follow us on twitter and like us on facebook. We appreciate every bit of help we can get from you and hope you'll be able to help us achieve the goals we have for this idea that we are strongly determined to complete.

story:
Awakening and Innovating our own Solutions in Greece
Support New Leaders and Innovators to Meet, Learn
and Take Action Together
hosted by the Living Wholeness Practice, SoL Greece & Synergy

On December 17, 2011, we brought together 30 Greeks of all ages and backgrounds to imagine the Greece we wish to create and leave to future generations. It was a powerful day of participatory conversation, collective visioning and practical, hands-on learning. Our next step is to widen the field of participation and the scope of our skills, create new actions, learn and practice collaborative leadership.  Your financial support will be a direct investment is bringing together citizens who care, innovators, new leaders to meet and collectively move from protest to enterprising to systemic change.

What is possible when we tap our collective resources - our energy, heritage, family and land-based wisdom, innovative ideas, modern technologies and ancient myths - to create a new participatory pathway towards a culture of governance and living in Greece that sustains both people and planet?
 
A Pivotal Moment
Greece, like the rest of the world is at a pivotal moment in history.  As a nation, we stand at a precarious edge, instigated by an economic crisis connected to a global financial system that we now know is not sustainable.

As our current systems rapidly disintegrate, and we witness increasing unemployment, poverty, suicide rates, and despair we also see local initiatives being sparked and new forms of active citizenship beginning to flourish. As a naturally enterprising people, Greeks hold a treasure chest of traditions, ideas and abilities that if awakened and catalysed, can pioneer a new sustainable future - not just for this country but for a changing Europe.

We believe we can re-frame â€œcrisisâ€ to potential, re-vitalize the values of democracy towards an new world that is aligned with deeply sustainable human and ecological values.
 
Katalysing Change
To "catalyse" in Greek means to move towards solutions.  As Greek citizens, we are already catalysing our own solutions in how we are responding daily to the massive challenges that are already present. However, these creative responses remain disparate and at this point, they lack coherence.  KATALYSIS is a systemic change process initiated by a group of us, committed Greeks and internationals who work with participatory methodologies, social innovation and arts. We believe that as local citizens and global citizens, we hold the key to a renewed Greece.

KATALYSIS aims to:
  1. Illuminate emerging ideas and catalyse new connections that lead to social innovation, enterprising and entrepreneurial activities and that support a generative spirit and vision in the country.  
  2. Create and host gatherings and spaces that move us collectively from the current paralysis, through despair, towards hope and into the belief that we can ourselves create new socio-economic thinking, values, practices and skills. 
  3. Invite people to remember, reclaim, re-imagine who we are and want to be for ourselves and as members of the world community.
 
Your financial support will be a direct investment in:
Supporting New Leaders and Innovators to Meet, Learn and Take Action
Together to transform the energy of collective protest to collective enterprising.

 We will do this by creating:

1.  An Art of Participatory Leadership Learning Event:
A 3-day training for up to 45 new innovators, active citizens, artists, business and community leaders and those ready to step up into new forms of leadership and innovation that are aligned with the Greek psyche and culture.

Funds will allow Greeks of all ages and income brackets to participate and learn with and create new realities with a field of innovators from movements here and in other parts of the world.
 
 2. A Collective Conversation in the Commons/ Agora event (Î‘Î³Î¿ÏÎ¬):
An art-based, conversational marketplace to bring together 200-300 people in a collective conversation for networking and connecting to see a bigger picture and inspiration for creating a collaborative future. And create a mapway for concrete next steps and our further actions.
 
These events will act as "doorways" for those who are searching for another way to participate and make a difference in their own futures, beyond protesting or dependence on current institutions.  These people are the "social transformers" who, when connected to one another, can scale up their initiatives and potential.

THANK YOU!!!


A Glimpse of the Bigger Picture of KATALYSIS (stay tuned!)

This initiative creates a long term systemic transformation initiative with key building blocks that will act on a viral basis. Those who participate, step up, learn new skills, practice them and transfer them to their contexts are the katalysers. We will begin in Athens with satellite locations in Rhodes and the Volos area and then spread throughout the country as people learn, practice and transfer their learning to their own communities, and other locations.
 
Our systemic transformation initiative will work on three levels:

1.     K (ÎšÎ±Î¹Î½Î¿Ï„Î¿Î¼Î¯Î±) Innovating , Enterprising & Research - Supporting new ideas into fruition, proto-typing and learning together; competition for new ideas that can then be scaled out.
 
2.     A (AÏ†ÏÏ€Î½Î¹ÏƒÎ·) Connecting and Imagining -  Agora Events which are large-scale multi-stakeholder gatherings and networking opportunities.
 
3.     T (Î¤Î­Ï‡Î½Î·) Inspiring and Learning - Leading-edge thinking and practices, trainings and workshops and the use of Arts for social change.
 
We will cross-pollinate the learning - On-line web-based, interactive conversational and other learning events and take this learning into Phase 2 of prototyping and scaling out the innovations and new ideas.

You are most welcome to contact us at: katalysis.greece@yahoo.gr  ~ Looking forward!

story:
Our Story

Capital CarShare (CCS) was developed by a small group of passionate, environmentally-conscious, upstate New Yorkers looking to bring shared mobility to the dense region of Albany. With CarShare, community members have easy access to vehicles for use by the hour or by the day. Our goal is to launch a fleet of neighborhood cars in June, but we need your help to #getthere. 

The Perks

Raising $20,000 will help us purchase a fleet of eco-friendly vehicles, fund our first advertising campaign, and hire staff members.

As a thank you we're giving away CCS swag, free trials, driving credits, and lifetime memberships!

Your contribution, no matter how great or small, will ensure that our members have access to fuel-efficient cars in their neighborhood at any time day or night. 

The Impact

Bringing CarShare to the Capital of NY will provide city residents with more efficient and accessible transportation options. 

80% of upstate NY carshare members have reserved a car for a trip to the grocery store. **

30% of upstate NY carshare members have used this service to get to a job interview. **

A fleet of 12 fuel-efficient vehicles will take approximately 87 private cars off the road and allow for less congestion in dense neighborhoods. **

**Statistics provided by Buffalo CarShare

Sharing is Caring

Not able to contribute? No biggie! Serve as a CCS ambassador and share this campaign with all your friends.

Live in the Capital Region? Stop by our office at 176 Central Avenue, Albany, NY to find out how you can become a volunteer.

story:
Hi, I'm Pat Neleski and I want to improve my crummy website so I can help US Navy, Coast Guard, Merchant Marine and NOAA sailors and Marines get better curtains to get better sleep at sea. 

Ten years ago, I made a curtain for my husband to use when he was at sea on a submarine. As you can see from the sample above, the light just streamed through his Navy issue curtain. 

Since then, my little company has made and sold our flame retardant blackout storage curtains all over the Navy and Coast Guard. 

We've outfitted 22 Coast Guard cutters, 15 submarines, two destroyers, two NOAA ships, one Military Sealift Command and whole berthing areas in larger ships. 

We hire our seamstresses from the Navy Fleet and Family Employment Assistance Program, and our product is US made.

For the past 8 years, NavyRackPacks has stayed at the top of the Google listings, but customers often call or email me saying the website is pretty confusing. 

Here's where you can help. First, I need suggestions.... lots of them. Be brutal. The sailors deserve it. You can leave your suggestions in the comments section above.

Then, I could use a little financial help to hire someone to help me with the website. It doesn't have to be fancy, so I am not asking for a lot of money. It just needs to be better. 

If you could donate one idea and one dollar to our cause, I would love to include you on our list of special advisors. If you could donate five ideas, and five dollars, I'd love to send you a sticker with NavyRackPacks on it. We'd like to give you a tour of NavyRackPacks for $50 or a day in St. Marys and lunch for $100. Help us out, please!!!!!!

story:
Who we are

Hi! We are Valley Verde, a small non-profit in San Jose, CA with a big vision: We believe that with daily access to homegrown vegetables, people can enjoy a healthier lifestyle and help their community become more sustainable.

We teach families how to grow and maintain their own organic vegetable gardens so they can have access to affordable, fresh, and healthy food. Since 2012, we have trained 143 gardeners to grow their own organic food. 

Why the Super Jardineros Project?

We want to make an even bigger impact on our community! The majority of our gardening families work in low paying jobs that offer little opportunity for economic advancement. Through Super Jardineros, our families will have the opportunity to own a home greenhouse micro business and supply the South Bay population with organic and culturally relevant seedlings.

Who are the Super Jardineros?

The Super Jardineros will be home greenhouse micro-business owners who will grow multi-ethnic, organic vegetable seedlings, such as okra, chayote, bitter melon, finger eggplant, tomatillos, etc.

Valley Verde will support our Super Jardineros by providing greenhouse supplies and training to operate backyard nurseries so they can grow high-quality, organic seedlings for retail sale.

How it works:

1. We install home greenhouses in low income households

2. We train gardeners to grow varieties of ethnic seedlings such as chayote, bitter melon, finger eggplant, tomatillos, etc.

3. They grow their seedlings and sell them to us for retail sale.

4. We sell the seedlings at local farmer's markets, seedling sales, or stores.

Benefits to low income families:

  • Provides sustainable income

  • Teaches entrepreneurial skills

  • Promotes seed and food independence

  • Increases food access

Benefits to Santa Clara County residents:

  • Fills an unmet need for residents who want to buy organic ethnic vegetable seedlings for their garden

  • Increases food diversity

The Super Jardineros project is the only one of its kind challenging inequities in wealth and food distribution through the empowerment of working-class families by combining agriculture, education, business, and cultural food connection.

Our goal is to raise $10,000 to start this project

Every contribution counts!

We need funding to provide 10 families with green houses, seeds, seedlings, trays, pots, domes, heating mats, and training.

Other ways you can help:

Share this by using the links near the top

To read more about this campaign, visit our website at valleyverde.org

Perks!

story:
In desperate need of a car!

Being that my old boss kept 3 of my Paychecks when the company went broke, i ended up with a negative remark on my Credit because i couldnt pay certain bills due to the missing income. By now everything is paid off. My credit wont get cleared until Jan 2015 ( thats how it works in Germany). To make matters worse, my car just broke down and isnt worth fixing anymore. I just got promoted at work and now have no way of getting there. I currently work for the US ARMY thats stationed in Germany. Im full time and permanent. Unfortionatly i have to make a 70km drive daily to get to work and back. So im screwed without a car.

Im asking for you guys help because i desperately need it. I know this is a different type of project than this page usually does, but i dont know where else to look for help.


Im an ex Graphic designer and in return for your donations i can help you out with flyers, cd covers, Logos, business cards, etc.


Heute ein etwas anderes Projekt!

Da mein alter Arbeitgeber damals 3 meiner Loehne einbehielt ( er ging pleite) bin ich damals in die Schufa geraten weil ich meine Rechnungen nicht mehr bezahlen konnte. Mittlerweile ist alles abbezahlt, und wird zum Januar aus der Schufa geloescht. Gerade jetzt hat mein Auto den Geist aufgegeben. Und das gerade jetzt, wo ich gerade in meinem Job aufgestiegen bin. Angestellt bin ich Vollzeit und Unbefristet bei den US Streitkraeften in Deutschland. Leider muss ich dazu aber einen Arbeitsweg von 70km taeglich zuruecklegen. Ohne Auto bin ich nun aufgeschmissen.

Ich bitte um eure Hilfe, da ich nicht weiss was ich sonst noch tun kann. Die Bank gibt mir dank SChufa keinen Kredit, und Auxmoney ist fuer mich keine Option! Ich bitte euch, einer zuverlaessigen 27 jaehrigen auszuhelfen!

story:
Bio

My name is Patrick Nicolas , I'm a young canadian studying at UQAM University in accounting ( not really what i wanted but for my dad that was the only program for me). I'm living in the most beautiful and culturally diverse and hospitable city in the world  (need to think twice before getting a serious relationship ;-) ) 

History 

I was searching for a product in the summer of 2012 and it was impossible to find it anywhere. I asked a few people and it was hard for my surroundings to answer me . I told myself  "I know there is someone out there who's selling this product and he knows there are people looking to buy it too but there is one thing missing and its the "connection " . From that moment, I decided to built a Classified adds Website TAGTROC based on a social network platform completely free. I would like to give people the opportunity to exchange goods and services among themselves for free . 

Tagtroc philosophy is simplicity and the priority of images . 

TagTroc is a complete and practical social network, characterized by a spirit of collaboration and business acumen. Easy to use, this dynamic forum for discussion provides an opportunity for each member to create a network of contacts throughout North America which is absolutely free.


Reviews / Feedbacks

The positive feedbacks that I have received for the project encourages me to forward with confidence. People in general, really like the concept and approach . 


Financing

TAGTROC was launched in June 12,  2014  in beta version . I have invested  all my savings in the project because I strongly believe in it, and I want to create a better economic community, city and State . I want to give people another opportunity before going right to the store or shop to satisfy their needs. 

Sometimes I wonder and ask myself Is the project worth the try? I will challenge the big names like (Craiglists , Backapge , Kijiji and more) It's gonna be David against Goliath . What if I fail!! But I remember that David won his battle and with all these positive feedbacks, I decided "you know what, let's go". Now we are at the most difficult stage of the project "Promotion" It's hard to promote a project without money but it's not the only solution. 

There are 4 ways to help us realize the project:

1.- We are inviting you to sign up and tell your friends, family to subscribe to your profile and share the page to promote TAGTROC. (worth more than money)

2.- Like our Facebook page , invite your friends to like and share it (worth more than money)

3.- Give us advice and suggestion to improve the Platform. (worth more than money)

4.- Give us any amount to promote it ( I personally prefer  1 , 2 & 3 ;-) ) but feel free to take option 4 . 

Why this amount of money ?

The cost associated with a site like this goes well beyond the amount of money required to make it successful. Money will be used for the following: promoting the TAGTROC platform around the US & Canada , servers fees , development of applications, Social Media promotions,  recruitment of talented web developers, office space , marketing promotion ect. 

Other ways to help .

If you have other options to support the project, feel free to contact us . We will appreciate any kind of help you can bring us. 


We welcome all support. Send us a private message on TAGTROC profile or Email us at info@tagtroc.com

Why others who tried, failed?

There are many other small adds sites online and none of them have managed to shake up the big names. Why? The reason is simple, they do not come with a product that is innovative and different. They all try to resemble each other instead of standing out from their competitors. We are doing something completely different 

Impact

We do not want to generate a regional or provincial recession because people will buy less from the big companies and will think TAGTROC first. Ok , I'm kidding may be not so harsh as a recession, but we want to have a strong impact on every daily  life (environmental, ecological, recycling ). 

We are offering a better Website than all others out there. Our first goal is to allow people to exchange their goods and services. 

So people let's spread the word and advertise TAGTROC. You need to be a part of the project . Hurry up and sign up to start sharing and posting any great product you have home !

If you like the project, do not hesitate to show your appreciation by giving us any amount of money or better yet, work with us to improve the Website. Thanks for taking the time to get acquainted with us. I look forward to hearing from many of you. 

Sincerely,

Thank You 

***Don't forget Indiegogo sharing tools
story_txt:
Bio
My name is Patrick Nicolas , I'm a young canadian studying at UQAM University in accounting ( not really what i wanted but for my dad that was the only program for me). I'm living in the most beautiful and culturally diverse and hospitable city in the world  (need to think twice before getting a serious relationship ;-) ) 

History 

I was searching for a product in the summer of 2012 and it was impossible to find it anywhere. I asked a few people and it was hard for my surroundings to answer me . I told myself  "I know there is someone out there who's selling this product and he knows there are people looking to buy it too but there is one thing missing and its the "connection " . From that moment, I decided to built a Classified adds Website TAGTROC based on a social network platform completely free. I would like to give people the opportunity to exchange goods and services among themselves for free . 

Tagtroc philosophy is simplicity and the priority of images . 


TagTroc is
a complete and practical social network, characterized by a spirit of
collaboration and business acumen. Easy to use, this dynamic forum for
discussion provides an opportunity for each member to create a network of
contacts throughout North America which is absolutely free. 





Reviews / Feedbacks
The positive feedbacks that I have received for the project encourages me to forward with confidence. People in general, really like the concept and approach . 
Financing
TAGTROC was launched in June 12,  2014  in beta version . I have invested  all my savings in the project because I strongly believe in it, and I want to create a better economic community, city and State . I want to give people another opportunity before going right to the store or shop to satisfy their needs. 


Sometimes I wonder and ask myself Is the project worth the try? I will challenge the big names like (Craiglists , Backapge , Kijiji and more) It's gonna be David against Goliath . What if I fail!! But I remember that David won his battle and with all these positive feedbacks, I decided "you know what, let's go". Now we are at the most difficult stage of the project "Promotion" It's hard to promote a project without money but it's not the only solution. 


There are 4 ways to help us realize the project:

1.- We are inviting you to sign up and tell your friends, family to subscribe to your profile and share the page to promote TAGTROC. (worth more than money)

2.- Like our Facebook page , invite your friends to like and share it (worth more than money)


3.- Give us advice and suggestion to improve the Platform. (worth more than money)


4.- Give us any amount to promote it ( I personally prefer  1 , 2 & 3 ;-) ) but feel free to take option 4 . 

Why this amount of money ?
The cost associated with a site like this goes well beyond the amount of money required to make it successful. Money will be used for the following: promoting the TAGTROC platform around the US & Canada , servers fees , development of applications, Social Media promotions,  recruitment of talented web developers, office space , marketing promotion ect. 


Other ways to help .
If you have other options to support the project, feel free to contact us . We will appreciate any kind of help you can bring us. 


We welcome all support. Send us a private message on TAGTROC profile or Email us at info@tagtroc.com

Why others who tried, failed?
There
 are many other small adds sites  online and none of them have managed 
to shake up the big names. Why? The reason is simple, they do not come 
with a  product that is innovative and different. They all try to 
resemble each other instead of standing out from their competitors. We are doing something completely different 


Impact
We do not want to generate a regional or provincial recession because people will buy less from the big companies and will think TAGTROC first. Ok , I'm kidding may be not so harsh as a recession, but we want to have a strong impact on every daily  life (environmental, ecological, recycling ). 

We are offering a better Website than all others out there. Our first goal is to allow people to exchange their goods and services. 

So people let's spread the word and advertise TAGTROC. You need to be a part of the project . Hurry up and sign up to start sharing and posting any great product you have home !


If you like the project, do not hesitate to show your appreciation by giving us any amount of money or better yet, work with us to improve the Website. Thanks for taking the time to get acquainted with us. I look forward to hearing from many of you. 

Sincerely,Thank You ***Don't forget Indiegogo sharing tools

story:
Short Summary

In the year of Katrina and Rita (2005) I was studying in Bunkie High School, LA as a foreign exchange student, commonly known there as a "Naked Slovakian"  - many of my friends remember that party :D. During this year I ate GUMBO uncountable times and I loved it.

I really do like cooking, especially during examinations. After a sentimental recalls about my time in LA, I decided to prepare my own gumbo. The first one was made last year and everybody loved it, my family, friends even my little "vegetarian" sister. 

As a university student in Czech republic, I found a brother, very extensive partymaker Tom, who tasted gumbo couple of months ago and we together decided to spread the lyricism and excellence across the globe. 

After couple of non-sober brianstorms, we had decided to start with Indiegogo. Join us in our gumbo-style party community and help us reach our goals!   

What We Need & What You Get

Since the main component of gumbo is variety of meat. We start with chicken, pork and shrimps, and after reaching goals we add another kinds of meat.

There are couple of goals we set:

  • $50   we cook THE gumbo and post photos on you website and throw a party in Brno, Czech Republic
  • $60 - we add turkey
  • $80 - we add salmon
  • $100 - we add antelope
  • $120 - we add ostrich
  • $140 - we add wild boar
  • $160 - we add deer
  • $180 - we add zebra
  • $200 - we add pheasant
  • $220 - we add lama
  • $300 - we add crocodile 
  • $500 - we cook THE gumbo and throw a party in three different cities, Praha, Brno and Bratislava
  • $3500 - we cook THE gumbo and throw a huge party in Bunkie, Louisiana and the whole gumbo-style community will be invited 
  • $5000 - we cook THE gumbo in Bunkie, LA and other place in US (not decided yet - we will let the community decide) and the whole gumbo-style community will be invited
  • $???? - we open a GUMBO-STYLE party bistro 

    The Impact

    The impact of this project is obvious, to spread our experience with GUMBO around the world and also to party and have fun!

      Risks & Challenges

      Risks of the project are gluttony, alcohol overdose and the mess. But, since I am an ex-med student, who has passed the first-aid course, Tom is a pretty good cleaner :D, and both of us are heavy eaters and professional drinkers with a lot of practical experience, these facts will lower the risk to a minimum. 

        Other Ways You Can Help

        If you do not wish to contribute, you can join our GUMBO-STYLE community on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/slavicgumbo and share the project further. We will be also very thankful!

story:
The Last Straw Revival

My name is Jeff Ruppert and I am the publisher and editor of The Last Straw, The International Quarterly Journal of Straw Bale and Natural Building, or TLS for short. 

TLS is a rich and lively forum covering all things that are related to creating buildings with natural materials, such as straw and earth.  We have been out of print for a few years and are reviving ourselves under new ownership.  To get going we need help with a few up-front costs, including re-building our website, updating the graphics and re-formatting the magazine layout for a refreshed look and feel.  Our goal with the revival of TLS is to bring it into the digital age while maintaining the integrity and richness that we have been known for.  The next issue is due out at the end of February, which means our need to fund the tasks to revive the Journal are upon us.

TLS is and will remain reader-supported, meaning that our content is supplied primarily by professionals in the construction trades and owners of the greenest buildings in the world.  This is critical in this day and age of corporate-driven choices in the construction industry.  TLS represents the best response to what is best known as an industry dominated by a few mainstream materials and highly impactful systems on our environment.

By assisting us in our revival you will be contributing to the growth of the true "green building" industry.  We are beholden to no one, meaning we do not have big financial backing and therefore we cannot do this on subscription fees alone.  Once we are up and running with a few issues behind us and a new track record, we expect our advertising base to increase and the use of our website and other forms of media to take off.  You can find us at The Last Straw website.

Our Campaign

This campaign will raise funds to specifically cover the following:

  • Website redesign, relaunch and maintenance since August of 2013. 
  • Refreshed graphics for use on the website and in the publication.
  • Editorial costs for the first couple issues.
  • Initial layout costs for the first issue (template creation and editing)
  • Initial accounting and legal services
  • Initial office expenses

If we do not reach our goal we will still use the money and couple it with other planned fund-raising campaigns. 

As a token of thanks for your support we have a few items to offer as gifts.  Most notable we have one copy of Build it With Bales (version 2) in pristine condition signed by Matts Myhrman and Steve McDonald.  This collectors item will go to the first person who makes a $200 donation.

We are also offering various issues, subscription and tote bags as a thank you for your generous support.  We hope there is something that suits everyone.


The Power of the Bale

Straw bale construction has made a name for itself by being a very tactile and accessible building technology.  It represents the best of natural building and is an ambassador inspiring imaginations that result in the most creative, beautiful structures in the world. 

By reviving TLS, the progress of natural building will continue to be documented unlike anywhere else.  There are no other print publications with the breadth and depth of the natural building world.  There are many websites run by individuals working in the industry, but you'll find no other outlet with both print and digital options on such a wide range of topics.

The team at TLS remains the same with the exception of myself.  I have a background as an engineer and builder of natural buildings, and have written articles for numerous publications on various topics.  I am supported by the same group of people who have been with TLS all along and who know how to put this publication together.

We simply ask for you trust and support to keep this invaluable asset to our community alive, well and refreshed.

Show Your Support

If you can't make a donation, please make sure your network of friends and associates knows about us.  Use the share tools here at Indiegogo to get the word out.  As we pointed out above, we couldn't do this without this extra level of support. 

Thank you for your support and we look forward to seeing all of you on a project!

Sincerely,

Jeff Ruppert
Editor

story:
THE DTES STREET MARKET

The DTES Street Market takes place at Pigeon Park every Sunday from 11am to 5pm. It is a volunteer run non-profit enterprise that started as a protest against the vending tickets being handed out in the DTES (Downtown Eastside of Vancouver) by the Vancouver Police. 

The market provides free vending space for the most marginalized and impoverished groups. One third of our vendors are women, many current or former sex trade workers, one half are native, a significant minority are from the Chinese retirement community, and many are either homeless or under-housed in the infamous nearby SROs (Single Room Occupancy Hotels).

Over the course of a year, on Sundays only, the market provides over $500,000 of direct economic injection into this low income population by merely providing a free place for them to sell their binned items. We also estimate that over 20 tonnes of waste is removed from landfills by the recycling efforts of Vancouver's industrious binners. 

What We Are Asking for

We want to expand the market to more days per week at our new location at 62 East Hastings. The City of Vancouver has provided us with a lot, but no additional funding to run a market there. 

We estimate that it will cost an additional $700 per day to run the market at 62 East Hastings. This will provide a minimal stipend for the volunteers to work at the market, picking up trash, registering vendors and setting up the tents and tables. It will also pay for portable bathrooms for the site, as well as garbage pickup. 

Here is a detailed breakdown of our estimated expenses:

62 East Hastings $693.90
weekly
Coordinators $210.00
RPICs $189.00
Marshalls $49.00
Tent Crew $40.00
Sandwiches + Coffee $40.00
Garbage $45.45
Bathrooms $120.45

The Impact

This budget of $693.90 would pay for one day of operation per week. We would like to go for 3 days per week for a trial period of six months. This takes us to $18,000 total cost ($693.90 X 4.33 X 6).

Thank you for Supporting the Street Market

If you are in Vancouver on a Sunday, please stop by the corner of Carrall St., and Hastings St., and visit Pigeon Park to find a deal and help out the local vendors.

story:
Short Summary

Hello all, and thanks for clicking on this project, The Soup Crew USA!!!  

My name is Cordell McGary II, and I am the owner of Eating Well with Chef Cordell (www.chefcordell.com).  For the past 5+ years, my company has focused on accentuating healthy eating via community cooking classes and demonstrations, Personal Chef service, public speaking (and the like) around the country.  Personally, I have always been a passionate advocate for FRESH food access for all neighborhoods, but more specifically food deserts, which are defined as urban neighborhoods and rural towns without ready access to fresh, healthy, and affordable food. 

The Soup Crew USA, a group comprised mostly of volunteers, is on a mission to disseminate at least 10,000 HOT SOUPS across Chicago through the winter months, starting in January.  Whether or not you’re a Chicago native, I'm sure that you know that it gets veeeery COLD here during the winter; hence our moniker "The Windy City".  During this frigid season, our streets are covered with people who are homeless, hungry and in need of a number of basic necessities that you and I are accustomed to having in place.  Regardless of financial, social or class "status", NO ONE should have to go hungry or be cold; we are all in this race together: the HUMAN race. "Giving" and "being of service to others" is at the core of The Soup Crew USA, and we want to START to play our part by providing HOT SOUPS twice per week, at 4 locations across Chicago, throughout the winter months.  In order to reach this goal, WE NEED YOUR HELP!!!  

Your donations to this mission will help feed and warm 10,000 residents of "The Windy City" who are in desperate need of sustenance, hope, warmth and the feeling of someone caring about their well-being.  In my travels I've seen wonderful transformations of people's hearts, minds and life directions by acts of kindness from others.  It's probably warm in your car, office and home right now, but it's cooooooooold on these streets.  Help us help someone stay warm today; it may do the same for your heart too.

What We Need & What You Get

We are in need of $18,000, which will cover expenses including:

  • Food 
  • Kitchen rental
  • Equipment
  • Transportation
  • Labor (minimal, but for the cooks)
  • Marketing materials

IF WE DON'T REACH OUR GOAL, we will still feed as many as we can with what we have available to us.  IF WE GO BEYOND OUR GOAL, we will pay the volunteers a stipend for their time.

In return, you will receive one of the wonderful perks listed here =====>

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean that you can’t help.  We'd appreciate it if you could:

  • Get the word out (social media, your office, etc.) and make some noise about The Soup Crew USA's campaign!!
  • You can also use the Indiegogo share tools!

#TheSoupCrewUSA

story:
Short Summary

My name is Tom Dickinson and I am on the Autism Spectrum.  I am also a Culinary School Graduate, A Professional Chef, and Two Time Cookbook Author, The Contributing Chef to Autism Today TV, and the Chef Instructor at Aim Higher Incorporated in California.  And to put it bluntly, I need your help. 

Being a self advocate for Autism I have advocated for adults on the spectrum and all adults with special needs to learn how to cook fresh meals for themselves and not rely on fast food, frozen dinners, and processed junk because I believe that anyone can cook a simple delicious meal for themselves and my campaign is to be able to reach as many special needs adults and kids as I can and that's why I need you. 

What I want to do is to be able to offer cooking classes for special needs adults at a minimal cost to them.  And with your help we can do that.  Imagine the potential of people cooking for themselves and believing in themselves not just in cooking, but in all aspects of life as well.   

With your help, we can change lives.  We can make a difference in the life of someone instead of relying on microwave burritos from a frozen package, they can cook in their kitchen independently and live a healthy life full of confidence, independence, and quality food. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • To get this going and to do it right, we need $200,000.  Why so much, first and foremost, we need a reliable vehicle to be able to go on location to different areas to set up cooking classes for special needs adults.  We need cooking supplies and portable burners that they can cook on.  We need knife kits so these students can learn proper knife skills and safety in the kitchen.  We want every student to be able to wear a chef outfit so they can feel inspired and excited to cook.  And also, we need to be able to purchase good food product so they can learn how to make great meals for themselves. 
  • I'll be honest with you.  I don't have a lot to give in return except for this.  If you choose to contribute to this campaign, the greatest perk that you will ever receive is knowing that you have changed a life.  You've helped someone learn how to take care of themselves.  You have become a part of the journey to build confidence, increase independence, and improve quality of life. 
  • If my chance we don't reach our goal, that's okay, because the money will still go to reach out to special needs adults and help them to learn how to be great home cooks, no matter how much money is raised. 

The Impact

What this all means in a nutshell is this.  By helping to raise money for this campaign, with our help we are going to change the way that people look at adults with special needs.  It's going to change their life into thinking that all they can do is play on the computer and that's it.  It's going to make them healthier, happier, and they are going to be able to take care of themselves.  And I know some are thinking "He just wants a new car.  It was first on the need list."  No!  That's not it.  Right now my wife and I are carrying around cooking supplies in an old 98 Saturn to different sites to teach people how to cook and we are willing to do that.  But this isn't about me.  This is about the betterment of people's lives.  Whether it be someone with Autism, Down's Syndrome, or whatever.  This isn't about making them into chefs, this is about teaching life skills and creating something awesome.  Thank you. 

Other Ways You Can Help

And if you guys can't contribute money right now, that's okay.  But please, do share this campaign with others so they can be a part of something awesome to build up the lives of hundreds, and potentially thousands of special needs adults who want to learn how to take care of themselves so please share and thank you.

Short Summary
My name is Tom Dickinson and I am on the Autism Spectrum.  I am also a Culinary School Graduate, A Professional Chef, and Two Time Cookbook Author, The Contributing Chef to Autism Today TV, and the Chef Instructor at Aim Higher Incorporated in California.  And to put it bluntly, I need your help.  
Being a self advocate for Autism I have advocated for adults on the spectrum and all adults with special needs to learn how to cook fresh meals for themselves and not rely on fast food, frozen dinners, and processed junk because I believe that anyone can cook a simple delicious meal for themselves and my campaign is to be able to reach as many special needs adults and kids as I can and that's why I need you. 
What I want to do is to be able to offer cooking classes for special needs adults at a minimal cost to them.  And with your help we can do that.  Imagine the potential of people cooking for themselves and believing in themselves not just in cooking, but in all aspects of life as well.   
With your help, we can change lives.  We can make a difference in the life of someone instead of relying on microwave burritos from a frozen package, they can cook in their kitchen independently and live a healthy life full of confidence, independence, and quality food.  
 


What We Need & What You Get
 

To get this going and to do it right, we need $200,000.  Why so much, first and foremost, we need a reliable vehicle to be able to go on location to different areas to set up cooking classes for special needs adults.  We need cooking supplies and portable burners that they can cook on.  We need knife kits so these students can learn proper knife skills and safety in the kitchen.  We want every student to be able to wear a chef outfit so they can feel inspired and excited to cook.  And also, we need to be able to purchase good food product so they can learn how to make great meals for themselves.  
I'll be honest with you.  I don't have a lot to give in return except for this.  If you choose to contribute to this campaign, the greatest perk that you will ever receive is knowing that you have changed a life.  You've helped someone learn how to take care of themselves.  You have become a part of the journey to build confidence, increase independence, and improve quality of life.  
If my chance we don't reach our goal, that's okay, because the money will still go to reach out to special needs adults and help them to learn how to be great home cooks, no matter how much money is raised.  



The Impact
What this all means in a nutshell is this.  By helping to raise money for this campaign, with our help we are going to change the way that people look at adults with special needs.  It's going to change their life into thinking that all they can do is play on the computer and that's it.  It's going to make them healthier, happier, and they are going to be able to take care of themselves.  And I know some are thinking "He just wants a new car.  It was first on the need list."  No!  That's not it.  Right now my wife and I are carrying around cooking supplies in an old 98 Saturn to different sites to teach people how to cook and we are willing to do that.  But this isn't about me.  This is about the betterment of people's lives.  Whether it be someone with Autism, Down's Syndrome, or whatever.  This isn't about making them into chefs, this is about teaching life skills and creating something awesome.  Thank you.  


Other Ways You Can Help
And if you guys can't contribute money right now, that's okay.  But please, do share this campaign with others so they can be a part of something awesome to build up the lives of hundreds, and potentially thousands of special needs adults who want to learn how to take care of themselves so please share and thank you.

story:
Wayne Bowles - R.I.P.

Wayne Bowles a.k.a. 'Dad' a.k.a. 'Lil Wayne' a.k.a. 'Canadianwayne' a.k.a. 'Bowlsey'

Wayne Bowles, a father, a step-father, a husband, a business owner and a comedian.  He is survived by 4 children and his loving and supportive wife, Cassie.   Wayne was a great guy, a sometimes comically passionate and animated individual who would have done anything for anyone.  A genuine good guy.  He will be dearly missed. 

Wayne was an aspiring comedian at Comedy Quarry in Windsor, Ontario and was also an avid Youtuber.  Wayne ran a one man operation driving drunk people home safely with their vehicles called Soberide.  As a one man operation, his passing will leave great financial burden on his wife and children. 

 We are asking that our network of friends and colleagues who see this page please donate what they can to help out.  All monies minus a small fee to this online provider will go directly to the family.
